Reviews.Title: “good location for budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: cksu
Reviews.Content: we have stay 5 nights in this small budget 3 star hotel with a small kids found this property is vey suitable for the first time solo with small budget..easily 5 minutes short walkaway to mtr jordan will bring u to most of the hot attraction tourisme spot like central, causewaybay,tst,mongkok, disney and so on.... Service in the front desk is no smiles at all but no rude too, mayb they are so boring on the jobs already but this is not so important for us as we are looking for hotel location, but if they can improve the service its mayb their add plus points.. If u have more budget can try kowloon park view as can seen the hk residents sport everyday in the morning but we choose city vista also not bad the view compare with the last few visits we have stay in the good location metropark prince edward but poor view Overall the hotel location is good, but if u expect more can try for othe higher price hotel like langham, etc.. I highly recommend to solo traveller but for those looking for more confortable they are still some choices for u

Reviews.Title: “Small room, good breakfast and unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ROCKYPRO
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 days, we checked late in the evening. The guys at the front desk were non accommodating and unfriendly. We asked for non smoking floor gave us smoking floor. The rooms were small. I was with my wife and infant son. Difficulty in keeping luggage and moving at same time in room. Although it is located on Austin road, ideally close to Nathan and Canton road ( shopping streets )Close to both Jordan & Austin metro. Next to Kowloon park. This connectivity is helpful in moving in HK. Only silver lining was elaborate breakfast. I will recommend this hotel to single or couple travellers. There are couple of hotels close by which is recommended for family like holiday inn, pacific , Novotel ....

Reviews.Title: “Superb efficiency and great service attitude”
Reviews.Author: Valeriemei
Reviews.Content: I m still here in BPI and just need to comment that the service attitude over here is beyond my expectation. Well done guys! Just checked in last night at 7pm and went out immediately for shopping and dining. When we came back to our room, we had a problem with some cleanliness in e room. Don't get me wrong, the room is neat and clean. I m just tad fussy so I left it to the morning to feedback to the hotel duty manager, Thomas and within half an hour, he personally picked up my luggages, changed my room and upgraded us on top of apologizing profusely for my inconvenience. He even offered us a late check out after learning that our flight tomorrow is late at night. This great service attitude is something that I do not get for most of the hotels i stayed in. The housekeeping managers even sent us a fruit plate and make sure everything is alright. B P international, u guys did a great job. Thank you so much to Thomas and his colleagues for making my stay so pleasant here. I will be back and would recommend your hotel to my friends from Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: GrahamGallagher
Reviews.Content: I booked a garden view and never received it, over a period of 4 days the reception desk staff used the " do not understand English" excuse not to address the issue. But I HAD paid for this view and had an awful view of Kowloon back streets. Small room, limited facilities, 1 lift not working. Requested non smoking, but previous occupants smoked, cigarette packets still in the bin!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, large room, but infrastructure not good”
Reviews.Author: ryantheleo
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect, very close to ICC and Jordon Metro Station. Room is comparatively larger than most other HK hotels with even higher price point. Price is quite reasonable, especially with advance booking. Service is also good. However, their elevators are just not enough. I waited for 15 mins in the morning, and finally first took the elevator up to the top then came down. This is really a waste of time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: polyesterNewZealand
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times over the last 5 years and will continue to do so. Best value in this location. a few minutes walk to Temple St Market, and the MTR, and about HKG30 from the Airport Express Terminal. Rooms are small but adequate, every room I have had during this time has been the same size, staff very friendly. Great view over the harbour and Kowloon Park. Adjacent to the lifts is a screen showing all departure flights fiom HKG airport, great to check if your flight is on time. Plenty of small supermarkets close by.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ALTRobinson
Reviews.Content: We got the room with a window facing the Kowloon park and it was so lovely to look at! At night you could see all the lights from the nearby buildings in Tsim Sha Tsui..and at dawn, the joggers are already there. Our room was not that big enough but it has the amenities we expected like the complimentary slippers, ballpens & notepads on the bedside table, hairdryer by the window and of course the usual other amenities. The staff were also very polite & friendly, except for the little language barrier where we asked for salt through the front desk & minutes later, someone knocked at our door & we were given 2 Soaps! Hahaha The hotel has a very spacious lobby with i think, 3 entrances. Right across the street is a 7-eleven store where we were able buy something to munch and Cafe de Coral where we had our breakfast. The hotel is situated in a location wherein you can just walk the shops. We even walked to the ferry terminal going to Macau. We took a taxi from Mongkok and cost us HK$27, compared to how far we hiked in taking the MTR down the austin road, it was just worth it! Our stay was definitely one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotel with a great view”
Reviews.Author: ALFREDC22
Reviews.Content: The view from my room (25th Floor), facing the Harbor, was really an excellent one! I enjoyed it so much that I even invited my friends who were in HK at the same time I was (and staying around Jordan) to pop in at night to share in the sights. The lights from the buildings over at HK island, from The Peak, parts of the harbor, as well as the view overlooking Kowloon Park were really something I enjoyed tremendously. BP is located just beside Austin Station, which is along the MTR to Coliseum, Hung Hom, so it would be pretty convenient if you were coming back from a concert there I think. It is also just next to Harbor City and China HK City (for shopping and Ferry to or from Macau). BP is also located sort of midway between TST and Mongkok so it is pretty convenient if you wanted to walk either direction. Lots of small eateries and fashion shops nearby. Internet access was not complimentary for my hotel package. TV was old and channels were limited. Due to limited rooms, I, a single traveller, was given twin-beds of which I could of course only sleep on one for the night. I wished I could have been given a double bed. Overall not too bad an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeffsey500
Reviews.Content: It was a nice place to stay. Check in was acceptable. I wanted a double bed, but they only had two singles. Seems like they don't have very many rooms with double beds to begin with so you really have to check with them to make sure you get it. They apologized and upgraded me to a sea view room instead. The room was nice. Bathrooms very clean. Would have hoped for a bathtub but those are quite rare in Hong Kong. The room had what seems like taller ceilings. The sea view also faces the park behind the hotel instead of the road in front. That said, not much of a see view left with so many taller buildings in the way. Bed was a touch hard, but that's pretty typical of Asia. The AC is powerful enough but it turns off when you take your keycard out of the slot. Ripping the cardboard sleeve they give you for the keycards and stuff it into the slot does keep it running. Room has a basic safe, but its bolted to a cabinet, not the wall (sorta iffy). The elevators are awful. Simply awful. They were working on them during my stay so they had 3 instead of 4 running (one of which ran on it's own with separate buttons). Normally, it should be fine, but the elevator controller is pretty idiotic. Hopefully it'll improve once the work is done. Oh and the 25th doesn't have elevator service, you walk a flight of stairs from 24. The crummy elevators is really the only thing keeping me from giving this hotel a 5 star rating. Location is good. Close to MTR Jordan Station and Austin Station. There are busses on the main road, but don't bother, the MTR is usually much quicker. There is a shuttle bus to the Airport Express at the side of the building. The Airport Express was much faster and cheaper than taking any of the hotel shuttle services.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RtnRajiv
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel. Centrally located. Was very convinient to go here and there which we kept doing. Rooms are good though on the smaller side.Lots and lots of tourists.Found a little difficult in communicating in English.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Alfonso S
Reviews.Content: Our first family trip to Hongkong was made worthwhile with the excellent location of the hotel. Every public transport is easily available and every shopping place from bargain shops to high end signature shops were just a few minutes walk. If you are just looking for a place to sleep after going aroubd Hongkong or a place with a central location, then this hotel is what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “More than Average but cld n't found anything Great”
Reviews.Author: varun123
Reviews.Content: We were there on company outing and had booked 9 rooms. We arrived at 11 am but ..i guess the checking time was 3 Pm but till 3PM rooms were not ready for Check IN. - Room Size was not suspicious but clean and decently maintained. - They don't offer complementary water .If you want to drink water you have to go water dispenser every time ...i was shocked to know this. - Location is good , MTR station is just 10 min and walking distance to temple street Market , Fa Yeun Street Market and ladies market are also just few Metro station away max 15 min from Metro. -Food:- Had breakfast only and it was Good. Overall it worth to stay in Hotel BP but if you looking for something extraordinary and superb then its that not place.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: suepross
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from June 6 to 8, 2012 and were 3 adults, 1 kid and 1 infant. we love the location, its in tsim sha tsui, the victoria mall is just right next to it and when you cross there are 7/11, circle k, sasa and other restaurants and cafe and its also walking distance to the police station as well as the bus station. it is also close to langham place (short taxi drive) if you want to visit h&m, muji, armani, nike or other high end shops. The rooms are small about 20 sqm. once you enter the room you would see the bath room on the right ( shower with glass enclosure, no tub, toilet and sink ) with basic toiletries, closet on the left with hanger and safe. the room was 1423 near the fire exit and the rooms were clean. there were 2 bunk beds w/c is just right for our party. theres a small tv with dresser and a blow drier and a fridge with mini bar. all of it fit in a small space. the elevators were fast as well. i cant say if the staff were rude or friendly - they didnt smile and they have a hard time speaking in english so they just point or use sign whatever it is we asked. we forgot to bring an adapter (for cell phone and camera charging) and we called the housekeeping and they delivered it in our room at no extra cost. when we arrived we wanted to go to ocean park but 5 of the taxi cab refused to take us there (guess because of the distance ) and we asked help from the concierge and they gave us a small calling card and wrote something in Chinese and when we showed it to the taxi driver and asked to go to ocean park they drove us there no questions asked though we didnt know what the concierge wrote in the card. for the amount that we paid, id say that its a good value and wed stay there again the next time we visit Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, uncomfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: akahoshifan
Reviews.Content: Pros: One of the more affordable hotels in HK. Reasonable walking distance to two Metro stops. Bathrooms were clean. Cons: It started with our check-in. We had reserved a room with a double bed in a non-smoking room. We get upstairs to our room and not only are there 2 twin beds, but the place reeks of smoke. We go back to reception to the most unfriendly staff member imaginable. We get the manager involved, and he explains that they catered to our "nonsmoking" room and that the double bed room we reserved was "preferred" and not guaranteed. Considering we paid extra to intentionally book the double, we were at a stand-off for several angry minutes until the manager finally decided to upgrade us for the evening to a suite until a double room opened up the next day. Because he finally decided to meet us half-way, they get 2 stars. The beds were horribly hard, but I'm guessing this is the standard in China and HK. It was a marginal upgrade over sleeping on a bare tatami mat. The double room was also small (as was the suite, to be honest), but I value quality sleep over the size of a room I don't intend to spend much time in.

Reviews.Title: “Good location by the park”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Sigurdson
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is slightly dated, the location, cleanliness and value makes it a good pick for people passing through Hong Kong on business. Right by Hong Kong park with nice views over Victoria harbour, the Hong Kong Island and lower Tsim Sha Tsui your are quite well off, especially on the higher floors. The close distance to Kowloon Ferry Terminal, Tsim Sha Tsui bus station and the MTR makes it a good spot to start when you are going places. The rooms are small and the interior is old, although clean. In general the offer is nothing special, but tend to your basic needs and generally at good rates. Service is OK, breakfast decent and there is WiFi available at a charge. The hotel seems to be popular with tour groups and the lobby was occasionally packed with people and bags. The elevators were quite slow and getting to and from the room often took longer than you would expect.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyk1981
Reviews.Content: stayed there over a year ago, the location is accessible to night markets and some shopping, the service is average ! you wont get a great view from the hotel as its in a busy location with buildings /markets around. The breakfast choice is decent ,.. the metro is walking distance from the hotel ! its in a busy part of HK. I stayed there as I manage to get a good package deal , otherwise I think you can get a lot of options with the money spent ..... If you looking for something secluded , avoid this , if you like to be in the hot spot , its a good place

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: sakurajme
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Room was a bit small, and furniture was outdated, but it was clean nonetheless, and I enjoyed my stay. The location of this hotel was great. Its close by all the major attractions (Victoria Harbour, Avenue of the Stars, Temple Street Night Market) lots of shops and cafes around (popular eateries like Tsui Wah Cafe and Hui Lau Shan) and moreover, near two MTR stations, making my trip to HK very enjoyable. For the value and convenience, I would stay here again for my next trip to HK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yen C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient and clean. It was a cozy room, which is expected in Hong Kong. My husband has a lot of family in Hong Kong, so we stayed at a locals rate (still $200ish a night). The rooms had two twin beds divided by a dresser and there was a desk/area to tuck your luggage stuff towards the window. It has A/C, internet (only 1 user at a time if you sign up), and a cool view of the busy city. We barely spent any time in the rooms because we were out and about, doing what you do in HK...eat and shop!

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: possmina
Reviews.Content: My husband & I travelled to Hong Kong on July 1 - 4 and stayed at the B P International Hotel in Tsim Sha Tsui. It was our second stay in this hotel and will most definitely stay here again in our next trip here. We have been to Hong Kong countless times, have stayed everywhere but to our opinion, because of BPIH's strategic location and value for money, we couldn't ask for more. Check-in was smooth despite the volume of tourists that came in. The standard room assigned to us was very neat, clean, complete with toiletries and provided more than enough space for both of us. The hotel does not provide bottled water but there is a cold and hot water dispenser provided in every floor. The hotel is situated right beside Kowloon Park. It is the shortcut route to Canton Road where one of the largest malls in HK called Harbor City is situated. At the far end of Canton Road is the ferry terminal that can take you to the opposite side of the peninsula. The Avenue of Stars is also within the area. Temple Street night market is just a few minutes walk and Nathan Road is a stone's throw away and if you are the more active type who simply adore the long walks, Mongkok and Sham Shui Po which are famous for night markets are within reach on foot. There are also MTR Stations close by so travelling around HK is hardly any problem. Getting a taxi? No worry as there is always a cab waiting at the doorstep. Strategic location, value for money, proximity to shopping malls and night markets and restaus - what more can you ask more from B P International Hotel? Not to mention the nice staff..

Reviews.Title: “Beware: Major Fire Hazard!!!”
Reviews.Author: blsnwbrdr
Reviews.Content: So, my entire extended family and I stayed at this hotel recently. One elevator was completely down as it was being repaired, so that left three working elevators. While we were there, over the course of three days, two of the three remaining elevators constantly broke down. At one point, we were carted up to our rooms on the 15th floor using the service elevator. We were told that the two broken elevators were under emergency repair and would be up and running soon. Later that day, we tried to leave our rooms on the 15th floor. Just like before, only one elevator was running. The one working elevator constantly went to the 25th floor and proceeded downward picking up passengers till the bottom. Unfortunately, being on the 15th floor, we could not get on since the one working elevator was always full by the time it got to us. After waiting for over ten minutes, we decided to take the fire stairs down fifteen floors. To our surprise and horror, the bottom eight floors were locked. Even worse, the last few floors were completely unlit. We eventually made our way out of the death trap on the 11th floor and got downstairs using a different set of elevators that only go up to the 13th floor. When we presented our dissatisfaction with the elevator and emergency exit problems to a manager, he focused on the elevator issue being fixed soon. We tried to explain the hazard of the stairs leading to unlit and locked lower levels. The manager maintained that the last level is unlocked (it's not, we checked), but failed to understand the problems with having an unlit stairway and locked emergency exit doors. In my opinion, the B P International is a dangerous place to stay. As for the rest of my experience, it was average. The front desk didn't seem to care much for the issues we presented and were not very helpful. On the other hand, the concierge and information desk was much more helpful. The large lobby is very inviting and kept very clean. Our rooms were pretty small; however, the size of the room didn't bother me. I agree with other reviewers that the location of the hotel is nice. There is a lot to do nearby (shopping and eating) and subway stations are very close. Probably the best asset the hotel has is the GREAT dim sum place sitting under the hotel. Prices are good and mainly visited by locals, not many tourists will be found there.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot. Big lobby and big room.”
Reviews.Author: pubprisoner
Reviews.Content: I just stayed for overnight and I didn't expect much after reading reviews about small rooms in HK. Reception was friendly and efficient. Room was pretty large with king bed. full bureau and good size bathroom. Bed was on the hard side which was perfect for me. Bed was plenty long- I am 6-3. Next to beautiful kowloon park. From airport, take express train then free bus shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “All on the doorstep, busy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Baby2
Reviews.Content: Whether lady luck was smiling on us, I don't know, but after my husband chatted to the staff, they gave us a bigger room, which changed the experience considerably. Travelling with a toddler, space and a bath tub are a god send. The junior suite they gave us was super, as the original room was just OK, but tired. The bathroom had been upgraded but over all small. The world and his wife stay at this hotel so the battle for the lifts can get ugly but you have got everything downstairs. Need clothes alterations / food / massage / park and swimming? MTR? Everything anyone could want it within seconds away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good values”
Reviews.Author: Geffect
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed in this hotel for 12 nights in June, 2012. I was raised in the hotel neighborhood so I know my way around. Let me give you my honest evaluation: Location: Superb, close to everything. We could go back to the hotel for an afternoon nap to get over the jet lag. Amenities: Excellent. It was nice to have a safe, a mini fridge, a hair drying, ironing equipment and a hot pot in the room. Shower: Top notch. The powerful water jets helped to soothe the aching muscles. Price: Reasonable in Hong Kong standard. Housekeeping staff: Super responsive. Mangerial staff: Very engaging. Why didn't I give it a 5-star rating? These are the 3 weaklist links: The front desk personnel, the extra firm beds and the elevators. The front desk staff needs training to be more friendly, helpful and it does not hurt to smile once while. The elevators were being renovated during my stay so they may improve afterwards. The beds were firmer than any hotels in US. They definitely did not accomodate the body contours. All in all, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel with decent size room”
Reviews.Author: E-TravellerCanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night enroute to my journey from nearby china ferry terminal to Kaiping-China. This was my 3rd time staying here and always enjoyed my stay here. Check-in and reception service is a bit lacking ... had to wait 15 minutes to get my keys. The room I must say are a decent size compare to many of the compress mini rooms in many other Hong Kong hotel. NIce comfortable bed and clean washroom. The thing I like most is its location. As said earlier in proximity to the China ferry terminal, MRT in walking distance and pretty well the main shopping drag of Tsim Sha Tsui just within walking distance north of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Reasonable Price!”
Reviews.Author: smileseed
Reviews.Content: Went for a 5 day's trip to HK and stayed in this hotel. It's located at a very good location, close to the MTR, u have street food right near the hotel, and best of all, it's walkable distance to HarbourCity! While staying there, we walked to HarbourCity and we spend a whole day shopping there, and we even travelled to Macau from there, as there's a ferry terminal. Will definitely come to this hotel again if I visit HK.

Reviews.Title: “3 adults okay for 1 week”
Reviews.Author: TravelSmarterJZ
Reviews.Content: 3 Adult females shared a 1 bedroom 2 bunk bed room on 14th floor. Elevators were a pain between 10-12pm when guests checking out. Staff are repairing elevators and trying to speed them up, but a 24 floor hotel with only 4 elevators says it all. Room was small but clean. Everyday the maids changed the beds and towels, they provide all in room necessities from slippers to toothbrushes and combs. Daily vacuum and very clean in common areas as well!!! We had the American buffet breakfast included in our 1 week package. Very good, but expected foods, in addition to Chinese options. Most days was same staples, which was comforting and safe. We also paid for buffet lunch that was $118 HKD pp and very good. If it's pouring rain, the bell boys will lend out umbrellas and if you have an address of somewhere you need to go, they will write it out in Chinese for the taxi drivers. No complaints. The hotel is older, but well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: al p
Reviews.Content: Staying at BP International Hotel is comparable with the exciting trip to Disneyland and Ocean Park. The room is very clean, the beds are so comfortable to sleep with and the bathroom is so clean you can sleep on it. The elevator is very reliable. However, we have an irritant feeling of being unwelcome when we checked in at past midnight on May 25. The lady at the front desk seemed uncomfortable when being asked. However, this will not deter us from checking in at BP the next time we will visit Hongkong.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view ruined by poor service”
Reviews.Author: TiberiusVerax
Reviews.Content: I have been a regular at B P International over the years and I have posted a review before but my experience this time warrants another contribution as a warning to other guests. I booked a Harbour view room in February requesting a non-smoking room with a queen bed, arriving on May 7 for 4 days. Three weeks prior to arrival, I emailed the hotel confirming my booking, once again requesting that a non-smoking, queen bed room be put aside for me. The hotel thanked me for my email and "noted" my request. We arrived in Hong Kong on an early flight from Europe, but there was no room available as yet (no problem with this, we were very early). Nevertheless, the girl said she would check us in so all I would have to do later was collect me key. Once again, I reminded here of my request of a non-smoking, queen bed room. She said it would be no problem. On our return later in the afternoon, to my amazament I was told by a different check in person that my room with TWIN beds was ready! I explained that on three separate occasions, I requested a non-smoking, queen bed room. He said that there was none available and that there were only six such rooms in the whole hotel (this hotel has about 500 rooms!). After a lengthy heated argument, I had to settle for a smoking, queen bed room. So after booking three months earlier, reconfirming my request by email three weeks before arrival and being told that very morning that everything was ok, the hotel still couldn't deliver. What is the point then of going to all the trouble to ensure your booking if the hotel can't manage something as simple as this? Very poor service!

Reviews.Title: “Not an up-'lifting' experience”
Reviews.Author: TheMadCat
Reviews.Content: Ever watched a B-grade movie 'Devil'? (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Devil_(film)) So I stayed at this hotel a few years ago and had walked away with a pleasant memory, and hence, picked this despite the many reviews and feedback about the horrendous elevator experience. Believe those and this. It is truly bad. I had been given a room on the 24th floor, harbor-view, and while the view was pleasant, going in and out of the hotel was anything but that. There was a total of three working lifts servicing B, G, UG, 11 - 24 storeys. They don't work well. One particular lift seemed possessed, stopping at EVERY SINGLE LEVEL with nary a soul in sight at the lift lobby. They were slow. And to a girl carrying shopping bags and needing to pee, very, very very bad news. Whined to a cleaner who revealed that the lift situation has been like this for more than six months, that even she could not stand it at times. So what's happening B P? Pluses: - great location - step out of the hotel, turn left and walk a few steps) (okay maybe for five minutes) and you will hit Austin Station. Better yet, turn right from the hotel, walk towards Parkes Street and you will hit Jordan Station. - great food With Temple Street nearby and the plethora of seafood (giant praying mantis prawns, crabs, shellfish etc), and so many tea houses nearby - you won't go hungry. - great service Staff was nice - lady checking me in was nursing a very bad flu and had a mask on but went out of her way to recommend a respectable foot reflexology place to help with the aching feet. Awesome. - great price, sorta It's not ex for a hotel like this - but surely you can give more than one tiny bottle of shampoo and soap for two people? (Then again, a supermarket is JUST across the street from the hotel.) So in short - book this.. maybe LATER, when the lift situation is addressed. I am glad my bladder muscles work well.

Reviews.Title: “Average, clean hotel, but in a great location”
Reviews.Author: stuash82
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a simple, clean hotel in a good location - this is a great option! The hotel is on Austin and Nathan, about a 5 minute walk to the Jordan MTR stop, and 10 mins to Tsim Sha Tsui. Several restaurants and shopping malls all around as well. We had a room facing the HK Harbor, so we had excellent views as well!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sheronlee
Reviews.Content: This is my third trip to Hong Kong and my first stay in this Hotel. My friend and I stayed for a total 5 nights. Compared to the previous hotel I stayed, this Hotel is just good. It is located within walking distance to the Jordan MTR (5 mins walk) and it is surrounded by many restaurants and cafes. The famous night market, Temple Street is about 8 mins away. Tsim Tsa Shui (TTS) is about 20 mins walk. If you do not feel like walking, then just hop on the Jordan MTR to TTS. The hotel room is big compared to other hotels. The staff from the housekeeping department are super friendly. There are 2 negative things about this Hotel. Firstly, I find that the staff manning the reception are not helpful or friendly. They have this "air of arrogance" in them and it seems that they only treat guests who can speak in Cantonese well. Their English is mediocre and they have a tendency to speak fast. They would not volunteer any information but rather acted very aloof. Secondly, the elevators in this Hotel seems to be specially made for a remote little village and not for a mega fast paced city like Hong Kong. The elevators take ages for any guests to ride. From the many reviews in Tripadvisor, I believed this is the main complaint. People in Hong Kong tends to walk fast, eat fast and talk super fast and yet this elevator is superbly slow..... P.S: For those who want to go to the airport or going to the Hotel from the airport, you can travel via the Airport Express. The costs is HK$90 per person. but if you buy the tickets in a group of 2 or more, then you'll save more than HK$20 per pax. From the airport, take the Airport Express and stop in Kowloon station. In Kowloon Station, there is free shuttle buses to major Hotels. To go to BP International, take bus no. K5. The last stop for K5 will be BP International.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Julian L
Reviews.Content: First in HK, location is very important, property is so valuable in central areas so I feel the price was quite good value. The location was very accessible, near TST and the metro. Good facilities as well, like the self-laundry service, which can save you a ton. Also the view (I had a harbor view) was really impressive. The room itself is quite small but it gets the job done. I highly recommend getting a queen instead of twin, much less cramped. What wasn't good value was the in-house restaurant. I mean, breakfast (a mediocre one) for 200hkd isn't worth it. I second the recommendation for people to hit up 7-11 or cafe de coral for meals. The only other issue I had was the elevators. For some reason, in a massive hotel, one elevator is always out of order, and you have to press two buttons to call the other 3 elevators. So, elevators come to each floor twice (if you follow my meaning) and its horribly inefficient. For such a massive hotel they really need to improve on their elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value for money...a truly pleasant surprise upon arrival!”
Reviews.Author: AussieFinn93
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid for this hotel, we really were expecting something very basic. However as our airport bus pulled up outside, we thought that we couldn't surely be in the right place. The lobby is truly impressive and well decorated. The restaurant was divine. The staff were really friendly. Everything was great! For the price we paid we did get quite a small room (although larger rooms are also available for a higher price) but everything in this room was, although basic, pristine and in excellent condition. The Scout Association of Hong Kong have their headquarters in the same building, and as I have been associated with Scouts in the past, it was great to pop in and converse with some scouts from a different country. The location of this hotel is fantastic; right next to the beautiful Kowloon Park and within easy walking distance of public transport to access other parts of the city. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean and central”
Reviews.Author: pw2530
Reviews.Content: I took a taxi from airport to hotel,230HKD, well worth it after the long flight. Checkin was very prompt and my request for a non smoking high floor room was met. I only had to wait 2 mins for the lift and the longest wait for a lift during my stay was 4mins, nothing to complain about there. My room was very clean and the view amazing. Welcome bowl of fruit was a very nice touch. Easy to walk, even with sore feet, to Canton rd, exit hotel left, and Nathan rd, exit hotel right. Easy walk to Star ferry also. Hotel food was good but 7eleven breakfast a good option and Welcome supermarket had stacks fresh fruit etc. Close to many other really good food outlets. My room was serviced daily and always looked clean. Bathroom is small but hey how long do we really spend in there? I took the Hotel to airport bus for my return flight, 110HKD. I would reccommend anyone to stay at BP but be prepared for a small room if 2 staying. Was ok for myself.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Accessible and Affordable!”
Reviews.Author: dragster180
Reviews.Content: Just got back from HK 5 day trip, the hotel is easy to find just look for the K4 shuttle bus (free) from kowloon station from airport express mtr! Or if you opt to take a scenic bus ride from airport to the hotel take the A21 bus which leaves the airport every 20mins i think. The Hotel is very near the mrt station C2 exit to be exact, its just around the corner before nathan road. Welcome supermarkt 7-11 is just in front of the hotel, if you like eating straberries, wellcome supermarket sells it only for $hkd 10.60 for 200grams. its so cheap i bought 3 boxes and the strawberries are giant! There are plenty of resaurants on the streets in front of the hotel, if you like exotic ones try the steam turtle with szechuan suace! you wont know its a turtle hehe (yuck) but if your on a tight budget like we do for the last days, we just (take away) its what they call on take outs food, anyways bowring corner parkes streets there is a food stall which offer a variety of squid balls, siomai, beef balls, dumpling soup, chiken wings, hotdog etc! very very cheap, just 10-30hkd, lots of locals go there to eat there are no seats so you have to eat standing or on the mini shelf they provide. Oh about the hotel, we got the family room with a twin double decker, its just a standard room not that big not that small, the bathroom is not that big also but you can move around comfortably, very strong hot and cold shower which i used it for 30mins just to sooth my aching legs! Refigirator is provided, mini bar, 23in lcd tv. We had the buffet breakfast which is delicious at first days, but they didnt change the menu for the buffet breakfast for five days so you get tired of the same taste! The elevator will take you an average 5-10mins waiting time and it depends on the frequency of people coming in and out. At first upon checking in we had trouble, the front desk told us that breakfast is not included i told him (mr. Sun) the tallest guy at the front desk that we already paid for it so how come he will not include the breakfast? then he made a call and he said ok you have breakfast, sheesh! then we ask if our 6yr old daughter could have breakfast too for free since she hates food hehe, mr sun no at once we have to pay 98hkd for the kids each to eat, then i forgot i am in hongkong one of the rudest people on the planet, so ok the kids had brunch at 7-11 instead. But i still recomend this hotel, the park is just at the back of the hotel YOU MUST check the park out! hang out for half a day! my kids went swimming at the sports center and had lotsa fun very affordable too, aviary is free, feed the pegion, stroll beside the pond. Btw this is the 2nd time i visited this hotel so it is def worth it! good lookin out folks!

Reviews.Title: “Easy Access Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rachel B
Reviews.Content: When you arrive in Hong Kong catch express train to Kowloon. At Kowloon walk around to Bus terminal and catch free bus to BP Int. This Hotel is a great place to stay for the family. The main entrance is amazing for a mid range hotel. I had difficulties finding a roon in Hong Kong for a family of 4. This Hotel was able to do this - 2 bunk beds which the kids loved. The room was incredibly small. And the lifts very slow. We used the fire exits - despite being on 14 floor this was still quicker. If you have an early riser - head out for a moring stroll in the park behind the Hotel. It is incredibly clean - very peaceful and lovely to watch morning Tai Chi and Flamingos being fed. There is also a fabulous swimming pool complex. The outdoor pool is only open in summer months. Being on a budget we didn't eat in the Hotel restaurant - we crossed the road for a much cheaper breakfast - and headed down to Temple St for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “B.P. International hotel Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: dundonnelldreamer
Reviews.Content: The B.P. International hotel is in an excellent location, handy to the Austin and Jordan MTR stations, so close to the Temple St market and Nathan Rd. The only complaint was that we had to wait so long for the lifts in the hotel as we were on the 20th floor, but in all fairness, the lifts are being refurbished. Service was great. We did the Lantau Island Big Buddha tour and it was very good value for money. The Peak tram ride was also great.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location!”
Reviews.Author: ro_oan
Reviews.Content: For a traveller who is 'geographically challenged' this is the best hotel for you. Just a few minutes away is Jordan Stations MTR (train line)- this is the most convenient way to traveller around the city. Also for us who went to Macau, the China Ferry Terminal is walking distance so we saved in the taxi fare. The room is clean, bed plush, the room is averaged sized. There's a lot of closet room for our clothes. The bathroom maybe small but all the amenities are in (bath gel, shampoo, toothbrush and paste, slippers, cotton buds and cotton pad as make up remover). Water heater also available. We didn't get the harbour view but the view of the city- it's nice to see the city lights in the evening. I liked the breakfast buffet, since it has a lot of choices. And since it's a buffet, we filled ourselves up and just ate light lunch outside- we were able to save some money again for the meals. There is a tour desk at the hotel lobby too, they helped us a lot. All in all, I had nothing bad to say about this hotel. When there's no smoke, there's no fire ^_^

Reviews.Title: “Good stay @ BP”
Reviews.Author: Ser1980
Reviews.Content: Just came back from my hk trip. Stayed 5nights there @ this hotel. Simple, cozy & just the right size. Nothing fancy.. we don't need that too. We booked a standard room on the 21st floor. Non smoking level. No stale smell! There's no bath tub.. but the shower power is just right. Clean toilet And the best thing is the room makeup service.. We are very messy. And we notice the people who makeup / tidy our room is adjust the display according to our "habits". This is really good! Location wise, it's just beside the new Austin station. But if you are the one who focus on shopping you will be taking the Jordan line more often. Which is just a stone throw away too. If you took the ariport express to Kowloon station, u can save $$ by taking the free airport shuttle. K4. Right @ the hotel side door! View is great to me.. I stayed on the 21st floor.. room 2115. unblocked view. I can even see Elements from my room. Last but not least, the location there is quite safe.. away from the noise and yet accessible. So if you just want a nice room to stay & yet accessible I'll recommend BP International hotel. PS: HK Scout association is there too.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: dev-null___0
Reviews.Content: Based on 2 separate personal recommendations, we decided to stay here instead of the more pricey, bigger names hotels. Excellent location - walking distance to Temple St night market, Nathan, Star Ferry etc. Average room - A/C worked fine. Paid more for the harbor view, could see some of the nightly light show. Skip the seafood buffet dinner. We were jet lagged the first night and had the buffet when we should have gone across the street (Cafe de Coral) for a light meal instead. No problems w/ the 100 HKD shuttle to/from HKG. We initially planned on taking the Airport Express back but ended up taking the bus both ways. While the entire experience was average, I have no other Kowloon hotel experiences to compare it with.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: nearing40
Reviews.Content: We were searching all over the Kowloon area for a Hotel that would suit our family of 5. We required interconnecting rooms - with an additional rollaway, breakfast included, comfortable bed and good shower, and for a weeks stay - a laundry which is located on the 13th floor. The BP ticked all those boxes. The BP was very reasonably priced, great night views of Victoria Harbour from our 16th floor rooms, easy walking distance to the harbour, and we had Austin and Jordan MTR's only half a block away, either side of the hotel. If ever we stayed in HK again, we would have no hesitation in staying there again

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Anokh P
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on favorable reviews, a good location, and a relatively modest price by Hong Kong standards. My first impression of the hotel was decent enough. The lobby is nice and, while small, the rooms were clean. There was nothing particularly fancy or luxurious about the room itself, but it met our needs just fine and had a nice, strong shower. However, service at the hotel was markedly lacking - even by Hong Kong standards. Our problems started at check in, when my wife and I were told that only twin sized beds were available, rather than the queen sized bed we would have preferred. When I asked if we could at least switch rooms later during our stay, we were basically unapologetically told no. This was not the end of the world, but a simple smile or apology would have helped go a long way. The next day, it was raining quite a bit and we had dinner reservations. We asked at the bellstand if we could get a taxi. We were told, "No problem. You can hail one outside." But there were none outside. So, we were left to stand in the rain on the sidewalk to hail a taxi on our own. This took about ten minutes, and we were about ten minutes late for our reservation accordingly. Again, this wasn't horrible. But a little bit of help would have been nice. The following day, we checked out. Check out was efficient enough and easy, despite a long line. We opted to take "their" shuttle to the airport to catch our flight. At 110 HKD per person, this was barely any cheaper for the two of us than a taxi would have been. But we figured it would be easy and reliable (see above about catching a taxi). When I asked how the shuttle works, I was handed a list of times with no actual instructions, information, speaking-to, or even eye contact. So we chose a shuttle that gave us a little cushion on time on our own. We left our bags at the hotel and were told to be back at 19:30 to catch our bus. We were back at 19:15. At 19:45 (our shuttle's scheduled time), there was neither a shuttle nor mention of a shuttle. We inquired at the bell desk, and we were told that the shuttle would arrive any minute, and the bellboy would let us know when it was there. No problem; we continued to wait. At 20:00, my wife again asked the bellboy where our shuttle was. She was told that he had "just spoken" to them (maybe the driver? who knows...), who was five minutes away. Of note, we had been watching this bellboy moving bags around for the preceding 45 minutes, and at no point was he near to or speaking on a phone. So we asked if he'd mind calling and checking with the driver again, as we needed to catch our flight. We were still being polite, I should add. However, at this point, the bell staff literally turned his back on us and walked away, completely ignoring us. I can tolerate a degree of subpar service, but blatant rudeness to your customers crosses a line for me. As we had been ignored, we asked again (admittedly, somewhat less politely this time) and were told, extremely rudely, to "just wait a few minutes" as, again, he turned around and walked away from us. The bus did, in fact, come a few minutes later. Overall, it was about 20 minutes late. Luckily, we had given ourselves a big time cushion, so 20 minutes wasn't the end of the world. But the complete lack of basic communication or professionalism by the hotel staff was inexcusable to us. Additionally, as a note, if you take "their" shuttle (as it's advertised), give additional extra time, as this is a shuttle that stops at multiple Kowloon hotels. Again, not necessarily a big deal had we known, although, when we asked for details about the shuttle, this information (and, in fact, all information) was not given to us. The hotel does boast a good location, adjacent to Kowloon Park, and nearby to a lot of good food and shopping. It also boasts a clean, though not fancy room, at an affordable rate. But, as I said, you get what you pay for. Service is not only lacking, but at times obnoxious, rude, and unprofessional. In light of this, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a closer look”
Reviews.Author: Jinnie S
Reviews.Content: My initial impression of this hotel was that it was a bit shabby...but during my stay in HK, I came to realize how much I like it, and I intend to stay here again on my next trip. The location is my main attraction - several nearby MTR stations (Jordan, Tsim Sha Tsui); busses that cross into China terminate right behind the building; several great shopping neighborhoods very nearby, including a notable "night market;" and many authentic HK streets and alleys nearby to explore. Easy to get cabs in front and throughout the n'hood. I also found the staff and their service to be of high quality, they helped with several needs and requests during my stay. Free breakfast (mixture of western and eastern, decent-tasting selections, good coffee) and free wifi in my package were greatly appreciated. Gets very crowded on weekends. Room was a nice size for one person, a bit tight for two but still doable. The adjacent Kings Cuisine restaurant/banquet room is also popular on weekends, and serves great dim sum - although I did better with a local friend who could help me order; the menu pictures did not help me order and the staff did not speak english, so the noodle dish I thought I'd ordered turned out to be soup :-)

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: dustylynn
Reviews.Content: We were recently in and out of Hong Kong several times, and chose to come back to the BP following our initial stay. The location is just perfect for everything we wanted to do there. The gardens behind the hotel are really a lovely place to spend some time. We had arrived early and needed a spot to wind down following a 14 hour flight. When we returned the room was ready, and a nap was in order. We had asked for a non smoking room and discovered that this was not the case. The situation was resolved and we were upgraded to a superior room with a better view on our next pass through. The front desk staff seemed a bit harried at times, with few smiles, but it is a very busy place and they did seem presssed. We did not have free wifi as some have noted, but a computer near the bar was made available to us. There is a happy hour every day for those who enjoy a 2 for 1 drink. The one negative was the wonky elevator service. Friends we were travelling with were on a floor where the elevators did not want to stop, and ended up having to walk down at one point. We watched elevators go past our floor on more than one occasion. I did create a sense of unease when we eventually got in, wondering if we could get out! Apparently upgrades are about to occur. Good. The price for this hotel was reasonable, and we would recommend it to other travellers. Good value for money, and a shuttle sersvice that takes you to Kowloon Station and the Airport Express.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectation. Highly recommended. :)”
Reviews.Author: aeb03
Reviews.Content: I very much recommend this hotel. It is cheaper compared to other hotels in Hongkong but with so much to offer. Check-In: check in was fast, plus we had free complimentary drinks. The receptionist attended to us well. In case of early check in and your room is not yet available, like ours, you have the option to leave your luggages at the reception so you can start touring hongkong. Not to worry since they do have an organized system so as to take good care of your belongings. Lobby: really huge and comfortable where a lot of people can sit comfortably in case you have to wait upon checking in or out. Looks really nice as well. :) City Vista Rooms: yes, the rooms are a bit small, but let's face it, its hongkong and we dont get to see so much big rooms here. Even though they're small, it's really clean and they have nice comfy bed sheets that they change everyday. Really well maintained. Also, the rooms have complimentary water, coffee and tea replenished everyday. If you ran out of drinking water, you can always go to their pantry, and refill your bottles. The bathroom was really nice too with a shower heater installed to it. Also, it is complete with toiletries (bath gel, shampoo, toothpaste, toothbrush, comb, slippers) and towels, which are also changed daily. But I have to suggest to just bring your own soap since the ones they provide can't actually clean you thoroughly. Also, the room is equipped with hair dryer, iron for clothes, electric water heater (which I dont think you'll need since you can always get hot water in their pantry per floor) and a safe which works really well. They also provide hangers inside the closet if you want to hang your clothes. Wi-Fi: i believe it is not on every package that wi-fi is free, but in our case, it is. Connection was really good, but the downside is, only one person can use it at a time so if you are traveling with others, you have to take turns in using the wifi. Elevators: their 4 elevators are already working but there is a note in our room that they are still updrading it. It is indeed quite slow, but based on the previous reviews, I can attest that it did improve a lot. :) Location: near the shopping area for mid-high range priced clothings also near MTR Jordan. :) Check out: really fast unlike other hotels that make you wait until they have checked the room if you have taken something from their bar. So Kudos to BP International, and I am definitely recommending this to my friends and will definitely go back here. :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Homathko
Reviews.Content: I really can recommend this hotel. Nice, clean rooms, although rather small. Water kettle, refrigerator, hair blower, in room safe, an excellent shower, TV with sufficient channels (but you don't need it, enjoy the area around instead). The night market is just in walking distance, even the Star Ferry terminal is just 10 walking minutes away. Breakfast (buffet) is really good and offers almost everything including fresh prepared omelets. The coffee is surprisingly good. The only reason not giving five stars is that the elevators are not perfectly synchronized and you are going to wait sometimes pretty long for a then already fully occupied one. At least this should improve in the next future, they are already working on it.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: wales18
Reviews.Content: Stayed at BP international for 4 nights. The room and bathroom was small but clean. The breakfast had a good variety with no complaints. Location was good next to the park which was very relaxing and quiet compared to the busy streets of Hong Kong. Would recommend a high room and would recommend this hotel and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Celery0503
Reviews.Content: We travelled with a 2 year old boy. This hotel is perfect! I have no complaints. Lets start with check in. We were lucky that we were able to get our room at 1:30PM instead of 2. There were some days that the lobby and front desk looked like chaos and pandemonium around 1 to 2pm but on the day we arrived everything was calm. So I guess you just have to be patient if you are going to wait for your room, which we did. We first had lunch across the street at Cafe de Coral, rice and noodle meals. Then we walked around the park to kill time. Went back to the hotel at 130PM and our room was ready. We just had to wait for the 2nd room (for the grandparents) another hour but that was okay since everyone could just rest in the 1st room. The rooms are small but what would you expect in HK and for the price. But we were comfortable --- a 5'11' dad, a 5'4" mom and a little boy. We had a queen bed. Maybe for "taller" visitors and tourists the room would seem small to them. But for our physique it was okay. There is a 7 eleven across the street and a grocery store "wellcome" at the basement of the 7 eleven store. I bought fruits and drinks were cheaper at the grocery. So convenient. Kowloon park is right behind the hotel, a good 3 minute walk to get to the heart of the park. Beautiful park, perfect if you are travelling with kids because they need time to just run around, walk and explore. There is a big children's playground. Perfect! Park opens at 5am and closes at 12mn. There is a jogging trail too! Unfortunately i didnt bring any gear and was tired from walking all day. You can walk to Harbour City mall and the other malls along Canton Road! All the high end and mid-end shops are there! It is retail shopping heaven! Nathan Road is just a short walk up the street. You can actually walk down Nathan Road to the Avenue of Stars and watch the Lights and Music show at 8pm. So for the price of the room, it was worth it. We stayed for 3 very comfortable nights. The bathroom is small but very clean. If you are not a luxury traveller, this is your place. I'd stay here again with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Family Room = Bunk Beds (Beware)”
Reviews.Author: GaurishGoa
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is well located but Indians looking indian food need to walk minimum 15-20 minutes to Tsim Sha Tsui for restaurants. The worst part of this hotel is it offers bunk beds in family room category so beware before you book your room. Such rooms are OK for youngsters who can climb to reach the bed. Be careful while getting up even if you are on lower bed, as there are chances of hurting your head. The front office staff is 'blunt' and have no 'whatsoever' consideration for any request if you have. Don't expect any 'hospitality' from these staff. Rooms are clean and neat. A bathroom cannot be smaller than the one in this hotel. Seven Eleven store is bang opposite the hotel and MTR (Jordan or Austin) are few minutes walk. Jade market and Temple Street Night Market are also ten minutes walk from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: xjenniex
Reviews.Content: Have just spent a couple of days in Kowloon at the BP International Hotel . What an amazing place Hong Kong is but do not think it is as cheap as everyone seems to say it is. We stayed at the BP International Hotel in Kowloon right in the centre of food courts and shopping centres. The hotel itself was spotlessly clean Staff all very friendly and helpful and most spoke perfect English. The rooms ( we had a twin) were not very big but certainly good enough for a few days stay. There was plenty of hot water and good size shower even though the shower room was very small. I always think if the bed is very clean and the shower is good that is fine for short stays. Our room was on the 20th floor overlooking the city so lots of lights at night . There gave you two free bottles of water a day which came in very helpful . The bar had happy hour for a couple or hours a night. and the buffet restaurant for lunch was very good. The hotel also looked after your luggage if you had a late flight which i thought was helpful too. you are within walking distance of the night market and ferries to Hong Kong Island and Macau as well as some great shopping malls I think if we visit Hong Kong again i would certainly stay at this hotel They do a shuttle from the airport to hotel for 110 HK dollars ( March 2012) one way We found this very helpful as we arrived in the evening and didn't really want to be getting on buses and trains but if you are young public transport is really cheap. A seven 11 was right across the street and behind the hotel was Kowloon Park a lovely oasis in all the high rise buildings Well worth a visit if you are in the Kowloon area

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms small but clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SPclaire
Reviews.Content: GREAT LOCATION, 5mins walk to Jordan MTR, 10mins walk to Star Ferry, plus all the shops & restaurants right outside the hotel. My double room comfortable suited 1person, but was a tight squeeze for 2 people, but it was clean & comfortable. The hair-dryer provided was pretty useless. But the complimentary tea, coffee & water was appreciated. Plus the free newspaper hung on your door every morning was a nice touch. Tiny wardrobe, could only hang 3 items, so had to utilise the side-board & floor. The bathroom was also very compact, but clean. The cleaning staff were always very friendly & staff on reception were helpfull. The hotel was very busy & noisy at all times & the lifts seemed to stop on every floor which was annoying. Definitely ask for a room on a higher floor & waterfront side as the view is great. Also ask for a room away from the lifts, as it can be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “convenient and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie D
Reviews.Content: it was our first time to travel in hongkong with my siblings, there were 4 of us so it was pretty difficult to find a hotel that's reasonably priced thats in the tsim sha tsui area. Although the room was a bit small and simply functional, for the price we paid, it was ok. The staff were very accommodating and nice. But the best thing about this hotel is its location. Its in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: kim n
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 11 days & thank god they have a laundry service (i think on the 13 floor?). The only downfall to it is that there are 4 washers & i believe 2 dryers? (i cant remember) but its not a huge laundry mat, but its better than looking around HK for one. if memory serves correctly its open 24 hrs. i personally think the price of the rooms are pretty expensive & the rooms are REALLY TINY!! so if you suffer from claustrophobia, i highly advise you to NOT stay here. The bathroom is TINY, i cant stress how small it is in there. I heard the hotel donates part of the money to the Boys Scout ~ or something along the lines (so its for a good cause!!). I believe if you pay for wifi (or if its generally free) just make sure to speak to the front desk for the pw, otherwise you're stuck using their PC at the bar lounge area. Their wifi was pretty weak, so if you want to skype/facetime someone, i'd suggest you go to their bar lounge / main floor where the connection is A LOT stronger. The area of the hotel is slightly "sketchy" (if you're not use to that type of environment. But it gives the flavor of how HK is. There are many restaurants & foot massage places around the neighborhood, as well as a huge park right behind the hotel. The hotel is inbetween 2 train stations (took me a few days to figure that one out, though there are many trains in HK, you really cant get lost, even if you wanted to. Everyone that works at the hotel is very nice & the cleaning ladies are sweet & fast. And without failure, they always restock you on bottled water!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: MonicaGeller10
Reviews.Content: Location - excellent, its near all the tourist spots, shopping areas, train stations, its so easy to find a place to eat, theres a 7-11 right across the hotel. Price - definitely worth it! Service - excellent! wonderful people, always smiling and willing to help rooms- not as large as your normal 5star hotel, but who stays in the hotel when your touring the whole day and shopping at night? it's just perfect for the price and convenience. It's pretty clean too with complete toiletries. aircon, water heater, personal ref, cable tv, wifi- all excellent! all in all, i would recommend this hotel to anyone without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Calgary68
Reviews.Content: A very busy hotel, located on Austin Road, just off Nathan, in Tsim Sha Tsui, Million. Easy access from the airport by Airport Express train and free hotel shuttle bus #K4. The train will run you HK$140 one way to Kowloon Station from the airport (for two). The B P has some elevator issues at the moment, but they're working hard to overcome them. The hotel is part of the Baden Powell Scout Centre and seems to have a gazillion rooms. The rooms are typically small - no room to swing a cat by the tail here, but they're well maintained and kept clean. Staff is friendly and accommodating. Close to just about everything you need or want in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: merwoman
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed here for 3 nights and had to reserve 2 rooms, a "family room" and double bed. The "family room" consisted of 2 bunkbeds crammed into a tiny room with absolutely no space to walk. The website shows bunkbeds but does not disclose how small the room really is. You can barely see out the view outside because the bunkbed is right against the window. After a lengthy time at the front desk, we were able to decide on 2 rooms across from one another, but they had to be on the Smoking floor, which was the only floor available with "family rooms". Wouldn't you think family rooms should be on non-smoking floors?? Housekeeping offered to clean the rooms to get rid of the smoke, which helped a bit, but it still did not make sense. The location of this hotel is pretty good, close to Nathan Road which is famous for its shopping, but high end stores. Subways are also very closeby, as are restaurants, but not too many with English menus. We found most restaurants to be rude, they have no patience for English speaking tourists. Breakfast is not included and is fairly pricey. Dinner buffet is also extremely pricey (on weekends, $40 CDN!). The gentlemen helping us with our luggae always seemed annoyed. We had a lot of luggage because we first travelled to the Philippines before Hong Kong. We offered to do it ourselves which seemed to anger them even more. The hotel lobby is elaborate and so grand that it makes you feel like you're in a magnificent hotel. Don't be fooled by the first impression!

Reviews.Title: “All about location”
Reviews.Author: winxian
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is right where you want to be when in hong kong. The Jordan station of MTR is right around the corner. Walkable to the night market and other popular shopping areas in TST. A lot of Restaurants around the area. On the downside, the rooms are quite smaller compared to the other hotels that i've stayed at in hong kong. Staff were somewhat snobbish. They don't want to be bothered. There's always a long wait to take the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: RJAYR
Reviews.Content: Location Location Location...BP International was a perfect pick because of location and price. It is close the all the great shopping. If you want to shop high end then yes, Hong Kong is the place to be, but for cheap stuff like cell phone cases, just order it on Ebay and save yourself the hassle. I dont suggest going to the swap meet type areas like Mong Kok or the night market. It may look like a deal, but its not. Just go on Nathan Road or the malls for the small stuff, most shops will have the prices listed and they arent that bad. The best night food places are on temple street (2 blocks from BPI). Great price and really good food. There are 2 MTR stations near the hotel ( Austin street & Jordan Street stations) My Wife and I stayed here from 02/01/12 - 02/05/12 as part of a package deal when we went to the Philippines. We booked it through Holiday World Tour. I'll break it down to make it easier to read. Pick up at Airport- Coming in on a late flight was good because you get the shuttle service all to yourself. They say that extra baggage is $25HKD per bag, but they never charged us so we tipped the driver more..they just say that so you don't bring too many bags. The arrival agent was nice and so was the driver. Front Desk- Front desk staff was very helpful and answered all my questions, night after night. The check in was at night so there was no line. I went down to change my money and they told me that if i needed it now they would do it, but suggested the money exchange across the street for a higher return. It's the small things which really make the difference. The place right across the street isnt much more than the hotel ( Hotel= $7.30 for $1USD, Money Exchage $7.40-7.50KHD for $1USD). I found a place next to the Temple street night food area which always had a good exchange every night (Sun Rise Money Exchange & Remittance Co. Law Ho Yin 75 Austin Rd [--] she would always have $7.60 or even $7.80 which is really good. If your in the area then i suggest going there and she's really nice. Bell Desk service- Bell boys were very attentive and got our bags up to our room fast. They are also helpful with questions about the area. Rooms- We were on the 23rd floor and our room faced the skyline...WOW. you really cant beat the view. Rooms are a bit small, but we only used them for sleeping so it didnt bother me. Two to a room is MAX. The rooms are Very clean and updated (except for the TV's) Beds were comfy and they made sure they maximized all the space in the room. The Bathrooms are small as well, but updated, i really liked the shower...no pressure problem at all. Don't touch the mini bar, just go across the street, they have a 7-11 and a Circle K and the building next door also has a supermarket. I recommend buying some cup o noodles and use the hot water in the hall way...cheaper. Internet- The internet is NOT free. For 4 hours it is $50HKD, for 24hours its $100 HKD. for 24hours+ a mobile usb adapter its $150. And your timer starts when you first log on. Phone calls- Phone calls are not free as well. 1 local phone call cost $4HKD...not much, but it can add up if your not paying attention. Elevators/Lifts- there are 4 lifts....they are all slow. This is why i rated this hotel a 4 star instead of a 5. You can waste your entire vacation just waiting for these lifts. Watching everyone rush to the lifts on the ground floor is like catching the MTR during rush hour! Concierge /Tour desk- Very helpful, when it comes to the tourist stuff, but if your looking for food places like good ole street food, then you should talk to the bell hops. If you plan on going to Disney Land you can purchase your tickets here and avoid the lines at Disneyland. Same for Ocean Park. Restaurant- we didn't try the buffet , I rather go out and try the different street food vendors and our door eateries on Temple street. Hong Kong- so if its your first time to Hong Kong dont be intimidated...the people are very nice and most speak some English. If you want to get around take the MTR ( Subway) go to the customer service desk and pick up a Octopus card. The card deposit is $50HKD plus $100HKD. So when you get the card you pay $150 and have $100 to use. You get the $50 back when you return the card minus the $9hkd service fee if returned with in 30days. You can recharge the card at several loading stations and you can use this card for EVERYTHING, parking meters, Vending machine, Most types of transportation in tourist areas, Food, ect. FYI- Smokers....Hong Kong Is Very Clean and they want to keep it that way. You will notice that most people that smoke hang around orange trash cans with ash trays on top.That because they dont want to get slapped with a $5000 HKD fine for throwing their cigarette butt on the street. Same fine for spitting as well...yea thats right Spitting. Also there is no Eating or drinking on the MTR or in the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “The elevators gave this hotel an average review!”
Reviews.Author: bjreimann
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend in January - the rooms were decent, the meals were good, but the excessive wait for the 2 elevators caused me to give this hotel an average review. In all seriousness, we needed to allow an extra 10 minutes to get down to the lobby or up to our room on the 17th floor! There was no way that 2 elevators were near adequate to service the people wanting to go up and down. I even tried to figure out the stairs a couple of times only to pop out on floor 12 to find the entire floor being shampooed and then to find the stairwells dirty and full of mouse traps and not going all the way down. The park next door was nice (although the hotel and park didn't look anything like the photo in January) - the lack of a workout room made it REALLY difficult to get any exercise in unless one wanted to run laps around the smaller park. We tried to run through the park and then down to the water and dodging through the crowded streets was very frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with good location to famous eateries and street shoppings”
Reviews.Author: seijinm82
Reviews.Content: Travelled with a group of friends (total of 5 people), booked this hotel last minute due to problems with a previously booked guest house. Stayed for only one night as the hotel is full for the otehr nights. Location: stone throw away from famous eateries (e.g. Dairy Co), and wont go hungry as there are lots of food outlets around the hotel. Walking distance to the nearest Jordan MTR and the Temple Street Night Market Rooms: rooms are clean and cosy Price: as we booked it on the day itself, the price is definitely higher than if booked earlier (however, given the other good qualities of the hotel, the price is not a big issue) Service: the staffs are very helpful and polite :) and will try their best to communicate with you if you dont speak Cantonese

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: toweisi
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located in Kowloon. Very near the Kowloon park, the MTR Station, and Nathan Road as well. Can even reach the Avenue of the Stars by foot from this hotel. Main lobby is very spacious. Rooms are comfortable, with great views of the city. Bathrooms are clean and well-equipped. Staff are helpful. Highly-recommended hotel, if you ask me.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: tmbailey
Reviews.Content: We were happy with the cleanliness of our room, the friendly cleaning staff who greeted us in the mornings and the great location of the hotel. Very close to restaurants, cafes, markets, public transportation, parks.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pecanfam
Reviews.Content: I stayed late December, 2011. The hotel is big, well located, but room are on the small side. Looks clean and does the trick. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, effective and friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Hanica
Reviews.Content: B P International is the scouts movements hotel i Hong Kong (that is Kowloon which is not the island) and B P stands for Baden Powell. All our dealings with the staff went like clockwork. The rooms were clean, well equiped and we also had a lovely view over the harbour and the Peak. The beds were a little short. It is about ten minutes to walk to the harbour and make sure you do it throug the Kowloon Park with beautiful birds and flowers. Nathan street is close and so is Shanghai street with the nightmarked.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Kowloon area”
Reviews.Author: pine129
Reviews.Content: With costs continuing to increase in Hong Kong, the BP International is a good value. While rooms are small, the service is good. Internet is included. My only complaint on this visit was the elevators are still slow as one has been under remodel for months and months. I recommend this hotel for cost focused travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Worth your money”
Reviews.Author: Charmione
Reviews.Content: breakfast is limited but enough to fill your stomach. Very good location to all shopiing areas- Giordano, Esprit, H&M and to all tourist spots and port going to Macau!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jadylee
Reviews.Content: Location was quite good. Near MTR's, Temple Street ladies market, Walking distance to Harbour City. There are lots of food stalls across the street. Small rooms but very clean. Rooms have free wi fi, although 1 person at a time can use it. It was quite pricey though, I paid about USD 400+ due I made the booking close to the date of arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in kowloon”
Reviews.Author: sosohanoi
Reviews.Content: Really great location in austin road, near kowloon park, tsim sha tsui road and the bay. Breakfast is okay. Rooms are small if you have 1 kid.

Reviews.Title: “The Price Is Very Right!”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: Was surprised to find the $rate so reasonable when I was looking, so I booked immediately. The location is very excellent, within walking of Tsimshatsui, Metro/Bus, Nathan Rd. Room is very neat (tho smallish, typical in HK). But, for the money, it's excellent. Would without reservation stay here again. Oh, very close to the Airport Express station, etc., another plus. One perceived drawback - lack of free Internet. HK$50 for 4 hrs., HK$100 for 24-hr period. Bummer! Tried wi-fi at McD's, with my netbook, but no success. Internet is almost a must when tarveling these days. Pretty much very available in most of China, yet BP charges what I thought was not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “good bargain”
Reviews.Author: CentWestern
Reviews.Content: Location on Austin Road close to Nathan Road is perfect. Central Kowloon. A lot of shops and markets are on walking distance and a MTR station is nearby at the corner. Rooms are very small, bed is good. A good bargain in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great price”
Reviews.Author: Connie C
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during Christmas 2011. To start off, price is very reasonable compare to other hotels in HK during the holiday season. The rooms are small but expected consider the limited space in HK. We have 2 children so instead of squeezing into a fancy hotel in one room, we rented 2 rooms with very reasonable price. We had to stay in the smoking floor because this hotel does not offer connected rooms in the non smoking floor. We were unsure about that at first but it turned out fine. Ventilation was very good so we didn't really smell cigarettes inside the rooms. You would smell it in the elevator area though. I wish they would just get rid of smoking in the hotel or put connected rooms in the non-smoking floor. Hotel staffs were very friendly and helpful from bell service, cleaning crews, front desk, to the property managers. Rooms are very clean and neat but need some updating. I wish they would have a DVD player and a more advance TV instead. Otherwise, most of the basic necessities were there. Alot more than some motels and hotels in the United States would offer. Cleaning service was very efficient. They could be in and out within 30 minutes and our rooms would be sparkling clean. The mattresses and pillows were very firm and in good shape which we found that as very important feature after a long day of walking. You won't feel the springs like some hotel beds do. We have had worse beds in the Marriotts and Hiltons in the US before. Location wise, it is very convenience with a grocery store across the street and a Manning drug store close by. MTR (subway) is not as close as some other hotels but it was still within walking distance. There were some restaurants around but if you want varieties, you would have to take the MTR to MongKok or the heart of Tsim Tsa Tsui. We did not get the free breakfast package because there is a cafe de Coral across from the hotel which serves reasonable price breakfast with varieties. That was my children's favorite restaurant since their food was similar to American food. We got free wifi instead which is more important because you won't get any free wifi anywhere. I would suggest travelers to get free wifi instead of free breakfast since HK is a food haven. Afterall, we had a great stay in this hotel and I would recommend this hotel to anyone even family with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Wendorful hotel, excellent location, clear, nice service, good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Hussain125
Reviews.Content: Wendorful hotel, excellent location, clear, nice service, good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good free internet, 1 min to airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: Asrul
Reviews.Content: My priority is always free intenet and good location. Bp international hotel offerred that privileges exceptionally in my opinion. The best way to get to the hotel is by airport express. I bought octopus card on arrival and take the express train to kowloon. The hotel name is listed in the airport express complimentary shuttle route k4 from kowloon airport express station. This put my mind to peace especially being my first time here.
