The shuttle took me directly within 30 sec walking distance to the hotel entrance. The shuttle trip is quite frequent - every 12 min. I was initially checked into a room with two single beds though I requested for double bed during booking. They agreed to move me to double bed next day albeit in smoking floor. I was a bit apprehensive but turns out the room is good, with no cigarette smell and excellent view of harbour. I love waking up with Sun rising above the harbaour landscape. The room size is ok for my 70kg, 176cm body with enough space for me to work up. Bed size n bathroom is good too with basic amneties provided. The wardrobe is fantastic with complimentary safety box. My room dont have ironing board but I used the ironing facilities provided in its laundry room. The internet is superb but only allow one machine to logged in at one time. all in all I am very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “tiny clean rooms, good quality furnishings, good location”
Reviews.Author: SubwayRider82
Reviews.Content: Bell staff here are eager to porter bags despite any resistance, in exchange for tips (and they are not shy to wait with an open hand). The rooms are small, clean with good quality furnishings. Water temperature for showering can occasionally go hot or cold unexpectedly, so keep the temperature somewhere in the middle. On the second floor is a restaurant and a piano lounge/tea area where you can get free internet access on 2 old computers. Attached to the hotel at lobby level is the Kings Court restaurant which offers cheap dimsum, and a local bus station that can take you to places in China. The Temple street night market is a couple of blocks away and the hotel is walking distance to Jordan subway station. Upscale stores surround the area, grocery stores and pharmacies are nearby as well. 30 minutes walk will get you to the ferry terminal. I have stayed here previously in 2004 for a few days, and it was pretty much the same, just a little newer.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, and the night view from the park view rooms is delightful.”
Reviews.Author: GregandWinnie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the BP (Baden Powell of Boy Scout fame) for 6 nights when I was on buisiness in HK. I was upgraded on check-in to a Park View room on the 22nd floor, which has a great view over TST to the Island. Wonderful at night. Room was not large, but comfortable and clean, and there is free wifi in the room. The front desk staff were very helpful. As the hotel was close to work, it was good for me, but it is also close to Nathan Road, the MTR, and the area around Temple Street. All in all a good experience, and I will stay there again. The only down side was that I think they were refurmishing their lifts, and 1 out of the 4 was not working, which made the lift service a bit slow.

Reviews.Title: “Very good within its category”
Reviews.Author: terinay
Reviews.Content: Location is key here. The Jordan MTR station is half a block away. Right outside the hotel is a 7-11 where you can buy necessities or even top up your Octopus Card credit. Directly behind the hotel is Kowloon Park where my husband and I went for a short morning run in attempts to run off all the delicious food we were having in HK. Temple Street night market and Nathan Road are a stone's throw away. I don't disagree with the other reviews about the small rooms, but hey, we've got to be realistic here. This is Hong Kong and real estate is expensive and scarce. If you go to New York or Tokyo, the rooms are not going to be any bigger. In fact, we've stayed in even tinier rooms in NY. Within its category, BP International met expectations. Service staff was friendly and our bathroom was equipped with toothbrush, comb, shower cap, facial cotton, etc. We don't see these complimentary toiletries anymore unless we are staying at a 5-star hotel these days. One thing is that they only have 4 non-smoking floors, so be sure to request for it at check-in if that's what you want. One quirky thing: the hotel played the same elevator music the entire week we were there. I caught myself humming to the tune when walking on the streets. The poor hotel staff has listen to this same tune everyday! Tip 1: right outside is the pickup point for the Airport Shuttle Express bus that will bring you to the Airport Express train, if you don't want to take a taxi. Tip 2: When catching a taxi to a place where you only know the English name, ask the receptionist to write the Cantonese name of your destination on a card for you to hand over to the taxi driver. Many of the drivers don't know the English names.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: RobertCanberra
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the BP International just on check-in time (2.00PM) and we booked for three nights through Expedia. We had clearly requested a non-smoking double room. Upon arrival I was told they could put me in a Smoking room with 2 single beds for one night and they'd move us on day 2. I said that this wasn't acceptable and we waited about 30 minutes for a double non-smoking room to be cleaned. This was all a bit of a painful start to our stay, but that said, the staff were very polite and professional and they did expedite a room for us. The hotel appeared to be very busy. The lifts were very slow (they are upgrading them) and the room was a bit pokey but for a really good location in Kowloon and for the price, it was quite reasonable. The room was spotless and serviced professionally each day and the staff were friendly and very helpful. For location and value the BP International is a good choice. If you want a more luxurious and romantic stay (and a King Bed) then this is probably not the place. One tip for HK and surrounds: get rid of smoking in rooms completely!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price, low-middle quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: EZE2525
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night while waiting for my husband's flight to arrive. It took more than 20 minutes to wait for check-in when there were 3 people behind the desk and only 1 was serving a guest. Quite frustrating since the 2 extra people were standing at the counter but attending to other things... this seems to be a common complaint of this hotel, though so come prepared to wait in a queue that is not self-explanatory. Pluses and minuses + Good location, overlooking park, close to subway + Lots of food options nearby + On the route of the airport express bus (subway to airport) + Good AC + Close to Elements Mall (great shopping and food options) - Poor wireless internet - Old rooms - Medium to hard beds - Slow elevators

Reviews.Title: “Tired building and tired, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Puzzled66
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Hong Kong before so I don't have any source of comparison, but the rooms were extremely small and minimally equipped. Not a single bottle of water is included in the room - just as an addtional charge. The beds are either twin or double, they are short in length, and harder than rocks. The breakfast is boring and minimal - the fruit is old. The location is ok - walking distance to the pier and the night market.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Franz_Zena
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel in November. The Hotel is simply amazing. The staff is perfect and the rooms are awesome. I can suggest this hotel to everybody as I couldn't ask for more in an hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not a pleasant experience in BP International”
Reviews.Author: aditimukherjee04
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 days stay at Hongkong. We stayed for 3 nights at BP International and thought of updating my fellow travellers on this hotel. Firstly, let me start with the good points - a) Excellent location in Kowloon. Close to all major tourist attractions in Kowloon area. Proximity to multiple restaurants and to the Jordan MRT. b) The lobby is vast and nice with some wonderful steel chandelier kind display c) Efficient check in process - did not take much time d) We requested for an early check in and they gave that to us - ordinarily there check in is from 2 p.m. but we got the rooms by 1 p.m. . This helped a lot since we were travelling with a child & an elderly parent. e) The hotel has a Scout Display souveniers in one of the floors which was pretty good f) Breakfast spread was also quite filling and of good taste g) Opposite the hotel, there was a 7 Eleven store which became quite handy for us. Apart from that the hotel was quite close to the Temple Street night market and was within walking distance. Now for the unpleasant parts - We were at the 14th floor and on all the 3 days that we stayed, we faced issues with the elevator, which somehow refused to stop on our floor. Had to climb down on most occassions to the 13th floor & take the elevators from there. Post reporting the problem, we saw notices that the elevators was under maintainance. Another bad experience we had at the hotel was with our luggages . It took more than an hour for the luggages to be sent to our rooms. The service boy who came with the luggage, simply just dumped the baggages near our door and left without even informing us. Can't seem to remember his name though. Overall service at the Hotel was quite apalling and I hope that the senior management wakes up & takes note of the behaviour of the staff there. A small suggestion to the Hotel - wrt to Breakfast - for stay beyond 2 days the spread becomes boring. Same set of food with no changes at all. Maybe, they could rotate the menu every alternate day. Additionally, I also feel that the rooms are really small for a couple with a child. Hardly any place to move around. The bathrooms being like matchboxes.

Reviews.Title: “not bad for the money but the room was too small”
Reviews.Author: Barbnyc
Reviews.Content: Had to pay for internet in room wasn't really worth it. If you sit in the lobby, you can get free wireless. Room was really small. too small for my taste. Overall, it was okay. The location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: yozul145
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, but standard for Hong Kong. Clean room, comfortable (but small) beds. Decent internet, but not as fast as I would like; Skype connections were dropped with some regularity. The location is great - near Nathan Road, with loads to do. Just across the street from a bunch of small, local restaurants, and just a few minutes walk away from the ferry pier and a glitzy shopping mall, so there are lots of options.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room which smelled”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: We had just finished the most wonderful trip to China with Wendy Wu Tours where the hotels were all modern with large rooms. The B.P. International Hotel in Kowloon,Hong Kong came as a terrible shock. The tiny room we were offered had a small shower and the room smelled of gas - presumably stale cigarette smoke. Many of the floors have smoking rooms only. As a non-smoking room was not available we had to pay £115 per night extra to upgrade to a suite which did give us more room and a bath but was still not great as the whole hotel has a tired, old feel to it. Whilst we were there one of the elevators was broken and others refused to stop at our floor. The "B.P" in the title of the hotel stands not for "British Petroleum" as you might think but "Baden Powell" of the Scout Association - say no more! I would definitely not stay at this hotel again and have advised Wendy Wu Travel not to use it. It's much better when in Hong Kong (where the hotels are expensive) to pay more and stay on Hong Kong Island rather than Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Basic, Close to Ferry Terminal”
Reviews.Author: RachelHong
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I were her for Christmas 2010. I found it pretty basic but clean.We stayed here for 8 night and have nothing to complain about. The breakfast buffet is decent, I love the congee that I had on 2 ocassions. The room itself was quite small, yet we didn't feel cramped. Instead of a table we had something that looks and feels like a ledge. A good use of space in my opinion. There are a quite a number of restaurants in the vicinity. The night market is a short walk as is the ferry terminal. The staff were very informative when we enquired about taking a trip to Maccau and made a couple of good suggestions. I woul definately stay here if I am in Hong Kong again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and basic in the middle of everything but with rock-hard beds.”
Reviews.Author: CORJr
Reviews.Content: This is a above basic hotel in the middle of everything on the Kowloon side. If you are not a smoker, get a room on the non-smoking floor not just a non-smoking room. The rooms, beds, and bathroom are very small; think cabin on a cruise ship. They do provide 2 keys per person but the internet service is only one device at a time even if there are 2 people in the room. The breakfast buffet is just okay. Nothing fancy. Tea but not coffee provisions are provided in the room. Kowloon park immediately adjacent to the hotel is a welcome place for quiet. There is free government wifi there. Being on the Kowloon side, you get the better view of the daily 8PM HK light show. It's a 15 minute walk along Golden Mile from the Star Ferry Terminal to the Hotel. There is a free shuttle (K4) from and to Kowloon Airport Express train station every 12 minutes. The ride to the station is 3 minutes. You can check luggage at the Kowloon Train Station. If there are 2 of you, you can get the 2-person pass for HK$140 one way. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A tight fit into a small space”
Reviews.Author: Mark R
Reviews.Content: Had no idea of what the BP stood for, until I noticed the Scout Association is connected to the side of the hotel. The B P is for Baden Powell. Another tight for space hotel. The rooms are tiny, but as is usual if we are not intedning to spend too much time in the room it is of no consequence really. The room is fresh clean and tidy and that you need is present. Internet is expensive! Close to the shopping districts and close to the ferry terminal. Our room overlooked a nice peoples park where we spent quite some time. A marvellous collection of birds in the aviary area including a large flock of Flamingos which surpried me, they were not caged and were free to roam at will around the large lake area. One thing that also impressed me was the number of eagles flying around. I got some great eye to eye shots of eagles soring past our room. Food was plentiful and good, like usual in China expensive for lunch and dinner, so mostly we go looking for restaurants, a short walk to Nathan rd and there are many choices.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: xMiniCee
Reviews.Content: Good value if you're looking for a place to stay and you don't want to pay too much. The room was a bit small, but very clean and tidy. Hotel is in a nice location, very accessible to public transport and easy to find coming from the airport. Easy walking distance to everything around you (for shopping or just exploring). Most of the staff were pretty helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KiwiTwo
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights in October. We took the public bus(A21) from the airport and found the hotel easily, just off Nathan Rd in Tsim Sha Tsui. As expected, with our early arrival, the non smoking room was not ready, but we left our luggage with the concierge. When we did check in about 1.30pm we were impressed with our room on the 20th floor, complete with harbour view. We had tea and coffee making facilities (replenished daily),and best of all free wifi.The bathroom was clean and well stocked, although, admittedly the beds were rather hard. We also received an english newspaper each morning. We tried the hotel breakfast once. Most things were available including made to order omelettes, and make your own toast. The atmosphere in the coffee shop was uninviting and very basic compared to the liveliness going on outside so we didnt go back. The hotel backs on to Kowloon Park which is a large pleasant oasis in the middle of the city and makes for a pleasant alternative to the streets. There is also a large public swimming complex in the park. In case you are wondering, BP stands for Baden Powell and the hotel is on the upper floors of the Hong Kong Scout Association which includes a large shop selling scouting equipment.

Reviews.Title: “good location but not 4*”
Reviews.Author: tedster074
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean but the rooms are small. The bar waas closed most of the day. but one could get a drink at the cafeteria. The Chinese restaurant looked like a cafeteria. Hotel staff a little unclear on directions except for the head bell boy. He advised taking the Airport Express (free shuttle every 12 minutes) and he was spot on. Otherwise all directions were off. lol.

Reviews.Title: “No parking space & only 1 key per room”
Reviews.Author: TorontoLai
Reviews.Content: There is a hotel with no place to park your car. If a friend comes to pick you up, he has to park the car in some far off street meter space and walk all the way to the hotel to meet you. Furthermore, my wife and I stayed for 14 days and was given only 1 room key. The lady receptionist said it's the hotel's policy that only 1 key issued per room no matter how many quests are staying in the room. She said if we are not going out or coming back together at the same time, we should leave the room key to the front desk and anytime whoever comes back first can approach to the front desk and ask for the key to the room. We then left the key to the front desk and left the hotel. When we later came back to the front desk trying to obtain the room key to get to my room, there were long lineups of quests waiting for check-in and check-out. We had to keep in the lines waiting to get our key. It took us about 15 mins before we can have the room key. Can you imagine the hotel needs 15 mins before allowing you to go back to your room? Another occasion was when I came back to the hotel, I approached to the front desk to ask for the room key, I was told that my wife has already returned and took the room key. So I went up the room and knocked the room door. However, my wife was inside the bathroom and didn't realized that I was knocking. I have to keep waiting and knocking the room door for about 5 mins. During my period of knocking the door, I was blamed by adjacent room guests for my disturbing noise. This makes me very embarrass. Room was small but clean and tidy. Beds are of prisoner's bed size. Most of the front desk staff are having difficulty with communication in English. This hotel is just average. All staff are with miserable faces. You can never found smile on their faces even when you say " Hi " to them. This hotel is horrible ! When you walk in the hotel lobby, you look like you are walking into a funeral home as every staff is having a long face. Don't fooled by the hotel pictures. It's not that good !

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Tiger8MiddleEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights after a tour of China. Good location in Kowloon so easy walking distance to local shops, the metro at Jordan Road, and the ferry terminal. The room was quite typical of a big city. reminded me of a Travel Lodge! Basic but everything you required. However the bedding wasn't paricular very clean. The best thing about the room was the bathroom which looked as if it had recently been refurbished. Although the bathroom was on the small size, not enough room for 2 people in there, the shower was very efficient. Breakfast at the hotel was very good. Big selection of various items including nice warm croissants and muffins, and large mugs of coffee! It didn't seem to matter what time you came down for breakfast there was always clean tables readily available. In fact the staff in the restaurant where very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property but poor service”
Reviews.Author: maubaraoidan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at BP International for 3 nights. Location is the best selling point of the hotel. MTR and shopping malls are walking distance. Rooms are not that big, but is very comfortable and is just right if you spend most of the day going around. The TV is quite old. The hotel people are not that nice though. I think they need to improve and train the people more.

Reviews.Title: “v.good value”
Reviews.Author: marcus m
Reviews.Content: nice, normal sized room over park for hong kong (space is expensive) oogd location near commercial and business areas, good for walking around

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaycee024
Reviews.Content: I only had 2 nights in this hotel but was very satisfied with my twin bedded room even though there was no discount for single occupation. The room was a good size and very clean and it was so nice to have a proper shower again. I also loved having the tea and coffee in the room and the fridge was full of nice drinks, though I did not use any. A very nice touch were the complimentary water bottles both days. The view was a bit disappointing but I still enjoyed looking out of the window. There was trouble with the booking and my Master card but the manager was very helpful and sorted it all out. I found the reception staff to be very pleasant and helpful and the staff on the Tour desk were kind and helpful with suggestions of what to do and how long to get to the airport etc. The location is really good - near the Night market, Kowloon Park and Jordan metro station, plenty of buses and only a short walk to the harbour and Star ferry for Hong Kong island. The Oyster card was great as not only can you use it for travel but also for buying things in shops and at the end if you have money on it they will refund it at the information at the metro. London should take note! I wish I could have stayed longer and hope I'll return one day and would certainly choose BP International.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: totoman
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on August 2011. It is a very big hotel with a great location near Jordan station in Kowloon. The rooms are big and very comfortable. And the price paid was cheap considering hong kong rates. The downsides of this hotel is the reception staff which is unpleasant and the fact that is a big hotel with no character or soul at all. But if you are looking for a nice room for a good price in hong kong it is defintely a place to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Valued hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AdAM0247
Reviews.Content: Got more than what we expected, yes exceeded. Nice and clean room. Friendly staff and we got good food and good price too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: vibinguyen
Reviews.Content: The room is very tight. I've never stayed in a small room with that price before. The bathroom is surprisingly small. But everything is clean. There is a pantry at each floor (I think so, because my floor has) you can fill cold and hot water. You have to pay for wifi, I don't like this.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: MySweetEscapes
Reviews.Content: We stayed in BP International Hotel in May 2010, for 3 nights at a rate of 750HK dollar on weekdays & 850HK dollars on a weekday. The rooms are quite small but anyway expect almost all Hongkong hotels to have small floor areas. The hotel is a bit old but rooms are well maintained & clean especially toilet & bath (with hot & cold water) Usual room amenities like kettle, hair dryer in-room safe, complimentary coffee are all available. They even have a small vendo machine for light snacks and a small pantry for drinking water! Cool! I would say that the hotel represents good value for money and would definitely come back and even recommend this hotel. Best for those who are on budget trip as well! However, you do need to book in advance as the hotel is always full - and the chances of a late check-out is somewhat challenging although their accommodating staffs will gladly try their best to do so. The hotel is just walking distance from the nearest train station (Jordan station) Kowloon park where you can find a huge swimming pool (in open space very nice for kids), convenience store, affordable Chinese restaurants and a midnight street bazaar where you can find cheap clothes and other souvenirs -just can't remember the name of the street but it's just 2 alleys away from the hotel. The hotel is in a very accessible location so you will definitely not get a hard time commuting.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful lobby, nice reception area”
Reviews.Author: racoontraveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived late after being bumped from flight due to typhoon season, took bus from airport which went up Nathan RD and stopped right by Kowloon Park . The hotel is just a short walk towards park, and we felt safe even with our rolling hand carry size suitcases. Found out the next day there is a police precinct near the corner. The lobby is beautiful and the reception staff were very polite and nice in a reserved way. Our room was a decent size, two twin beds on the firm side,but had all the amenities and toiletries. Only thing was it smelled of smoke. We thought we would only stay one night so did not bother to complain since it was past midnight. We ended up staying for two nights, but was out all day anyway so did not have to deal with the room. Bed was comfortable and clean , bathroom and towels were fresh and clean. Breakfast had an excellent spread, and a lot of it. Cost is reasonable , but one can certainly eat for less somewhere else. There are lots of restaurants nearby and fruit stalls on side streets. Internet is purchased separately but it was reasonable. Just have to keep your eye on your bill when checking out as well as for phone usage. The staff spoke English very well and very helpful. All in all I had a pleasant stay .

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: django1945
Reviews.Content: great location near mrt station, night market, good value and clean and the staff are all friendly, and accomodating

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain hotel, I would come back tomorrow!”
Reviews.Author: Matthew_June75
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend booked a room at BP for the first six nights of our Hong Kong - Macau trip, and we loved it. The hotel is very nice and clean, we just had some trouble figuring out where it was exactly, coming out of the MTR (Hong Kong subway stations are HUGE), but it was definitely worth it. The room was tiny but very clean, as the bath; the hotel staff was friendly and cooperative, they gave us directions and useful infos, and even kept our baggage for free after we checked out. The price was a bargain, especially compared to other hotels, more pricey but less comfortable (we stayed in a 4 star hotel in HK and it wasn't nearly as good). Don't be swayed by the low price, this place is too good to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: thisiskeng
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in BP for more than 20 times in the past 8 years. Like - Location is good. Few min walk to Jordan MTR - Airport Express Complimentary Bus stop is just on hotel's side - Shopping till late night in Tsim Sha Tsui + Habour City, and just walk back to hotel - Relax and take short cut through Kowloon Park next door - Lots of good foods across the street - Dim Sum down stair is super! - Price is right. - Now w/ free wifi Dislike - Small room - Tiny bathroom - Few and slow elevator - Check in / Check out can be slow during peak hours - Very bad slippers

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: Manchester008
Reviews.Content: We have just spend 2 nights at BP International the room was very small but very clean. The bathroom was really clean and the shower was excellent. We had free wifi which was great and air con. We had the buffet breakfast which was excellent and well worth it. We walked to the harbour which was a 15 min walk in the evening. The hotel is right on Temple street and we walked down the Market the other evening. I would recommend this hotel to others a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very accessible hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmpc
Reviews.Content: One thing I loved about this hotel is it's so near everything. Nathan road is just on it's right, Canton road on it's left, the very nice Kowloon park at it's back, and an MTR station with a ramp walkway next to it. It's not the Pen, but it has everything that a traveler needs. The rooms were decent, a bit small but good enough. The bathrooms were newly renovated. There was a laundrymat that was pretty helpful. The 7-eleven and wellcome supermarket across the street was so great, we got to buy cheap breakfast instead of eating at the hotel buffet. The staff were pretty helpful. I would definitely recommend this place. One thing to note is do request for a non-smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: ajaind
Reviews.Content: The rooms were a bit small for 2 people but the location of the hotel is great. It's very near to Nathan street and 10-15 mins walking distance from Soy Street. It's also a well known landmark in the area. Buffet breakfast was good with a lot of variety. We being vegetarian did not expect so much of variety. Friendly and helpful staff and clean and well maintained rooms.

Reviews.Title: “stay only if u don't get an accommodation elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: gyanchik
Reviews.Content: We went to Macau and disneyland and our last stay was at this hotel. Maybe our expectations were huge after the fabulous stay at disneyland hotel. The plumbing at the hotel made a lot of noise all throughout the night. The breakfast was also nothing to write home about. Location was the only saving grace as you were right in the middle of the Tsim Tsa Tsui and the night market was bang opposite the hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in centre of town”
Reviews.Author: SurajitMitra
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here with my family during New Years 2010-11 and must say my stay was great. Hong Kong hotels have small rooms and that was a discovery this time, but very clean and bathroom well maintained. I would rank this hotel a 4 star anyday. It is conveniently located close to Jordan metro station and just a few steps from Nathan Road. A 7Eleven across the road ensured our daily fix of supplies were taken care of. One noteworthy mention would be that if you arrive early, be prepared to leave your luggage at the concierge and come back in the afternoon as your room will never be ready in the morning as this is a very busy hotel. Breakfast was great but same everyday. Good spread of oriental and continental stuff. Neat and clean. There is a boy scout office in the same building but did not disturb us as we were out most of the time. Anyone staying here should opt for the harbour facing rooms as the views are worth every penny. A short walk away is the night market and money changers so everything is close by including the buses which take you to Tsim Sha Sui in no time. We loved this little restaurant run by Paul, called somthing Beef & Seafood Restaurant and the food here was superb. They even made a place for us on a busy 31st Dec night. The hotel charges HKD 1000 as a security deposit for the stay against any damages/mini bar which is refundable but make sure you carry cash and your credit card will take a month to re-credit the amount which is charged on the first day itself. However we will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Kowloon location, for $100 USD a night roughly”
Reviews.Author: Dekasu
Reviews.Content: For a Hong Kong hotel that is smack in the middle of Kowloon, $100 USD is a pretty good nightly rate. We stayed here the last time we went to Hong Kong in September of 98 (4 nights) and had fond experiences so we decided to come back here last year. Hotel employees helped carry 2 heavy pieces of our luggage to our room, which was pretty helpful of them. As for the rooms, I stayed with my mother and brother (3 people) for 4 nights (again) so we got 2 bunk beds and that pretty much took up the vast majority of the space in the hotel room. The TV was also kind of small, but hey I got what I paid for. No major sanitary issues, place was spotless top to bottom. The bathroom was decent, no major mildew or any major problems. The downfall of this place was that I had to pay for internet connection (trust me, after spending close to 3 weeks in Mainland China, I WANTED to go on Youtube and Facebook, but had to pay $300 HKD for 4 days worth of internet. Of course, as with any hotel in a central Hong Kong location, the view was breathtaking. Try to get a hotel room facing south and on a floor as high as possible so you could get a glimpse of the Hong Kong Island skyline at night. We got a room facing north so we got a view of Kowloon instead. As for restaurants, there is a dim sum place in the basement, but the food is overpriced and there are a lot of other great restaurants from all possible Asian cuisines in HK to try out, so I'd recommend against it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethLB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our first night after flying in from the US and loved the location. Kowloon Park was a great place to hang out and explore while we worked to get rid of the jet lag. Rooms were clean and comfortable, and they figured out from our Expedia booking that we wanted adjoining rooms, and gave us a queen in one and twins in the other, which was perfect. One room had a view over the park which let us see the laser show from the window. As others have said, the elevators are pretty slow, and the restaurant was pricy, but overall, we were happy. We liked the noodle place we went to down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for Hong Kong prices”
Reviews.Author: pine129
Reviews.Content: My first stay here was pretty much as previous reviewers had advised. The price was my favorite part and that internet was included. I found the hotel to be a bit too busy- constant coming and goings of people. More than usual from observations. Check staff was fast and nice. Hotel elevators were very slow and in fact there was statement in the room that the hotel is upgrading their elevator system over next few months. They need it! 4 slow elevators. Room was larger than I expected for the price and I was happy and I found the view to be very nice. Television was small and old- exactly what I had expected. My big gripe - no iron or ironing board and I was asked to visit self serve laundry to use a free iron there. Check out was so slow I had to leave and contact hotel later for copy of my bill as only two staff working reception. My rating would be higher if elevator was better and iron was not such a hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: TotalFoodSnob
Reviews.Content: I (35) stayed here with my 72-year-old dad. I picked it because it's in a flat area of the city. We found the location to be very handy. The airport express Kowloon station has the free bus that will drop you in front of the hotel, or you can walk it you're more able. It is also very close to the China Ferry Terminal -- an easy walk through the adjacent park, avoiding traffic. The park also has some neat attractions, including a large bird display. We found many close restaurants to the hotel, and the street markets are close too. We didn't eat at the hotel because we wanted to eat at the local restaurants. Our room rate included free internet, which was fast enough to get a good skype connection. The room was small, but that's what you get in HK unless you pay a lot more per night. The beds were also China hard, but everything was clean. The bathroom seemed spacious for HK too, and the hot water came quickly, and did not run out. We had a nice view of the Harbor. The concierge desk was very helpful. I highly recommend that if you plan to see the Big Buddha to get your tickets from the concierge -- you will save yourself A LOT of time when you get there by not having to stand in line!

Reviews.Title: “Wil refuse to stay there next time”
Reviews.Author: zem42zem
Reviews.Content: Roms are small, old and smelly. I didn't even fit in the bed. Price did not include internet (100HKD extra) nor breakfast (did not even ask), which means that for the same end-price, I could have had a much better room (including internet and breakfast) in a higher-end hotel. Only positive thing I'm able to mention is indeed its very nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location, loved my stay until I found out something was STOLEN!”
Reviews.Author: ThiNThuTRAN
Reviews.Content: I spent a lovely 9 days in this hotel and it wasn't until I was packing to leave that I found my gold plated flower stolen from within my luggage. I had my valuables in the safe but I forgot about this because it was not considered valuable! Just looked it, that's why it is targeted by thieves! Worst of all I had two male managers go thru ALL of my luggage! The hotel facilities were great, very close to the Temple Street markets and transport. Rooms were nice! I would probably stay here again but I would keep my luggage locked and just not have my room serviced so often! I didn't need it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Camryavalon123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near two metro stations which make it very easy to travel around the city. There are many shopping areas nearby. There is 7 eleven across the street and a mcDonalds behind the hotel. I recommend cafe de coral for breakfast which is located right across the street. The bell service is very good but they make you pay a tip and you can't use the luggage cart yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: QuickWorld
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel with bus & conv store just nearby. Take the non smoking floor. If you are taking the ferry to Macau just take the cab. walkable to metro station Jordan. Walk & in 5 minutes you are at Nathan road. Money changing facilities nearby , dont do it at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and awesome location”
Reviews.Author: TravelBella
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the B P International recently on a family trip and found the hotel suited our needs perfectly. We booked two rooms and the desk staff did their best to ensure that we received two rooms side-by-side. The rooms were small, as expected for Hong Kong, but clean and quiet. The best part of this hotel is the location. It's really close to the Austin MTR station, Jordan MTR Station, and has free airport shuttles to the Kowloon Station for the Airport Express Train. Right downstairs is a heap of restaurants, laundromats, shops, etc., not to mention all the shops along Nathan Road. Everything was very convenient and easy. Booking through expedia, I also got wireless broadband as part of the package. Would definitely stay at this hotel again next time I'm in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Kopstar
Reviews.Content: Excellent location on the edge of Kowloon Park, nice rooms, compact but ok for a city break, good bar and restaurant and friendly helpful staff, altogether a good hotel for a city break. If you want a pool take a towel & use the leisure complex in Kowloon park.

Reviews.Title: “The Austin Power - BP!”
Reviews.Author: petite_joan
Reviews.Content: Right at the heart of Austin street arise a towering hotel built by boyscouts years ago. Location wise I like it because it's walking distance to different shopping area. And very near the MTR station. The 3 most important things I always look for in an accommodation are: first cleanliness, comfort and good breakfast. This one fits the criteria. The hotel room is very dainty even the toilet. The bed is also comfortable to sleep with. The white atmosphere and the beddings are reasons why the room looks tidy. There breakfast is not stunning but the choices are good and the best thing I like is the BACON. For the price, I think BP offers a very reasonable price for the hotel quality and service. I still recommend this to people who are going to Hong Kong for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location and Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rucoji
Reviews.Content: > Late check-in due to unavailability of rooms. we booked for 2 standard rooms. we got the 1st room at around 2:30pm and the other one at 3:30pm. To compensate for this, they allowed us to stay until 1pm on our last day. since check-out time is 12pm. > The buffet breakfast inside BP hotel is good. Choices are eggs, sausage, bacon, steamed vegetables, congee, cereals, bread, croissant, noodles, fried rice and dumplings. It's a lot better than having breakfast outside the hotel, And rain is pouring during our 4 days of stay. > Housekeeping responds quickly. I asked for additional pillows and an adapter for my sterilizer. They sent it right away. >Bathrooms are clean. Water is good even the exhaust. Although I was hoping there's a faucet under the shower since it's hard to bathe my toddler using the shower.. And the free toothpaste is too small... >Rooms are clean even if it's small. There's no ironing board which could be very helpful too... And one thing that I really didn't enjoy from this hotel room is the noise outside the hallway. I can hear it clearly while lying inside the room especially at night... Our room is in front of the lift so you can hear people talking and children running. And the hotel music in the hallway is too loud I can hear it inside our room as well!!! > The location is great! There's cafe de coral in front of the hotel. Beside the resto is wellcome supermarket and 7-eleven. Kowloon park is at the back of the hotel. And most of the shopping centers is walking distance only. Like Harbour City, The One, Mira,K11, and Elements,. Temple street night market is also near. Starts at 5 pm where I got my souvenir chopsticks! Overall, we had a great stay at this hotel and would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “BP INTL HOUSE”
Reviews.Author: bebenimelvin
Reviews.Content: when we stayed there, i heard it was a new hotel way back feb 2008. it was a nice and clean hotel. we got the last room on the 17th floor, the view was superb, the climate that time was actually freezing :) its a new experience for us. we were happy about the stay and the location is just a 5-8mins walk to get to nathan road. we havent experience dining in to this hotel since our package was to eat outside hotel. shamrock hotel is also near.

Reviews.Title: “Good home base- No frills, but fine for our 3 day stopover & sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: NZ67family
Reviews.Content: Basic, small room and no frills, but location was great and the hot high pressure shower was excellent at the end of a busy day. Also quiet at night to sleep. The staff kindly let us have an earlier check in ( Note -requested before we left for our holiday) We stayed in the family room with Teens and it worked for us for our 3 day stopover. (Might have been too small for a much longer stay??) Supermarkets across street (Under ground) and around corner very handy and cheap. Able to walk to most places from here and/or take efficient trains. Enjoy Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel Good For Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: Saurabh A
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel. The hotel is ok for business travelers not good for family stay. Family with young kids to suggested to choose better 3 star hotel which may be little expensive by 300 - 400 HKD but worth it. If really want to stay then don't take family room take a Std room.

Reviews.Title: “Great option”
Reviews.Author: anujdhody
Reviews.Content: Hi Friends, This is a great place in case you are planning a business trip, located centrally & meets your budget needs and at the same time provides you good comfort. The rooms are clean & efficient providing you self sufficiency , transportation to most of the important locations

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: kevquan
Reviews.Content: To echo what others have said, a very basic no frills type of place. You'll pay decent prices for a HK stay in a good Kowloon location but it won't be anything fancy. A few quick points: - Across 7-11 and Wellcome Supermarkets so it's easy to stock up on water, etc - A block from the nearest starbucks - One block to the MTR Train station (Jordan Stop) - One block to Nathan Road - One block to Canton Road - About a 15-20 minute walk to the star ferry terminal - If you book with an agency, chances are they will also book you a shuttle road to and from the airport, which helps since it's about a 30 minute ride and the bus is very clean/comfortable - No gym - Laundry on site (25 hk dollars) for those travelers who pack light - Also, if you are looking for good food in the immediate area, the restaurant downstairs from the hotel is very good for dimsum and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but nothing romantic”
Reviews.Author: Curieuse12
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice but small rooms, very clean. There are washers and dryers available for travellers. Staff is efficient. Basically a good business hotel or a good base for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for one night! A bit steep though”
Reviews.Author: WarMage87
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in this hotel. Pretty good, free wireless. Watch out for the $4 charge on local calls though. Do visit Kowloon Park and take a dip in the nearby swimming pool. And the place is near the Jordan MTR station so this makes it pretty accessible all round.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Stay with convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: whitepicketfence
Reviews.Content: The hotel is what you would expect with any 3 star hotel. Rooms are a little small compare to North America. We had 2 single beds. We got free wifi. Food is expensive but there is a great restaurant across the street.- Cafe Corale. It is a quick chinese quick service restaurant. No waitress just order and pick up at the counter,. For breakfast we had congee with sticky rice and a hot drink for $20HK. They also have western style breakfast for $20-25HK.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy rooms, clean and great staff”
Reviews.Author: El_Predator
Reviews.Content: Stayed 17 nights in double room in September 09. Very cosy and comfy rooms. Not the cheapest hotel but not most expensive either. Make sure you get laundry done elsewhere cos it can be expensive here.

Reviews.Title: “BP International”
Reviews.Author: harkamaljit_sandhu
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel. Located in cnetral Hongkong and close to tourist spots. Bus is walkable distance and it is convenient in night time also. Staff is quite OK and there are eatries close by. It is good for family or solo travellers. Room as usual as little small but that is common in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: where_is_emily
Reviews.Content: Arrived from Macau via CotaiJet around 8:30pm. Cab cost about HK$100, because of the tunnel toll. Check-in was fast and easy. Lobby is separated in two parts, with a seating area and concierge in one, and just the main desk and elevators in the other. Looks very nice for a 3 star hotel. We also had to extend our stay 2 nights which they handled quickly. Elevators are SO SLOW. We stayed there for 7 nights and quickly learned to press the 'up' and 'down' buttons and ride it either way, because being in an elevator was better than just waiting for the one going in the right direction to come your way. Room was on the 13th floor, overlooked the city, but could see the park to the right. space-wise small, but god for HK standards and the price. Room was non-smoking (4 floors of the hotel are) queen bed. It had a safe, vanity, hair dryer, tv, 2 phones, luggage rack, and stocked bathroom. The showers were always warm or hot and were extremely powerful, rare for asia, but a welcome treat after traveling. Service was ok at the front desk, could be a little warmer and more welcoming. They always seemed annoyed to help and answer questions. An assistant was very helpful when we asked for extra sheets, some wire cutters to cut a lock that had broken on my luggage, and a corkscrew. Concierge is helpful. One complaint is the housekeeping. They were so eager to clean the room EVERYDAY. After we learned they refused to be turned away if we opened the door, we ignored the first two times housekeeping knocked another day until the assistant manager even came by and checked on us after calling us. If we have "Do Not Disturb" on the door, it means what the sign says. Another day, the housekeeping caught us just as we were coming back from breakfast, and insisted on cleaning our room when we hadn't even used any towels from the night before. We just gave up fighting and let them clean whenever they wanted. Buffet breakfast at the hotel was quite good. Served a variety of western and asian foods. for HK$85 it's not bad compared to what you can pay at other hotels, but you can get delicious buns at bakeries everywhere outside for about HK$20 max and fresh fruit juice stands nearby. We were given welcome drink coupons which we used the first night we arrived. The bar has live music from 9-11 and the atmosphere is basic, but fun. There are always taxis right outside the hotel, but there are 2 MTR stations nearby, Austin and Jordan. Austin, just one street away, and Jordan a few streets away. You can get everywhere on an MTR, highly recommended, easy way to travel. The Temple Street night market is walking distance. The Kowloon park is next door, also nice way to start your day every morning. Locals practice martial arts and exercise. There is an aviary and a maze. Various shops and restaurants surrounding the park. Check-out was a little more bumpy as they tried to charge us for internet which was free with our booking, but after a few calls, they wiped those charges from our account. Good stay, would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, and value for money”
Reviews.Author: michelle124
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights there. It's just 5-10 minutes from the MTR (Jordan or Austin), and if you're taking the airport express, there's an airport express shutter service that stops beside the hotel. Hotel is clean, rooms are of average size. Streets around this area are safe enough to walk back at night. The only possible complaint I can have is that internet services are not free. Other than this, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, tiny bathroom, no heating system, elevator only to 24th floor”
Reviews.Author: nemo_yu
Reviews.Content: Before my departure, I heard a lot about how small HK hotels are. It turned out it is true. But considering the size of HK, the room is ok, better than my expectation.B P international has great location, 15 mins walking distance to Star Ave, a lot of small restaurants and conveniet stores around. BUT their AC only cools, it doesn't function heating... and the bathroom is pretty small, washing area is right next to toilet. Since I've only been there for one night, it is a nice hotel overall. PS: if you stay at 25th floor, you have to take elevator to 24th, then stairs...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: JVM_7Wonders
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the central area of Kawloon. It was not difficult to find it for a first timer. The reception area is very small and is managed by very few staff members at the counter. It took us about 30 minutes to check-in. The room was ready as per our instructions.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located , additional extra bed gives no space to move around”
Reviews.Author: vanidaya
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, everything is walking distance from this hotel.The rooms are extremely small and after putting an extra bed , theres no room to move around . The buffet doesn't have much variety at breakfast time. Worth a stay only for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location. Beware when crossing the street.”
Reviews.Author: macpao87
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my trip to Hong Kong. I stayed for 3 nights in BP International. I can say that there is nothing extraordinary with this hotel. The rooms were very small for the price and bathrooms were very slippery - be careful. My friends stayed in a guest house nearby and the room size were similar although less modern. Next time, I think I'll just stay at a guest house since I only stayed in the room 4-5 hours a day for sleeping anyway. The restaurant at the basement was absolutely delicious though. I will definitely eat there again the next time I am in the city. What's great about BP is that its really close to Canton Rd and Nathan Rd. Everything is very accessible and it is more secure than the guest houses available nearby. Customer service was average and the bell boy sort of rude but later apologetic, when I confronted him for it. My uncle, who I was with, got hit by a taxi and we had a to spend a day in the ER. I think BP should be more cautious with this. They should request traffic personnel near the pedestrian line since they have a lot of guests using it. If you want a "hotel" feel and have the budget for it, I would recommend this hotel. It is way cheaper compared to nearby 3-5 star hotels, but if you don't really care for all the fancy stuff, I'd say better stay in a guest house and use your money for some shopping. :D

Reviews.Title: “Very good location...Stay in there...”
Reviews.Author: oguzk
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located very close to all attractions and shopping...The rooms are Hong Kong standard but really good value for the money. We have stayed there with our 6 years old daughter and we had no problem to reach any deserved point from the hotel. We specially would like to thank Sun(from front desk) for his help during our stay. We can recommend this hotel to evetbody…

Reviews.Title: “5 night stay at B P International in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: garrett678
Reviews.Content: We stayed at BP for 5 nights in January. We had requested a nonsmoking double room but apparently those are very few, so for our first two nights we had to sleep in a room with 2 twin beds. Only on our third day, did we manage to secure a double bed. It is a VERY busy hotel, and they have a high occupancy rate (I guess for a reason). It is in a very busy area, with tons of shopping. All the transportation needs are within a short walking distance. There is the big Kowloon Park right next door, so you can go for a nice morning stroll and see the aviary. All the major tourist sites are a short ride away so I believe this area would be perfect for any tourist coming to HK for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Martin C
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week and couldn't be happier. Comparing price to other hotels in the area, BP is a good value. Superb location near Jordan and Austin MTR and Kowloon Park. Ask for room overlooking the park towards Hong Kong. The view in the other direction is dull by comparison. Front desk is staffed by a cadre of young people who are efficient and eager to serve. Breakfast buffet has lots of choices, seemingly catering to US/Euro tastes. Rooms are kept spotless - nice linens, towels, etc. Rooms have hairdryers and safes.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: kitimat154913
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel from 2011 Jan 03 to Jan 07. We found that the price is good and the location is great (near MTR, next to Kowloon Park, within walking distance to Nathan Road shopping area). They are currently under renovation but construction is carried out only during daytime. We were not affected by noise of the construction too much because our room is not located on the top floors and we went out most of the time. The breakfast buffet at the hotel restaurant is good ( a variety of Chinese and Western breakfast choices) at a relatively affordable price when comparing with two other hotels that we stayed from Dec 22 to Jan 03. Overall we found that the staff are friendly and helpful. The front desk staff are very professional and accommodating to our requests. When we found out the double/twin bed room that our travel agent booked for us is too small for three of us (two adults and one child), we have to request for a cot. However, we could have a cot for three nights, not 4 nights because of the limited number of cots are all reserved on Jan 06. Seeing our dilemma situation, the front desk staff (Kevin) suggested that we could upgrade to a family room with two bunk beds for an additional HK$330 per night. There are only smoking family room available but Kevin let us checked out this "smoking" family room before we made a decision. We found that this family room is acceptable. As well, we think this is a good deal because the hotel charges adding a cot for HK$350 per night. This family room does not have a kettle, coffee and tea bags but Kevin arranged to have these things provided in our room. We also requested for a late check out (3:00 pm) because we have to attend a family event until 2:00 pm. The hotel policy for a free of charge late check is until 2;00 pm. The front desk staff (Kibe) was very understanding and allowed us to check out at 3:00 pm without charging us an extra amount of HK$750. We are very grateful for that.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: isayqc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in BP International from Dec 29 to Jan 3. I always trust tripadvisor on choosing hotels and I must say...it's always reliable for me. BP's location is the best in Kowloon considering the close proximity to jordan station, kowloon park which is just at the back of the hotel, very near to good eating places, few meters away to nathan road...almost every thing is at walking distance. so if you're looking for a decent and affordable hotel, BP is the one for you...the rooms are clean but a bit small...toilet is clean..linens are crisp and clean. one suggestion..if you're about four or five travelling..it's best to take the taxi from the airport...it's much cheaper and less hassle of lugging your stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Execellent choice, good value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: sunem70
Reviews.Content: Great location in Kowloon - close to Metro and the night markets. Excellen service and good value.

Reviews.Title: “CONSTRUCTION THAT VIBRATES YOUR ENTIRE ROOM EVERYDAY FROM 10AM - 5PM”
Reviews.Author: TravelinPh0t0grapher
Reviews.Content: A jackhammer makes it sound like your at war. Its constant and unbelievably loud, it vibrates the entire room and is so loud you can't even be heard during a phone call. It was so unbelievable that I left the hotel 2 days early and was refused any type of refund. I was willing to loose on the money I paid for the room just to get away from that hotel. The rooms are small and dingy, the tv was a 13 inch tube television (our we still in the 80s or what??) The beds are harder than rocks, you know the tempurpedic commercials that you can bounce with wine on the bed; the same goes for these beds except its because they are rock solid!! Probably the worst hotel I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “small ,average rooms but good value”
Reviews.Author: PeterandPatricia
Reviews.Content: an excellent location in Hong Kong. Rooms are average but tidy and clean. ...some rooms have excellent harbour-focused views as a bonus. Efficient staff here including concierge, reception staff etc. we have given this overall rating in light of its overall good value for money

Reviews.Title: “BP International - home in the city”
Reviews.Author: zhielaleene
Reviews.Content: PROS: • near ladies' market • 7-11 & McDonald's a few walks away • nice, big lobby • comfy beds • with closet & safe CONS: • slow check-in process, took us about an hour or two just to get a room (too many guests that day, based on the many luggage we've seen in the lobby) • room not that big, but spacious enough for us to walk around without bumping into each other :) DATE OF STAY was in July 2008, but I decided to write a review just today as I get more interested in travelling & seeing more countries & their culture. It was our first time in HK, so I really can't tell much about BP International. But I'll definitely recommend this hotel, and will most likely stay here again if I go back to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value for money..”
Reviews.Author: sumit0901
Reviews.Content: Date: 11th November to 16th November 2010 I should really thank tripadvisor for giving excellent reviews for this hotel. First and foremost advantage for the hotel ----- LOCATION 5 minutes walk to Jordan MRT 2 minutes walk to night market Temple Street 3 minutes walk to Nathan Road When you enter this hotel, the looks feels good. Everything is fine until you enter the room. Yes.. its small.. in fact for indian travellers like me, it really feels small. But I think in Hong Kong, size is small... small bathroom.. difficult to put 2 suitcases.. but.. ok . especially since we had planned that we wont be staying much in the hotel except for the night stay.. The breakfast was included in our price.. and nice layout.. had almost everything you want.. the only problem which i had was that i ate the same menu for the 5 days i stayed there :) Awesome service.. I wanted some extra tea bags for my room.. i tried the room service but they failed to understand my requirement.. within 2 minutes (at 1 in the night), room service was at my doorstep asking me what i wanted.. really good.. and for the rest of my stay i never had to remind them for extra tea bags.. small things.. but really appreciable.. Check in and check out was smooth.. have a different waiting lobby area..with ample space.. surely try this hotel.. u will not regret Thanks

Reviews.Title: “One of the best business Hotels in Tsim Sa Shui”
Reviews.Author: AvanapuVenu
Reviews.Content: BP International is a very good hotel which is in an excellent location. I arrived from singapore on a business trip and found the hotel extremely convenient to spot from Nathan Road. There are lot of restaurants around the hotel and the MTR and Bus stop are in a convenient distance. The hotel has a nice bed and very clean bathroom. The views were very good for harbour view room but not sure on how they are for city view rooms. The only negative thing about the hotel is that the internet is not free and you need to pay extra money for accessing the internet. Overall i can say it is a value for money hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Location great”
Reviews.Author: ExiledinAberdeen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights, great location, Jordan MTR station handy, also the bus stop is also nearby. Room clean and tidy. On the 17th floor you get a great view of HK. Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: motheroftwoin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the B P International for 2 nights. Location of the hotel was extremely central and close to most of the shopping and other attractions. Check in time is 2 pm but as they had rooms available, they were only too happy to give us a room as early as 11 am. Efficient service right from the bell boys to the front office staff. I have to compliment the concierge staff who without a complaint lifted our very heavy suitcases up to our room and down again. The room was a little on the smaller side and we were given twin beds as there were no double beds available in the non smoking floors. This was done after checking with us. The room was spotlessly clean and so was the bathroom. Each floor had a hot and cold water dispensing unit for drinking water. This was quite convenient as it saved us the bother of running and buying water everyday. Right opposite the hotel entrance was a very convenient seven eleven for odds and ends. Overall am extremely comfortable stay. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “All Essentials Covered”
Reviews.Author: MyMai87
Reviews.Content: Great location. 5 minute walk to train station, short walk to shops and restaurants. Bell boys very helpful and keen to assist with baggage however a tip may be expected. Staff were helpful in assisting with directions. However, if a smile is expected with service, it was rare to come across. The rooms were very poorly sound proofed. Walking down the corridor we were able to hear people sneezing, talking or watching tv in their rooms. BP international are currently undertaking construction therefore construction noises are quite loud towards noon. We found on this trip that some hotels may not provide affordable laundry service. BP International has a fully equipt coin laundry with a tv included! The room was clean and had adequate space. Bathroom was very small and lacked a bath tub. Despite this, the room has a great view of the city at night and from our room we could have seen the symphony of lights. We went to a few hotels for this trip and this particular hotel was by far the most expensive for the amount it provided. However, if you are looking for a simple no fuss hotel where all the essentials are covered, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “nice place...”
Reviews.Author: Kerwin225
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at bp for 4d/3n. great place! very clean. a few minutes walk to nathan road. near night market. great location. everything within the area. you can't go wrong with bp.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: TerryWrist
Reviews.Content: As my first choice in H.K. was unavailable, I ended up at BP International hotel. I was pleasantly surprised; it was a pretty nice hotel, located close to both Jordan and Austin MTR stations. It's a short walk to bustling Nathan Road. Free bus to and from the Airport Express' Kowloon station stops next door, which is convenient. Rooms are well-equipped, though the wi-fi is a bit overpriced in my opinion. Service was friendly and efficient, so I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: hamburg_girl_1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and were quite satisfied with the service/room. The room was small, but sufficient. The bathroom was also really tiny, but modern fixtures. It's air conditioned, clean, has a small tv, and a decent bed and that's all we need, so we were happy. The location of the hotel couldn't be better though. It's only a short walk to Nathan Road or the Temple street markets. Within 10 minutes you can walk to the harbour and catch a ferry to Hong Kong Island. There are several MTR stations in walking distance. The perfect location to explore the city. My only complain is internet charges. In my opinion, all hotels should provide a free internet service. And HK$100 per day, this charge is a rip-off. Overall BP International is a value for money property for people who want to enjoy the city rather than stay in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable experience^^”
Reviews.Author: Erika21
Reviews.Content: We stayed in their city view room which was very clean,and nice.The room attendants were very courteous, and the entire hotel was very classy. The interiors were modern,and the bed was quite big, so we didn't have any problem to share it with my 7 year old son. We will definitely go back here again for our family vacation next year!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel located in a great area”
Reviews.Author: dannoray
Reviews.Content: The hotel was average, clean and comfy. There was a mix up with the room we reserved but the staff was quick to correct. The rooms aren't spacious but the beds are comfy and the rooms are quiet. The hotel is located in a great area, minutes away from the subway and Temple street vendors and Nathan Street shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for experiencing Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: ifiruledtheworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice for two nights as stop-overs on the way to and from New Zealand. We picked the hotel because it seemed well located for getting around Hong Kong and to/from the airport and were not disapointed. The aiport train and free shuttle bus drops you off next door. The hotel is close to 3 underground stations so you can easily get around Hong Kong using the MTR. Or you can walk through the park and be at the ferry terminal within 20 mins. We were very pleased that the hotel gave us an upgrade to a superior room on our first stay, it was very spacious and had a good view. The standard room we had on the second stay was not as luxurious but still adequate (we missed somethings like the nice bathroom supplies), but we were happy that they at least had a room available when we arrived from our flight at 6am. The rooms are not too well sound-proofed, especially the ones close to the lifts. Overall, the hotel was a good choice because it was close to many shops and restaurants and the MTR so we could get around to visit the sights. If you're visiting Hong Kong for the first time I'd recommend visiting the Big Buddha (Tian Tan Buddha) located at Ngong Ping, Lantau Island. The Stanley market and Ladies market are great for bargain hunting. You can't really go wrong with the dim sum in any restaurant, although if you're ordering from the menu sometimes it can be hard to fathom what you are ordering. Near the S.W. corner of Kowloon park is a mall with a huge food court offering cuisine from all over Asia.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location, nice room, and great service.”
Reviews.Author: smokedsalmon
Reviews.Content: Great overall experience! The location itself (right next to Kowloon Park!) is well worth the money. Like lots of HK hotels, there are tons of restaurants within a 3 block radius (including Australia Dairy Company on Parker St). It's also only 5 min away from both the Austin and Jordan MTR stations. Best of all, it's close to the Kowloon MTR station (for the Airport Express), which is located in Elements, another gigantic HK shopping mall. The room was nice and clean, and the staff were very friendly. Added bonus - has coin-operated self-service laundry in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room - Awesome View”
Reviews.Author: RupZ
Reviews.Content: BP International is at the heart of the Place to be in Hong Kong. The rooms are bit smaller, so its not a hotel for honeymooners. However its the location that takes the cake. Just walking distance to the harbour, Go for an evening stroll and watch the Symphony of Lights or walk down the Avenue of Stars or shop around in the numerous malls around the area. If you are Non-smokers, ask for a room in the Non-smoking floor and ask for a harbour view. They first gave us a room with a bad view but when we went back to the reception they changed it gladly for us. The Kowloon Park just behind the hotel is also an excellent place to walk and enjoy the beauty. The hotel provides with free water in the pantry on every floor, which will save you some bucks. Lot of supermarkets and restaurants in vicinity. Overall BP International is a value for money property for people who want to enjoy the city rather than stay in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Waltz2
Reviews.Content: I was staying in Hong Kong for a couple of days prior to the arrival of my girlfriend. I was looking for somewhere cheap and cheerful to stay in a decent location, and BP was just that. The room itself is on the small side, and with basic facilities, but everything is clean, well-presented, and works. I got a room on the top floor which has some great views of the city. It's not an expensive hotel, and I thought it represented extremely good value, mainly because of the locations. It's in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui, very close to lots of shopping, sightseeing, bars, restaurants, and subway. For a well-located, basic but good value hotel you won't go wrong with this.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & service, coupled with great service recovery”
Reviews.Author: OrEmuN
Reviews.Content: I have chosen BP Int'l based on my budget and reviews on tripadvisor and I am glad that I and my spouse have not been disappointed. The service rendered was good 1. We emailed to BP Int about the Airport Express free shuttle before the trip and was given prompt and clear response. 2. Request for a high-flr room and subsequently a change of room due to the beds are accomodated. They even made arrangement to shift our luggage to the new room after we leave the previous room for the day. 3. Service was pleasant and helpful. No problem with checking whatsoever. After our trip, we came to realise that our credit card was charged with some items that we didn't consume. We emailed them about it and to our pleasant surprise, it was waived after our explanation. It was great service recovery as we were upset over this as it was unfair to us to pay for unconsumed items and BP Int did a great job in refunding our credit card company for the charges. All in all, it is a good value hotel, located in the heart of Kowloon (you can take a 5 min walk to either Austin/Jordan MTR) and we will definitely stay in this hotel, should we visit HK again.

Reviews.Title: “right where it matters !!!”
Reviews.Author: wildpepper
Reviews.Content: Chose the BP Intnl Hotel after a lot of deliberation and a lot of hours of reading various reviews. BP in the name stands for Baden Powell the founder of the Scouts Movement. So expect a lot of children and people around. Though the reception of the hotel is on the ground floor. The hotel actually starts from the 14th Floor. There is a coffee shop on the UG level and a self service laundry on the 13th floor. few floors in the middle are for parking and about 5 floors are of the HK Scout association. Dont expect a quite and peaceful reception area, its always full and with a lot of people around. The Concierge always seems to be full of luggage !!!! All in all.. a good lively atmosphere. Rooms: The rooms are small. I guess that this is a predicament for almost all hotels in HK so one should be ready for it. There is No Room service, though there is tea coffee making facilities and a mini bar in the room. The guys at the coffee shop were accommodating enough to heat up the tetra pack of milk for my daughter every morning. Each floor has a water filter and shoe polishing machine in the pantry. Ask for a higher floor, harbour facing room. The view of the HK skyline and the Kowloon park, more than makes up for the small confines of the room. The double bed was a bit cramped for us as we had our 2 year old daughter with us and we had not asked for extra bed. ( I doubt an extra bed would have fitted in the room though:-) ) But the bed should be adequate for two adults. A must check out is the Hon Po Palace restaurant in the basement of the hotel... yummy dimsums and other stuff. Location of the hotel is its main attraction. Smack in the centre of Kowloon. The Night market, The ladies Market, Avenue of Stars, Harbour City, Heritage, HK Space museum.....etc etc... everything is in easy reach. max 15-20 mins walking. or one can go to the Jordan MTR which is a five minute walk. Jordan MTR connects you to Central or Admiralty from where one can go to the Peak tram or the Ocean Park respectively The hotel offers a Airport Coach to go to the Airport priced at HKD 100 per person. But if you are group of 3 to 4 people then taking a taxi is more economical as it takes just 230 HKD for the trip.

Reviews.Title: “disaster committed in m life”
Reviews.Author: anujIndia
Reviews.Content: looking at the reviews i decided to stay in bp international with my family and friends in hong kong. my first shock was that my flight had got cancelled so i reached a day later although i informed the hotel way in advance regarding my delay but they increased the rates on the changed dates. the reception staff at the check in was a bit ok . when we reached the rooms we were shocked as they were too small i had opted for harbour view which was hardly the same. the beds were too small and the bathroom was a disaster it was so small that u can hardly stand. when the bell boy got my luggage he was after me to give him a tip and remained after me for the tip during the whole stay. in the morning we went for the breakfast since the breakfast was only free for adults we decided that children will not have the breakfast but they accompanied with us to the resturant and to my surprise i first time happened in my life that the restaurant manger kept walking behind them finally i had to send my children back to the room. finally when we were checking out the reception staff was very rude he misbehaved with us and was very rude and misbehaved with us made certain remarks on our appearance and behaved with us as if we were dogs. they also added breakfast charges in ou bill for the children entering the restuarant when i argued and asked them to show my voucher they conceded and waived it off. finally it was a worst experiance of my life staying in bp and will never recommend anyone to satay there. avoid it or u will spoil ur holiday i think it is a racist hotel.

Reviews.Title: “VALUE FOR MONEYAND ANICE PLACE TO STAY IN HONGKONG”
Reviews.Author: dharini-23
Reviews.Content: B P International is a good and reasonable hotel to stay ,situated in Kowloon area,which is very accesible and close to the main areas in hongkong.decor is excellent,rooms are good sized by hongkong standards,rates are reasonble with breakfast included but the menu does not cange which makes it a little boring when you stay for over a week.The only problem we faced was that our flight from India arrived at 5.30am local time and their check in time is 2.00 pm which makes it very inconvienient and tiring since we are flying through the night.On repeated requests they alloted a room at 12.00noon but after a great deal of pleading.so a lilttle flexibility in check in time would make it a still better place to say

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic view.”
Reviews.Author: TiberiusVerax
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the BP International a number of times and do so for two basic reasons, its location and the fantastic views across Kowloon Park, including sections of Victoria Harbour. Book a Harbour View room and ask for a high floor (Istayed on the 20th), it is well worth the extra cost. Located in Kowloon, the hotel is a short walk to the main shopping areas of Tsim Sha Tsui, there are handy shops such as Wellcome just across the road and Jordan MTR station is only a few minutes away. It is also within walking distance to tourist attractions such as Nathan Road and Temple Street should you wish to subject yourself to such activities. The service at the reception desk is efficient although a smile would make it even more pleasant (why don't Hong Kong hotels teach their staff this simple gesture?)! The airconditioning is excellent and easily adjustable. Rooms are not huge but a comfortable size for Hong Kong. Give breakfast a miss, there are plenty of shops around offering a more interesting, local fare. My main issue is internet charges. In my opinion, all hotels should provide a free internet service as BP International did on my previous visit. At HK$100 per day, this charge is a blatant rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: qqq266
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews from Trip Advisor and being told how small the rooms are from my cousin when she stayed there, I had tempered expectations. But our rooms on the 22nd floor were larger than expected. The beds were harder than we were used to but we were told to expect that too, The location is a great though.
