We walked to the Temple Street night market every night since it was so close. Both the Jordan and Tsim Sha Tsui MTR stations are short walks away. So were shopping on Nathan Road, Canton Road and the harbor. I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great hotel if you're not expecting 5 stars.”
Reviews.Author: Discursus
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked us at BP International and we checked it out. The year before we had scrimped and ended up staying in a crappy hotel, plus the fact that several reviews on Trip Advisor mentioned the small rooms, overall we were prepared and weren't expecting much from the rooms. The lobby was nice and big, and there were several elevators so we didn't need to wait long. We didn't have to wait long to check in. Strangely, we didn't even have to show a credit card when we checked in. They easily gave us three rooms beside each other, and while small, the rooms were plenty big for us Asians. The beds were nice and firm and a desk by the window with a built in hairdryer. Cable was good too. There was only one pillow per twin bed and it seemed a little thin, but the covers were nice and warm. The bathrooms were a little small, but the shower was nice and strong. The water though, if you turn the knob a little more than right between hot and cold was scalding hot. But the toilets were good. Breakfast buffet wasn't included and the price of the buffets were pretty steep. I had passed by one morning to check it out, but it didn't look that impressive so I passed. Internet isn't free (100 HKD per day) so you're lucky if you can find access to the free Hong Kong Government wifi. The best part about the hotel is it's location. It's got two money exchangers, a Wellcome, 711 and K Circle right out front. It's a five minute walk to the Austin MTR on the Purple Line (the hotel advertises a three minute walk to the Jordan MTR on the Red Line (the Austin MTR is actually closer! But the Red Line is the more popular line). The hotel is also a five to ten minute walk from China Hong Kong City Mall (where you can take a ferry to Macau) and Harbour City Mall aka Gateway Avenue. There are several places beside these malls where you can shop your heart out. The people at the front desk were friendly, and there were always enough of them to help out. Check out wasn't even five minutes! Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable, spic & span”
Reviews.Author: achuchennai
Reviews.Content: Located in downtown Hong Kong, BP is ideally located. Within reach of the waterfront and other places of tourist interest, the hotel has an interesting connection with the Scout movement : hence BP ( Baden Powell, the founder of Scouts movement) The hotel is spic and span, brassware gleaming and glasswork shining. When I reached there in the midst of the swine flu scare, extra care taken by the hotel was obvious. Rooms were a bit disappointing in size, but I believe it is the norm in space starved HK. Service at the reception was abit mechanical, not really very curteous to their guests, but room service was much better. Restaurant was good, but teh breakfasts were repetitive. The foyer is impressive, especially with its winding stairs and a statue of Lord BP. Value for money, though not very customer oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,affordable price,”
Reviews.Author: Bombil
Reviews.Content: B.P is located bang opposite temple street market,which is hub of cheap street side shopping in Hongkong.It is close to Jordan MTR station.though the room size is not very big but view from even city view room is good.The service is not that fast.Kowloon park is located next to this hotel you can access its swimming pool for 19 HKD.There is a 7/11 store bang opposite this hotel ,you can get your daily hot breakfast from this store.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: savio88
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from the 14th to 19th of april 2010 n loved every moment of my stay. reception check in was highly professional ambience in hotel top class. breakfast buffet total value for money. rooms though small very chic got to see the laser shows at night. location simply fantastic all the street markets close by and one cud get to the avenue of stars easily. highly recommended to any and everyone as its total value for money.

Reviews.Title: “I would not go back”
Reviews.Author: litaUk
Reviews.Content: We arrived from a long flight in the middle of the night to a not very friendly reception. Got to our room on the 23rd floor to find key not working. We trailed all the way back down to reception and back up to find there were 2 tiny beds in the room despite paying for 3 beds. After speaking to reception who were adamant I had not requested or indeed paid for a 3rd bed they demanded a further payment from me. I went back to receptio again (23 floors down) and was told it was ok they had found my booking and would send a bed to our room(no appology). How a 3rd bed went into that TINY room i do not know. The rooms are described by people on this site as small but they really are! There was an ashtray in the bathroom which clearly shows smoking is allowed! Cleanliness was ok but not great. The beds were the most uncomfortable I have ever slept in. The walls was paper thin(we had to complain about the noise next door). Drinks were overpriced (nearly £4.50 for a coffee in the bar) Breakfast ok. The evening buffett looked nice when we went in, but once you actually have a good look you realise most of it is for the asian palate and most was unedible to us. In fact we didnt even know what half of it was! To sum it up probably the worst hotel I have stayed in!!

Reviews.Title: “pretentiously over-priced disappointment”
Reviews.Author: whiteflyman
Reviews.Content: I transferred to the B P International (where B P stands for Baden Powell, former leader of the scouting movement) from the nearby Evergreen in Yau Ma Tei (see my review of that) to provide my wife with a more memorable experience for her short visit to join me after a business trip. The rooms are well over twice the price of the Evergreen and, yes, you get a huge lobby to walk into. I paid extra for a "harbour parkview" room, on the side overlooking Kowloon Park and parts of the island. The view was pretty nice, despite the number of buildings that are now in the way. However, the window was very grubby, which is no way to present one of a hotel's main features. The room was small and not very clean. Worse, it was clearly still being used for smokers - and I thought all civilised hotels had outlawed that nasty habit in their rooms. Breakfast and internet are extras here, in contrast to the excellent Evergreen. All in all, I would say that this hotel needs to either upgrade the rooms and provide included breakfast and free net use, or reduce its prices significantly. Not recommended at the price.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable enough if you'll be away all day!”
Reviews.Author: starfish2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my teenage siblings just a week ago, with a two night booking from their website. They get your credit card details online as a guarantee but do not charge anything on it. They say that they will charge you a one-night tariff with a week to your booking date as security deposit, but this wasn't the case with us. All payments were actually settled and signed during check out. Negatives ~ We were three with a city view room (two twin beds) and an extra bed so it was a bit of a squeeze. There is some room under the desk where you could store your luggage but the extra bed made access to this space very difficult. So we had to make do with our luggage on the floor and a few inches space to walk on. Not much, but it wasn't a deal-breaker. We were out most of the day anyway. There are signs everywhere of B P International being a no-smoking hotel, so it was quite strange that our room and bathroom smelled somewhat like cigarettes when we got there. We did not complain about this since it was not that bothersome for us. With the a/c left on, it went away after some hours so no problem. Positives ~ We slept comfortably in our beds, though narrower than normal twin beds, but the small size of the room made it quite cozy. With 500 plus rooms in the hotel, I expected to hear disturbing sounds but there never was any. I remember not wanting to get up from bed, thinking it was 6am because it was so quiet, but in fact was already around 9am. Bathroom was spotless, no complaints about this at all. Housekeeping was incredibly helpful, lending us everything from a 220 adaptor to a pair of scissors, and when asked, immediately bringing over an extra set of towels for our third person. No complaints about their service. Buffet breakfasts were not extensive but more than enough! I do remember them serving the same food every day.. bacon, hashbrowns, scrambled egg, fried rice, asian noodles, sausages, congee. There were also stations for cereal, salad and bread, and eggs. 85HKD per head definitely worth it. B P is a block away from Jordan MTR station.. easily reached with lots of local flavor around. Kowloon park just behind, and Chinese noodle shops, seafood restos, 711s and Wellcome supermarket just in front of the hotel. Money changers also just around the corner. We were actually billed for less than expected, and had no problem cancelling an online booking to take their shuttle back to their airport on our last day. The experience was pretty seamless, and given proximity to MTR and being right smack in the city, would likely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Sunny_SJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the first stop of our Asian trip and I am so glad we stayed at B P International. A local source recommended it and the hotel delivered on all counts. We had a small standard room with twin beds on the 21rst floor with a city view. The decor is modern and simple. The beddings are excellent. The bathroom is SPOTLESS. The hotel is not luxurious, but it is tastefully presented. There is a restaurant next door on the left, which serves decent dimsum . The hotel itself has a good breakfast buffet for about $10 USD per person. The location is in the middle of Kowloon, within 5mins walk to metro stations, and in the middle of shopping centers and eateries. A great base to explore Hong Kong! I am taking away one star, not giving the full five, because you have to pay for wireless internet in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and a Nice Place to Stay.”
Reviews.Author: alexme18
Reviews.Content: We had a late check in and they ran out of queen size bed thus me and hubby slept on 2 separate single beds but that's ok with us=) Location is great. Breakfast is also great except that the next day they will serve the same thing but that's ok. In front of the hotel has 711, wellcome and circle K(convenience stores). Overall I would recommend this to all travelers.

Reviews.Title: “excellent position, good value, not noisy”
Reviews.Author: mik11
Reviews.Content: I read so many reviews about Hong Kong hotels that I was a bit worried about very small rooms or dirty an noisy places. BP has been a positive confirmation of other reviews I read in this site. BP double room has a decent room for moving and placing even a big suitcase, no extra space but all we needed and confortable beds. toilet is surely small but shower provides a good size. only a few clothes can be hanged or stored in the two drawers, but Hong Kong is not north pole thus you don't need so many clothes The posititon is execellent you can walk to a third of the things you want to do or see if your are sightseeing Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...”
Reviews.Author: TheIceman01
Reviews.Content: Just back from a great stay at the BP. Contact the hotel to have them book the shuttle for you from the airport. Although a bit of a scenic tour, worth not having to deal with the train and then a bus. Room was small, but very clean. Do upgrade to a harbour view. Bathroom small but clean and functional. Room recently renovated. Water dispenser near elevator for cold and hot water. Very handy for tea in the mornings. Location of hotel is easy walking to Temple Street, Nathan Road, Ferry terminal. Definitely stay here again. Only complaint is the hard mattress. Need to get some softer beds.

Reviews.Title: “NICE LOCATION, GREAT HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: yu234723
Reviews.Content: Very nice. Close to everything, right beside Kowloon park, you have to go there. Plenty to see, very nice, quiet and nice to walk around. Hotel is a bit dated, but it did offer everything I needed, comfortable bed, nice mini bar, clean washroom..... one thing is TV is old, small, but it worked... Controller didnt. Maybe it ran out of battery, but it was ok. Nice view, and close to Seven 11. Gotta try Garlic noodle!!! It's one of the best noodles I have tried in Hong kong!!! People, try, it's good, and it was only 6.20 HKG dollar, which is only around 50 cents? Anyway, it was worth it. Will stay here again... =)

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT.”
Reviews.Author: bellybuster87
Reviews.Content: Great hotel highly reccomended. comfortable and very friendly staff. lovely food to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: cinc123
Reviews.Content: I would recommend The BP International Hotel to anyone and be happy to stay again. It has a great location, clean rooms and a friendly staff...What more could anyone want? I requested a room on a higher floor and got it and had a lovely view of the harbor...even if was a few blocks from the waterfront. It is not posh or elegant but it is great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Better than others!!”
Reviews.Author: rickyrose
Reviews.Content: So far, this is better than other hotels that I have checked-in. It is near the shopping district (night market) and MTR station (Jordan) where you can go everywhere you like while in HK. Just ask the hotel staff for directions and they are glad to help. Every staff I have spoken understands English. It should be the best, however, its too bad that the rooms are small.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel and good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: yorkspuds
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights to break up our journey to Melbourne. Hotel is conveniently located at the top of Kowloon Park - which is a pleasant, if fairly steep route, to the hotel. The rooms are 'boxy' but clean and adequate - we had a city view which was fine. We found the staff to be pleasant and helpful. Our deal, which was excellent at around £53 per night for the room, did not include breakfast. However, we did take breakfast here on one morning. It wasn't anything special but adequate at £6 per person. If we were in Hong Kong again, we would happily stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Chrisaw14
Reviews.Content: This is indeed a hidden gem so close to Nathan Road, Star Ferry, Metro, Ocean Terminal, Kowloon Park at back, views of the harbour. Very friendly and helpfull staff, we had room upgrade and view of Harbour for National Day fireworks. Good food, great cocktail bar with snacks, friendly bar staff and artists (singer and pinao player) Met lots of nice people here. Room was fairly large and extremely clean.

Reviews.Title: “It was better than what I've expected”
Reviews.Author: infinitine
Reviews.Content: Before booking this hotel through my travel agent, I made sure to check out the comments on TA. After reading a few of them, I've decided to book it. I wasn't expecting much as it'll be my third time visiting HK and I know how small the rooms usually are. When I arrived at around 8PM HK time, the receptionist told me that there are no more double rooms left, so she offered me a night in the family version and will move our luggages the next day. The family room consists of 4 bunk-bed. Considering the small room space, the room was quite small. My sister and I were always scared to hit our heads. However, the room was clean. The next day, we moved in a twin-bed room on the 20th floor. That room was pretty nice. The view is ok and we didn't have to worry about hitting our head. We took the Airport Express bus A21 and got off at the Jordan MTR station and walked for a few minutes. When leaving, we took the taxi and cost us less than $300HKD. Stayed there for 6 nights and we were only two girls. GOOD: - nice location, just 3 minutes of walking to Jordan MTR station with lots of restaurants around the area - bathroom is clean - room was cleaned everyday (beds / covers were comfy) - lobby people spoke English pretty ok with us and were helpful when we had questions - felt safe walking at night by ourselves BAD: - small area (well, it's HK) - old TV (who cares... it's not like I stayed in the room for the tv) - no wi-fi internet (the internet costs $40 HKD for 4 straight hours) I would definitely go back... I haven't tried their restaurant...

Reviews.Title: “Suited us to a tee”
Reviews.Author: timandamywedding
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real gem in the heart of Kowloon. The rooms were a little on the tight side, but most accomodation in Hong Kong is like that. It was nicely decorated though and we had two bunk beds. A/C worked well, there is a self serve laundry in the hotel which was great to catch up on some laundry!! The location of the hotel was excellent, there was a supermarket across the road and downstairs, easy walk to the night markets, and also to Nathan Road, and Canton Road to the ferry terminal to take you across to Hong Kong Island. Another reason we picked this hotel was it was well priced and Kowloon Park was right behind it, making it a great place to escape the noise of the city and relax. We would recommend BP International and would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Location, Good enough!”
Reviews.Author: 880imvip
Reviews.Content: B P International is a really nice 4 star hotel in downtown. Very close to lots of shopping, the street markets and also accessible to the metro stations. I personally love walking around to get the feeling im in a different country. The location is Purffect just about 10 mins from the Airports Metro station... it is just purfect for the single or companied traveler. I woudl reccommend this hotel because is extremely clean and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Stay”
Reviews.Author: tokid
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed two separate stays at the BP International Hotel in Hong Kong in January, 2010. We booked through Agoda and Expedia asking for non-smoking doubles each time. All non-smoking floors are located near the top and provide excellent city and harbor views. Our rooms were pre-booked and the only complaint I have is that our request for a double was not automatically provided and I had to argue to receive the same. Otherwise excellent service and very friendly staff. Hotel provides a free shuttle to the Kowloon Airport Express station. Also free internet is available at two kiosks in the bar for hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Economical; Good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: MundaneMuser
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is that its centrally located in the Kowloon Area, and the hotspots of Kowloon are extremely nearby. Also, there's an MTR station just few meters away from the hotel, which is extremely convenient, as travelling by the underground is the best way to go around Hong Kong. I'd suggest this hotel to whoever is looking for a nice and comfortable room to stay at night, with the necessary facilities. But if you're looking for good service and a leisure stay, then this one is surely not for you. The rooms are sufficiently comfy, but not very spacious and at times, get claustrophobic. But that was not an issue for us, as our priority was to visit as much of Hong Kong, as possible. So everyday, we used to leave the Hotel after breakfast in the morning, and return late at night only. So after an exhausting day of travelling, we used to just crash on our beds and revive ourselves for the next day. So considering all these factors, it was an overall good experience and not a heavy one on our pockets either.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_doro
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights after 8 nights in a tiny guest house style place. So I thought this hotel was really nice. The lobby was really new and had a gorgeous christmas tree. Our room was motel style, but I thought it was great, spacious, clean, and had an amazing view of the city with a big window. Had a cupboard, in room safe, bathroom was fine everything was clean and worked well. Bed was amazing after so many nights in a rock hard bed. Had manager on call 24/7 to help you with anything you needed, in our case when we ran out of toilet paper!! The location was really good, just about 100m from Nathan Rd and hardly any further to the subway. You could walk either way down Nathan Rd and find lots of shopping and interesting things. We ate at the buffet for dinner. It was really nice, though I stuck mostly to the things I knew. They had lots of hot and cold dishes, and had a bbq area where the chefs cooked prawns, fish, kebabs etc for you. Nice desserts and drinks, and waiters were always clearing your plate so you didn't have that big pile at the end! Also drank at the bar, and enjoyed all you could drink from 9-12pm for $150 HK (about $30 NZ) which we thought was a wonderful bargain. Had breakfast at the buffet which was nice nothing too exciting had the normal western style scrambled eggs, bacon, hashbrowns as well as some asian dishes. All in all I loved staying here and my boyfriend loved it too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lien_Le
Reviews.Content: Our family stay in BP International from 27-30/12/2009. The room was very clean and the cleaner was very nice. The room was small for a family of 4, but the hotel still manages to have 4 beds in it. There is no bar nor drinking water in the room and you have to go out to the floor store, where the soft drink is sold from automats and water is provided for free. The breakfast is basic, but have choices for all. Ưhat I like most there is the adjacent Kowloon Park, which is very beautiful. You can see many interesting corners there, such as the bird places, the Chinese Garden, etc. You can enter the park from many ways and all free.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, enjoyable experience.”
Reviews.Author: passenger94
Reviews.Content: This is a large and very busy hotel, I found the service to be very good and the staff always helpful. The room was a reasonable size, clean and comfortable, my only complaint being given a smoking room. The breakfast is quite a large affair and includes a full buffet of cooked items, of which some can be a little cold, they also serve freshly cooked pancakes as well as very good made to order omelettes. The hotel is in a great location and I would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. So easy to get to.”
Reviews.Author: ringer77
Reviews.Content: Located beside Kowloon park. Lovely to walk around the park. Easy to walk around Kowloon from here. Pretty good breakfast. Very friendly staff- accomodated us with an earlt check-in. Plenty of restaurants nearby serving very tasty local food.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: AW-Sing
Reviews.Content: We booked a family room (2 bunk beds) through DirectRooms.com on 24 Sept at HKD990 per night with American Breakfast and HKD770.50 per night without breakfast. We stayed at BP Intl on Nov 25-28, 2009. On 25th, we left Macau via First Ferry, arrived at China Ferry Terminal, Tsimshatsui and walked to BP Intl which took about 15mins. Check-in was smooth and our room was on the 15th floor, facing apartment/office buildings. The room was small but clean. The mattresses on the lower bunk beds were rather worn-out (sunk-in in the middle) while the upper bunk mattresses were more firm. Stiff foam pillows were provided. It was only at night that there was the smell of cigarette smoke in the room and traffic noise could be heard. Basic toiletries, 2 bedroom slippers, hairdryer were provided. Free in-room internet is not included. American Breakfast on the UG Floor level was satisfactory. Toast, cereal, congee, ham, bacon, eggs, fruit juices, coffee/tea, etc were served. F&B staff were quick and efficient. We chose to stay at BP Intl because of its location. A 10 min walk to Jordan MTR and numerous eateries, bakeries and convenience stores just at the doorstep. As we walked to and from the hotel, we were approached by many people handing out leaflets, selling property in Hong Kong, I think, waiting on the footpath along Austin Road outside the TST police station. After the first day, we avoided most of them by walking on the opposite side of the road instead. We walked along Nathan Road, to Granville Road, to Canton Road/Harbour City during the time we were there. If we were tired at the end of the day, there are many buses plying along Nathan Road for us to hop on. As mentioned by the Hong Kong Experts, it was very convenient for us to take Bus A21 to HKIA. The bus-stop is just round the corner of TST Police Station, along Nathan Road. We waited for 10 mins and the bus journey took about 50 mins as there was hardly any traffic at 8am on Saturday morning. Overall, we had a pleasant stay at BP Intl. As we were out for most of the day, the room served its purpose for us to rest at night before we went out again the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, OK price”
Reviews.Author: Froggy2Denmark
Reviews.Content: It had been hard for us to find a suitable hotel for our family of four (2 adults, 2 children age 8 and 10) that wasn't either too expensive or too far away from everything. Very few hotels in Hong Kong have rooms for more than 2 people and one extra bed – it's next to impossible to find anything with room for 4 persons. Two interconnecting rooms would have been an option, except that the Hong Kong hotels are so expensive - we could not afford two separate rooms. But the BP International has 4-person rooms available with bunk beds. All the standard rooms at the BP International are small and with two bunk beds it WAS a bit cramped, but it was quite cosy in its own right, and it worked well enough for us for the four nights we were there. We were on the 14th floor which I think is the lowest room floor. We hadn't expected much of a view, but we could actually see the harbour from our room. The location is good – it's only about 10 minutes' walk to the Jordan metro station and also in walking distance to the ferry pier. Our only complaint was that it was very cold in the restaurant where we had breakfast. Air conditioning can be problem in many places (often too cold) but it was particularly cold at the BP. We wore shorts and t-shirts as it was very warm outside, and we actually had to go back up to the room and get our jumpers while we were in the restaurant. But other than that, we had a good stay at the BP.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Clean, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Number66
Reviews.Content: OK, the rooms are on the small side, but at least there is walking room all around the bed, there's desk space with a chair, and space to store luggage out of the way. Anyway, when staying in a place like Hong Kong, there's not the need for a large room, since you're out most of the time. We paid a little extra to guarantee a high-up room facing the harbour, and I think it was money well spent, as the views were fantastic. There was an excellent view of the nightly light show from our room, and on the radio there's an FM station which transmits the music to accompany the light show. The check-in and check-out service was quick and efficient, and there was no problem in leaving bags prior to our check-in time and after our check-out time. The room was immaculately clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SunnyDTraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms here (Rooms 1136 and 1137) using my flight miles for one night just to get our bearings in Hong Kong. I booked this room based upon reading the other reviews on TripAdvisor. This hotel is easily accessed via the CityFlyer bus ($33 HKD) which drops you off near the Jordan MTR (Prudential hotel/Prudential Center). It is about 3 blocks away from where the bus drops you off. The hotel is a bit north of the other hotels in the Tsim Sha Sui area and is on Austin Road just on the northern border of Kowloon Park. I booked the cheaper City View rooms, but was upgraded to two Harbor view rooms with excellent views of the Park and Victoria Harbor. Check-in was quick and easy and the staff spoke flawless English. We had arrived a bit early (2pm) and they were able to let us into our rooms early. The elevators are a bit small and fit only about 8-10 people in them, but were fast and we noticed that they put a little note indicating that the buttons were disinfected every hour. (Hong Kong is very pro-active about keeping things clean apparently and we saw this throughout town). There is a Wellcome grocery store and 7-11 across the street from the hotel which is convenient for snacks. There are also many restaurants within walking distance. Again, the MTR is within walking distance which is very handy for touring Hong Kong. The rooms were indeed on the small side, but did not make me feel claustrophobic (it was not as bad as described by some other posters and I had anticipated the worst). The rooms were clean. We had two rooms with two singles and a great view. The rooms included a refrigerator, hair dryer, water boiling carafe and coffee service. I was not sure if the bottled water was complimentary so did not use it. We asked for ice and it was promptly delivered but there was no way for us to get the ice ourselves if we wanted a refill (the staff would have needed to be called to get us more). The bathroom was very small but did include the usual amenities such as shampoo, conditioner, body gel, comb, toothbrush/paste and slippers. As reported in the other posts, on the second day, for some odd reason, both rooms smelled of smoke even though we were on a non-smoking floor. However, the smell went away once we turned on the Air Conditioner. Also, the hotel does not have a pool, but did have a restaurant (which we did not try). Overall, I enjoyed my brief stay here, and I would recommend it to others who want to stay in Hong Kong. It is clean, in a good location and has all the basic amenities you need. It certainly is a more basic hotel (along the lines of a Holiday Inn) but does have all that is needed for someone who is going to be out seeing the sites and not sitting in the hotel all day.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: TerraCottaSoldiers
Reviews.Content: Two other friends and I stayed here for a week from Nov. 6 to the 13th. We had two bunk beds (shown in the picture), and although the room was small for 3 people, it was adequate enough, and it was an average size Hong Kong room. The girl at the front desk even upgraded us to a harbor view room as well. The rooms were clean, and the service was great. Going on vacation, these are the two qualities I look for in a hotel, because all I want is a clean place to sleep, while I explore the city. This hotel was under $100/night and was ideal for my stay. Location- Location was great, it was a short 5 minute/2 short blocks walk to the Jordan MTR station from BP International. Jordan is only several stops away from stops such as Tsim Sha Tsui, Mong Kok, Central, Causeway Bay. These are several stops that I went to often. Kowloon Park is located right next to the hotel, so for those who like to work out (swim, jog, daily pull ups/pushups), this park is great. A great dim sum restaurant is right next to this hotel as well. The Tsim Sha Tsui harbour, where the Avenue of Stars/Bruce Lee statue/8pm light show is located, is only 15-20 minute walk from the hotel. Also at the harbour, you can take a day trip to Macau. Victoria's Peak- Take the MTR to the Admiralty station, and exit out where Hong Kong park is, through Hong Kong park, you can take the tram to the peak. OR you can just take taxi to the peak (around 40-50 HKD). This is only about 3 stops or so from the Jordan station by the hotel. 8pm Light show at the harbour- 15-20 min. walk from hotel, or take the taxi from the hotel, it would be 5 min. or less and would cost about 20 hkd or less. The Hong Kong museums and space museums are here as well, right next to the harbour. Lan Kwai Fong (bars and clubs full of foreigners)- Take the MTR to Central, and exit D. This is about 4 stops or so from the Jordan exit. Ladies Market- Located in Mong Kok, is only one stop away from the Jordan exit. This is a place where you can do a lot of souvenir shopping. There are also many stores that sell athletic gear, with many Nike stores and shopping malls in this area. The Langham Mall is also here as well. Stanley Market- Take the MTR to Central, it's only 4 stops or so away from Jordan. From the Jordan station, go to the bus station right outside, and take the bus to Stanley. The bus will indicate if it's going to Stanley or not, several buses will take you there. Knutsford Terrace- a strip of nice bars and restaurants. You can walk from your hotel which will take about 15-20 min or take the MTR to Tsim Sha Tsui, which is one stop away. Ocean Park- Take the MTR to Admiralty, which is about 3 stops or so from the Jordan MTR, and take the bus from Admiralty. Staying next to the MTR station in Hong Kong will make your trip in HK very convenient, which makes BP International an ideal place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Harbour view rooms”
Reviews.Author: Matt_Standage
Reviews.Content: This is your typical Hong Kong hotel. It is well located at the top of Kowloon Park with direct access to all the attractions of Kowloon and Hong Kong Island Rooms are clean but quite small (which is normal for Hong Kong). If you can go for a harbour view the view of Hong Kong Island is impressive All in all a good hotel it the centre of town

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: AuntieSimone
Reviews.Content: Great location if you just want to break your journey and go shopping and especially to the night markets. Hotel is clean, but the rooms can be very small- only a problem when you ask for a triple room. Check-in staff are rude and angry even when they're not busy and we had to wait until after 4pm for our room to be ready - we arrived at 11am. We had asked for 2 non-smoking rooms and 1 smoking room and they completely disregarded this request even though I'd made it 6 months prior. They did offer the smoker a non-smoking room though, so I guess that was helpful? They made us wait in the corridor while they added a rubbishy looking fold out bed to a small double room to make into a triple. It was so small that none of the 3 people could open their suitcases. When we complained they did move them, but back into a smoking room (!) which was quite a bit bigger. All in all, the staff are rude, disobliging and stuffed it all up anyway. The manager was the only nice one on the front desk and did what he could to help. I had to stand by while a female behind the desk berated a colleague in a very unprofessional display which made me very uncomfortable and him even more so. She was totally unsuited to her job. After all the schamozzle, I realised how much their prices had increased in 2 years and was embarrassed that I'd suggested the place to my family who had to pay a considerable amount for a pretty rubbish room and experience. They need to drop their prices and get some better desk staff. We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Very Clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: business_travel99
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about the location. Right off Nathan Road. About a 3 min walk to the MTR station. Staff very friendly and willing to help. The only drawback is, there's no pool or fitness center. Otherwise, you'll be pleasantly surprised. Great view of HK island from the room.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant location!”
Reviews.Author: mayantravel
Reviews.Content: 2 MTR stations within 5 minutes walk (Jordan and Austin). Nathan Road and all its shops round the corner; Kowloon Park next door; 15 minutes walk to the harbour front, Star Ferry terminal and Peninsula Hotel (for afternoon tea); 5 minutes to the Night Market; 10 minutes to the Jade Market. Hotel clean; staff helpful. Only had breakfast (adequate but not as good as most in China) so can't comment on restaurant for other meals. Restaurants in the immediate area inexpensive and varied. well worth using as a base.

Reviews.Title: “Nice First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ConnieG5
Reviews.Content: Very Classy. The service was ok. I was on the 24th floor, the view was fantastic. Walking distance to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sweetdoctor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near Nathan Road. Just a few minutes walk is the MTR station. There is also a McDonald's and a convenience store nearby. The room is small but clean with nice and clean bathrooms. TV in the room is also small but it's cable TV. Shampoo, soap, toothbrush, shower caps and slippers are provided. The bed is OK. I recommend this hotel for budget travelers who don't want to sacrifice comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Happily surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Emmyx2
Reviews.Content: I had a 16-hour, overnight layover in HKG and just wanted a clean, safe place to sleep. The BP Int'l proved to be a delightful property, well located, clean and economical. From the airport I took the hotel shuttle, for a small fee it's a great way to get into town. The bus dropped me off on the side of the hotel, due to traffic instructions, so I had to walk less than 50 meters to the enterance. The room was small, but not much smaller than the 3x-price Sheraton. No view to speak of, newer building obstruct what was probably once a great harbor view. Internet for a fee, which I loath, but it was very fast. NB: the bed was very firm/ hard, which I like, but some may not. I took a nice walk about during the evening and was able to experience all the neon HKG is known for. Got some great photos with minimal effort. The harbor is a 15-minute stroll. If you want a clean, quite affordable room, this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Small, very clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: jjhk2009
Reviews.Content: First impressions were that the rooms were quite small. However, the rooms were very clean. We stayed on one of the highest floors and had a great view overlooking the harbour. The hotel is in a good location, two MTR stations in easy walking distance, park lane shoppers boulevard one street away. The bathroom was better than any other hotels Ive stayed in - the shower is easy to use, good pressure, does not leak water onto the floor (has glass doors rather than shower curtains) and drains quickly. The beds are hard and pillows are not very comfortable. The broadband internet service is not reliable, we tried it twice and it only worked for an hour or so before dropping out - the staff could not figure out the problem and we still had to pay for it. There is no complementary bottled water which was disappointing as you can't drink the tap water. Also there was no room service menu, didn't follow this up but don't think they offer it.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: gr8critic
Reviews.Content: A pleasant hotel. Got upgrade and free high speed internet access as client has a corporate account. Thought rooms spacious, shower fine too. Close to Jordans MTR Close to Temple Street Market (if you like tat) Not many decent looking restaurants nearby - hotel restaurant seemed pricey Don't get the airport shuttle transfer - BP is the last stop in Kowloon and still drops you around the corner - better get the train and taxi from Kowloon station. You will want to purchase an octopus card anyway Good communication during the typhoon Breakfast is buffet style but no instructions on what the chef can also cook for you. And instructions on telephone were poor. The international dialling code is 001 rather than the normal 00. Found mini bar items are charged twice - once by cleaner on the day, and second when you take your minibar bill on checkout. If I was going back to HK I would stay more central as the MTR is excellant for getting around Take a visit to the peak (up on the tram and return on 15 bus) , but don't bother with the roof experience

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Il_Duce73
Reviews.Content: We had no problems at the BP House and found the staff to be helpful. The rooms are super clean and I liked the modern decor. They are small, but that seems to be the norm in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL HOTEL RUDE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaMarzie
Reviews.Content: staff were very un-co-operative if you werent Chinese. Extremely staff. very unhelpful on where to go and what to do. roadworks right outside hotel loby and unable to either understand or heart what hotel staff were saying. very poor standard. would never recommend this hotel to anyone...........

Reviews.Title: “reasonably priced hotel, nice room, fantastic view!”
Reviews.Author: ArtistheP
Reviews.Content: Had a hard time finding a reasonably priced hotel in Hong Kong, but this was definately a great option on a central location! We payed a little more for a room with a view and weren't disappointed; could see a big part of the HK Island skyline! Room is small but not cramped and very clean, with a minibar, television and a nice bathroom. No breakfast is included. On the day we left, we could leave our luggage in the lobby all day free of charge, next to the big portrait of sir Baden Powell.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with good value!”
Reviews.Author: wtgn_ling
Reviews.Content: With the courtesy bus from Kowloon station, getting to the hotel is easy. It only takes 5mins to Jordan station & Nathan Road, and walking distances to many other sights. I was given the room on Level 19 with views out to the harbour & it was great!! Room & toilet decently sized. Only complain was the internet connection - I paid for 4 hours and the staff did not inform me that I can't use them over a period of time but had to use in a go. Otherwise, great place with good value!

Reviews.Title: “Position great, very clean, beautiful lobby, plenty of cheap eats locally.”
Reviews.Author: oztripperz
Reviews.Content: Staying in Kowloon was a good choice and so was the BP International, walking distance to star Ferry Terminal (10 minutes) and the nearest MTR 4 minutes walk. The hotel's lobby is quite spectacular and is a tribute to Lord Baden Powell who of course is the founder of the Scout Movement. The hotel has a Scout annexe, with it's own separate entrance from the main hotel and we saw many Scouts out on the street. Despite this difference the hotel was as good as any international standard hotel for service, appearance and cleanliness plus an in room safe. We had reserved a city vista room through the internet but on arrival found that it had two single beds and we wanted a double. The staff found us a double room ok but unfortunately it was on a "smoking" floor and the smell was quite obvious even when stepping out of the lift, one evening we accidently turned off the vent in the room and the smell was suffocating. The bed was the hardest I had ever slept on and the pillows were quite flat, in spite of that we slept very well. Maybe because of the room change we ended up with a room overlooking Kowloon Park and we could see part of the harbour. Our 4 night deal cost $3,190 HKD (no breakfast, extra 85HKD pp) which was one of the most reasonable in Hong Kong. We found a very good cafe called Marco's in a street across the road where you could get an English type breakfast or Asian or a combo of both for a very reasonable $22 HKD pp. We used the shuttle service organised through the hotel which considering the distance from the airport (about a 30 minute drive) at $85 HKD pp was very reasonable. I think the price has increased to $100 HKD now but still very reasonable. The hotel said that they had reserved a return journey for us too but it turned out that the earliest shuttle was at 7am and too late for our plane. We were well and truly ripped off for the taxi return journey at $329 HKD, (the hotel said it would cost $250 HKD) with the meter showing $185 HKD and the driver doing a calculation for what we thought were tolls and maybe an airport fee. We were just so flabbergasted and just paid but in hindsight I think we should have called his bluff and refused to pay so much. Other passengers we spoke to were similarly ripped off. Weighing it all up I would definitely stay here again, for price convenience and cleanliness it was worth putting up with a few niggles. Hong Kong is a great city, we felt very safe at all times. Make sure you do a day trip out to Lantau Island to see the giant Bhudda, it is just amazing! I did a search on Trip Advisor for Lantau Island and found a travellers instructions for a trip there, his detail was amazingly accurate and we followed it almost to a tee and had a great adventure. The bird market is also an absolute must for a cultural experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: MinistryOfTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a city view room. The location of the hotel is great. Close to MTR, Temple street market, Nathan Road. 10 min walk to Star ferry, and 5 min to Ocean Centre/Harbour City mall with a lot of cool designer shops. The only negative, we found, is the breakfast. We didn't feel, it was worth the price. There are so many other options around eg. a 7-eleven is across the street. We found a good reflexology/massage place close by. Across the street, and walk towards Nathan Road. Turn left towards Jordan, and there is a small place, which is cheap, and have great service :-) We have booked a stay at BP International again, for our next trip to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: StevenDP
Reviews.Content: Good service, clean, great value, good location...... we had a really nice view of the harbour. Top hotel for the money!

Reviews.Title: “A terrific and unforgettable experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: barbaram935
Reviews.Content: The room is okay,relatively small but do have a nice view overlooking the harbor. They don't have a lot of harbor view room on the non smoking floor. So please make the request on your reservation! The receptionist who helped us to check in was cheerful and very helpful. They gave us a room facing the city before but since we were going to stay for a week . They managed to give us an upgrade and then changed to a harbor view room later on. We appreciated that very much!!! However, we had a small incident during our stay that wasn't very pleasant. We found ants in our room. Not just one, but there were quite a few of them on the table. My son was unable to sleep at night. He got bit on his foot and began to swell on the next day. We reported this to their manager - elki kwon. I really have to say, this guy is amazing. He was kind enough to offer a room change for us. But since our stuff were all over the room. So it wasn't a good a idea to change. But he managed to change all our linens in the room and gave us some drinks coupons to use at the bar. Later in the afternoon, we came back to hotel from shopping. We met him on the street. He was off duty. But he recognised us and helped us to carry the bags back to the hotel. That's really nice of him. On our last nite in Hong Kong, we met this guy again when we were having a really really nice diner at a seafood restaurant. Those restaurants were so cool. You can actually pick what you want right from the water tank. There are hundreds and thousands of different kinds of seafood out there. It's really hard to choose!!! Elki was so kind to help us. He lived nearby and had a connection with one of the restaurant. He helped us to pick the seafood and recommended to us how to cook it. He was so kind to treat us the dessert after the meal. The mango pancake was absolutely fantastic!! He's not really not supposed to treat us like that. We really felt honoured to be treated like kings and queens. Thanks for his wonderful hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: laurenat40
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at the BP. We had a Harbour Parkview room on the 21st floor again with 2 twin beds and a great view of Hong Kong, Victoria Harbour and Kowloon Park. Rooms and bathrooms are extremely clean. There is a small refrigerator, safe, tea/coffee pot and hairdryer in each room. I have read other reviews about the rooms & bathrooms being small. Compared to rooms in the U.S. they are, but if you have ever stayed in a room in France you will think these are quite spacious. I have also read other reviews about the beds being hard. They are, but not to the point of being in pain when you wake up. The buffett breakfast is a great value with many choices of Asian, Western & Indian cuisine. Also, there is token operated laundry on the 13th floor with an automatic soap dispenser and an iron with ironing board. Extremely convenient! The BP has a great location: MTR, Jade Market, Temple Street Night Market, Nathan Road, & more all within walking distance. Also, there is a 7-11 , Circle K and a Welcome (grocery) store directly across the street. The only negative thing about this hotel is that they charge for internet access in the room and it is patchy. However, there are 2 computers in the lounge for guests to use for free and I understand that there is free access to wireless at that same location. We chose to take a taxi to the airport which cost us about $40 US, but was easier with all of our suitcases and a lot less worry about how many more stops the bus might be making in order to get us there on time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Gotecha
Reviews.Content: We booked BP International through Travel Agent: Holiday World. It was very pleasent experience to stay at BP International. This was our first trip to Hong Kong and as per friends who visited earlier, the hotels in Hong Kong were quite conjusted, due to lack of space on iceland. But on the contradictory, our experience at BP International was very pleasent. Very nice ambience, stratigically located, very comfortable rooms, clean and spacious bathroom. Breakfast served at hotel was of good quality and wide range of varities available for Vegitarians also.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sevsa
Reviews.Content: A good hotel but the best thing about it is it's location in Kowloon. Convenient to everything either by walking, MTR or ferry. The lobby is very nice and there's a restaurant on the floor above it. The room I had was small with 2 single beds and had a clean but also small bathroom. The view from my room was fantastic as I looked over the park and could easily see the harbor and Hong Kong on the other side. I ate in breakfast in the restaurant once and found the food to be good but the number of choices somewhat limited. The bus from/to the airport costs HK$85 each way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel in good position”
Reviews.Author: Guildford_SurreyMary
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Hong Kong and we were not disapointed. We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of March as a stopover on our way to New Zealand. The service was efficient and helpful. Our room was excellent, perhaps a little small for 2, but perfectly adequate for a short stay. It was beautifully clean and the beds were comfortable. We had an immaculate en suite shower room. Kowloon park was just behind the hotel and provided a lovely walk on the way to the star ferry which only took about 10 minutes. We found Hong Kong to be extremely clean and efficient and were very impressed that no one is allowed to eat on the streets or on public transport, consequently keeping everying extremely clean and tidy. Incidently if you drop litter there is an instant fine of £150! We found eating out challenging, probably because we tried to eat with the locals and chinese food in Hong Kong is nothing like it is in England! I think you have to pay a little more and eat in the European restaurants. Getting from the airport is so easy as there is train from the airport to the centre where you are able to get a taxi at a low cost to your hotel. One day we visited Cheung chau island which is about a 50 min boat trip away and we felt we experienced more of the real China. The buildings on Hong Kong island are awe inspiring, go up to the 43rd floor of the Bank of China for a great view. All in all we had a great experience here and would certainly recommend the BP International for a comfortable few nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located, Excellent Value.”
Reviews.Author: BoywonderTo
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I stayed here and I was not disappointed. Its location is excellent and its quality is better than other hotels in the same class. The rooms are NOT small in Hong Kong's standard (in fact they are huge for the price you pay). Jordon subway station is 2 minutes away and the hotel is walking distance to both TST (tourist area) and Mong Kok/YMT (shopping areas for local). Fantastic Value: the hotel is owned by the boy scouts (literally!) so I assume it is not aiming for high profit margin. If you live in any major city in North Amercia with a sizable Chinese population, the secret of booking this hotel (and a bunch of other hotels in Hong Kong) is to book through Chinese travel agents in Chinatown. They have access to "vouchers rate" which are even cheaper than anything you can find on the web. The one I think I was not thrilled about is its lack of free internet access (and the rooms are too high for you to access the PCCW (the telecom provider in HK) access-point at the 7-11 across the street). However, there are computers with free internet access at pacific coffee two blocks away. Or better, buy a PCCW monthly account (dirt cheap) and sit at the Starbucks down the street (one of the very few quiet Starbucks in HK).

Reviews.Title: “B P Scores on Location”
Reviews.Author: Arvind S
Reviews.Content: BP international scores over its location which is very close to attractions like Nathan Road, Temple Street, Harbour View etc. We were given a Harbour view room which had an excellent view of the Harbour Front. Room was quite small with no room for an extra bed. Staff was quite helpful and good service. Understanding English was a bit of concern. General Cleanliness was very good. The Cantonese restaurant was strictly OK. Hotel has a good travel service and you can book your tickets to Disney and Water Park etc. Overall we had a pleasant Stay.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: bojodi
Reviews.Content: Clean, just the right room for 2. The Hotel is near many shops. A nice place to stay in Hongkong.

Reviews.Title: “great location but not as good as the other reviews say”
Reviews.Author: RMDQC
Reviews.Content: My friends and i stayed at this hotel last year. we decided on this partly because of the great reviews we found here. Most of the excellent reviews made me expect more than what the hotel actually offered. The hotel is very near men's market, other shopping areas like park lane, walking distance from mtr station. that is the best thing about it - location! The interior of the hotel is unremarkable, the breakfast buffet is simple though filling. However, the rooms are really tiny. Definitely the pictures found at the hotel's website show the rooms looking a lot better than it does really. The "double" bed that should be ok for two people barely looked like a single bed to me. there were three of us, and after they provided an extra bed there was hardly room to walk! We had to close our luggage otherwise we would be stepping on the beds to get from one end of the room to another. The shower area is tiny! Maybe it would have been better if it wasn't enclosed in glass. We were laughing one morning because one of my friends was taking a bath and we could hear his elbows hitting the glass. It was that small. This is my third trip to hongkong and though it was a relatively pleasant stay I would probably stay at a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: shanelovesryan
Reviews.Content: the lobby looks elegant and checking in didn't take very long. we were given a smoking room but the entire floor didn't smell of smoke. the room was small but cute. my mom and i are both petite so we really din't have much of a problem with the size of the room. i guess taller people will have a bit of a problem with that. the bed was not as hard as some members have stated. you will definitely choose to sleep on it rather than on the floor. it was freezing while we were there so we turned the airconditioning off during our stay. the blankets kept us warm although they are somwhat old and overused. but i didn't care much since they were really clean. i loved the interior since it's modern as well as the bathroom. i love the strong pressure of the water as well. it's not entirely a sound-proofed room but i didn't experiencemuch noise coming from outside our room. our toiletries were replenished everyday and our room was also cleaned daily. and it's like a new room each time we come back. the tv has limited channels but it's ok since we didn't come to hk to watch tv. hehe. the elevators didn't take long however the carpet on the lobby is already dirty due to the contant raining so i guess they should change it more often. overall, i will definitely stay here again since i am scared to risk trying out other hotels in hk. the place is great and you can walk to any place, close to the mtr, night markets along the streets, as well as nathan road. i will recommend this to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Just plain & simple”
Reviews.Author: jatv
Reviews.Content: Its our first time to check-in at BP International and I must say for a 3 star hotel, price is just right. Location is excellent, Kowloon Park at the back, few minutes walk to the MTR station, an Airport Express stop and a few minutes walk to commercial area. Though rooms and beds are small, just right for those who only intend to sleep at night and walk all day. The bathroom is small but complete with the basic ammenities, they even provide complimentary sleepers, though not replace on a daily basis. Overall me and my wife together with our friends enjoyed our stay, the hotel staff "Sun" even extended one of the rooms till 3:00 PM since our flight back will be at 9:55PM. Will definitely consider checking-in here again specially if we'll be in a tight budget and need not to stay in the hotel for a long period of time.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location, Good value.”
Reviews.Author: Raffi1946
Reviews.Content: Though I specifically asked, 2 weeks in advance, for a double bed, they put me in a twin beds room. Other than that, I was very much satisfied from the very good location, the cleanliness and the good choice of breakfast items. To my taste, the bathroom (no bath, just a shower) is too tiny even for 1 person. Be aware: Even if you use your phonecard for outgoing calls from your room, they"ll charge you 30 HKG $ for each call. ( Local call: 4 HKG $ ). Only after arguing, they agreed to charge my calls as local. All in all: Very very satisfied !

Reviews.Title: “Best Value!!!”
Reviews.Author: asiantraveler101
Reviews.Content: Been here with my wife last October. It was great!!! especially the lobby which was very elegant and big. The rooms are small, which is I think standard in Hong Kong. However, they are very clean and up to date, especially the washrooms. The showers have glass walls. Also checking in is a breeze, took only about 5 mins. Daily maintenance was SUPERB!!! It was like a new room when we came back!!! Definitely comming back to this hotel again!!! Actually, we'll only be staying in this hotel everytime we go back to Hongkong!!! It was so GOOD!!! By the way, I'm the type of person who is either impressed or not impressed, so when I say its good, i mean it!!! GOOD JOB BP INTERNATIONAL!!!

Reviews.Title: “don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: beverlee329
Reviews.Content: BP international looks nicer on the pictures than it is in reality. The picture of the garden is kowloon garden but that is one heck of a photographer to make the view so nice. Firstly, we were taken through some backdoor through a shady area by the hotel shuttle (shuttle is always a good thing). The room I had was a "family room" which had 2 bunk beds. Since we have 3 ppl in one room it was a better option than cramping a double room with a third bed. My friends room with a queen bed was a bit larger. My view was pretty ugly (except at night..). The bathroom was the nicest part with walls glassed over and modern shower, faucet, toilet. The blanket was thin and rough. Kind of like a cheap used blanket. The location IS pretty good since it is walkable to harbour city and metro.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: ll213
Reviews.Content: i stayed at BP hotel 7 yrs ago via a air-hotel package. It was so centrally located that I stayed there again last month through an air-hotel package. the rooms, bathroom and its facilities were upgraded to really nice modern decor since. I got a twin room but floor space is limited so i had to walk over my bags. But it is clean and they even give you slippers. Like people said, you got to pay for internet. But i was able to get on to internet via wifi. You can request the converter plug for your electronic devices from the front desk. Room also got a minibar, with free coffee, tea, chinese tea, kettle and safe in the room. I got a nonsmoking room, and amazingly the entire floor does not smell of smoke. Request for room facing kowloon park, which gives a nice view of the harbor, HK island and lower kowloon. bathroom is small but manageable, it is clean and they give you complimentary bath items. Water pressure in shower is super strong - so strong that you can hear your neighbors taking a shower! bottom line, it is a great location, just 3 mins walk to the nearest MTR station (jordon). Or just 20 mins to the harbor front. Temple street is a couple of blocks away, and there are shops and restaurants all within a block. It is not on Nathan road, so you are not overwhelmed by buildings, people and congestion. The room with a view of kowloon park also gives you a feeling of "breathing room". Finally, there is a free shuttle from the hotel to the kowloon station (for airport express train). It is shuttle K5, runs every 20 mins, starts at 6.30 am. The free shuttle picks you up from corner of hotel and drops you at kowloon station. You can check in at kowloon station for your flight (participating airlines only) - they will take your bags and give you a boarding pass (which you have to check again at the airport counter 30 mins before departure). Very convenient as i was able to travel to the airport without my heavy bags! From kowloon, the airport train costs HK$90.00 one way. Octopus cardholder will get reduced rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: hist234
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for the location and the cost. The picture is deceiving- it is taken from Kowloon park on the other side of the hotel. Location is in Kowloon, not far from anything-but a fun walk to lots of places. MTR is easy and a station is nearby. A no frills place-food their is too expensive-never tried it. Room was small, but good-we had a great view. Staff helpful- a very busy commercial place- but who cares. Room cleaned up every day. Taxis are easy available if needed. Did use their laundry room machines- a little pricey-but great to have at the tail end or middle of a trip. Stayed at the Sheraton one night after return from Macau- much more upscale and was fun, but saved money at the BP and this was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Reflections on BPI”
Reviews.Author: steve_ben2004
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the BP International from 7 Dec to 12 Dec. Firstly the not so good:- 1) The bed was the hardest bed I have ever slept in, or tried to sleep in. I quite like a harder matress but in all honesty, sleeping on the floor (had there been room to do so) would have been a softer option. 2) Cost of Internet access was HK$90 for a 24 hour period or HK$40 for four hours. They did not offer a discounted weekly rate which many other hotels do. Having purchased internet access, the signal was at best flaky and at worst unavailable. This was for a wired connection not a WI-FI one. 3) Lack of WI-FI 4) I thought the cost of the Breakfast buffet was a bit steep at HK$93,50, but that appears to be the going rate 5) The size of the room, the bathroom in particular was very small indeed. I was pleased I was a solo traveler. The bathroom amenity pack was pretty sparse 6) I left three English £2 coins on the desk in my room. By the time i came to look for them, they had disappeared. 7) I could not seem to get the room temperature right. When sitting at the desk I was very warm from waist up and cold fro waist down Now the pretty good 1) Location - the hotel is close to Jordan MTR making transport very easy. Also there were always cabs available on the rank outside. 2) View from the room. I was in room 2128 and had a good view of both the harbour and of Kowloon Park. The only downside to this was being unable to close curtains to shut out the light when trying to sleep 3) The rooms were very clean and fresh towels were left every day. Its only a sam ethat tis was spoilt by point 6 above 4) The Wellcome Supermarket and 7-11 stores just opposite the hotel. All in all the BO is OK, but that is about it, just OK. The company that put me in there were charged in excess of HK$800 a night, plus tax. If it was my money, I think I would be looking elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: sccfsac
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located in Kowloon, 2 blocks from subway station (Jordan). It is in walking distance of shopping, coffee shops and restaurants. The sleeping rooms are small in terms of US standards, but very clean and functional. We had problems with confirmed reservations, but that was rectified with complimentary buffet breakfast and basket of fruit. Be sure to request non-smoking rooms. Taxis are available outside hotel, airport shuttles also pick up here. One advantage is free computer access to Internet in the second floor bar.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and clean with no extra frills”
Reviews.Author: Moonbeam720
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through agoda.com and stayed from 11/7-11/13 for $147 USD per night. We picked this hotel due to close proximity to MTR stations and easy accessibility to other places. The best feature in the room was the bathroom. It was larger than expected and clean. The shower didn't leak water out and the toilet flush was strong. Another plus, they cleaned our room efficiently and fast. However, this hotel lacks any amenities (besides the toothbrush and slippers that were changed daily). It lacks a gym, swimming pool, and even though it's targeted for business people, it doesn't offer wireless internet access in the room. Wired internet costs $90 HKD for one day and it didn't even work in our room (Room 2122). We eventually went down to their lounge to use the wireless access (we still had to pay the $90) and paid $55 HKD each for iced coffee. This hotel is good if you just need a place to sleep and nothing else. We were given two twin-sized beds instead of a full/queen as we were told they didn't have any. Would I stay at this hotel again? Probably not. The experience wasn't horrible but I believe for the price I paid, I can get something better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price and location!”
Reviews.Author: intravenouswit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night before we had to switch to GuangDong hotel for irrelevant reasons. Wished we didn't have to! The room was small but comfortable. Then again most hotels in Hong Kong (with this kind of pricing) are about the same size. The variety at the breakfast buffet was good. The location is excellent - can walk to anywhere easily with a couple of 24-hour convenience shops nearby. Above all, it's pretty quiet as it's next to a park. Although the reception counter was always busy, the hotel staff was most helpful once it's your turn. I recommended this hotel to another friend and he gave it rave reviews as well. Will definitely return to stay at this hotel for my next trip to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Travellingvillager
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for three nights at the end of a tour of China with Wendy Wu. Having read some of the reviews before we went I had serious reservations about what we would find. We need not have worried. Yes, the room we had on the 14th floor was not huge, but it was more than adequate as was the shower room. We had faxed a request for a non smoking room before we left and that's what we got. It was very clean and there was a hair dryer with lift up mirror in the bedroom. Noise? Well, you could hear the running water of nearby rooms but that was all. The beds were both clean and comfortable. What impressed us most about this hotel was the staff. Either things have changed over the past two or three years or those who wrote about their bad experiences were very unfortunate. All the staff, reception, room service and restaurant were amongst the most helpful, pleasant and efficient we experienced during our trip. The choice of morning breakfast was excellent, and the coffee well worth an extra cup! The service was first rate, with any finished plate cleared away from the table immediately - and I mean immediately. Constant attention. The evening buffet meal was excellent value and extremely well prepared. If like us you're booked into this hotel through a Wendy Wu tour, or similar, then based on our experience you can rest assured that you will enjoy your stay. As others have written, the location is central and you can easily walk to shops and the ferry. Just remember that if you do want a non smoking room, ask for it in advance and show them a copy of the fax.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: lucy1604
Reviews.Content: An all rounder! The lobby and general design is very grand - especially for the price! We got a good rate with an advanced internet deal. It is more than we would like to pay on our small budget but it meant a great start to our travels. Also, budget in hk is generally more expensive than other parts of Asia and for a lower standard. Very well equipped, clean and great views! The location was also perfect, next to the backpacker district and a two minute walk from the underground making everything very accessible. It is a ten minute walk from the pier where you can cross over to hk island easily. all public transport is very cheap. The breakfast is international, varying and tasty. It is a very nice hotel, it felt like we should have been paying more!

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected”
Reviews.Author: Traveller623
Reviews.Content: The toilet and bath were a bit small - but not a big deal, it's enough to do your thing. We stayed 4 nights and it was more than what we expected, clean room, minibar, tea/coffee maker, tv and internet. The staff were helpful, room is cleaned daily, even if you get up late. Towels are changed daily. Buffet breakfast was good and plenty. At dinner we had the grilled salmon - it was so good! Cooked just right! The hotel is situated right at the heart of the shopping and commercial area. Just a few minutes walk to the MTR station. We will definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but OK”
Reviews.Author: femaleTurista
Reviews.Content: My friends and i stayed here this September for 5 days. From the outside you'll think that this could be a 4 star hotel coz it's big. But once you're inside you'll know it's just a 3star hotel. though they have a huge lobby, there are no doormen to open or close doors for you, a bellboy did help us one time to bring our luggages to our room. but at the reception, a very friendly attendant named Sun is very accomodating to answer and help us with our queries. the ROOM: we had standard twin (they were gracious to give us non-smoking rooms as requested) single beds but hard mattress, mini ref, personal safe, heating kettle, hairdryer. they provided new slippers, basic toilletries each day. very basic but manageable. 7-11, wellcome grocery (cheaper), restos are just across the hotel. short walk to temple street night market with LOTS of eateries. mcdonalds and mtr jordan, bossinni are 10-15minutes walk. macau ferry terminal around 15 minutes walk too. avenue of the stars at the end of nathan is around 20 or so minutes walk. parklane shoppers area and granville road are 15minutes walk. overall, for the price we paid, this hotel has a very convenient location and is worth it for budget travellers like me who would not settle for anything less desirable. that at the end of the day you also look forward to coming to your room to take a bath and sleep. also, the place is safe ;p

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Professional”
Reviews.Author: OscarTheTraveller
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be Comfortable and Professional. Location was good easy walking / bus to tourist locations. Great selection for breakfast and good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Inspection”
Reviews.Author: meowmel
Reviews.Content: Location Across the road from Kowloon Park Supermarket close by Ladies Market 20min walk Rooms All rooms shower only, Internet available for HKD90 for 24 hours, NO CONNECTING ROOMS Standard- Dated Décor but tidy, ask for park facing, nice bathroom no mini bar but there is a vending machine on each floor Harbor partial view – Only difference is the slight harbor view and there is now a minibar Comments/Recommendations Really didn’t like the feel of this hotel. They had a nice airy lobby area and the hallways looked like they had been refurbished. The rooms however where looking very dated (apart from bedding) even though it was refurbished in 2005 They had a good selection of restaurants (Western, Chinese and Japanese) but again they all looked a bit tired They had an in house laundry for guests. They had vending machine facilities and water cooler on each floor. I thought were helpful but a bit tacky for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but in good location”
Reviews.Author: sunshiner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a trip around China as part of Wendy Wu tours. We were told by others in the taxi from the airport the rooms would be smaller than what had be used to in China. On Nathan road, a good location. 5 mins walk from Jordan metro station. Across the road is a useful Exchange .. does not take travellers cheques, cake shop useful if you having a party or birthday. 5 mins walk from famous Temple Street and its market. Plenty of places to eat. We ate in Spaghetti House as desperate for a pizza .. good food and service. Out of hotel turn right then left at the crossroads. Hotel lobby huge but rooms small.Lacked basic toiletries, no shampoo,hairdryer but only 10 mins walk from harbour and Star Ferry. No bath to soak those feet. But there was kettle with tea and coffee and slippers.We stayed in room 2014 fantastic view across the skyscrapers. Breakfast excellent huge choice. Internet in the bar area. Free for first half hour. Plenty of scout information and exhibiton on top floor about scouting.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: WelshWedge
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the BP International at the end of April 08. The hotel has a good location, just a 10 min walk from the Star Ferry terminal and right next to Nathan Road for shopping. The hotel was good value for money, clean and tidy. The room was small, but this did not matter to us as we only returned to the room to either shower and change or sleep. There is no iron or ironing board in the room. We were disappointed to have been allocated a smoking room when we had requested a non-smoking room. When we immediately complained we were told that there were no available non-smoking rooms left. Even though the room had been cleaned the smokey odour had seeped into the bedding and curtains and was unplesant for two non-smokers. Of note the majority of the hotel rooms were set aside for smokers and I believe only two floors had non-smoking rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Place in HK”
Reviews.Author: mike321ph
Reviews.Content: BP International Hotel is conveniently located at Austin Road. Right in front of the hotel is a 7-11 store, a money changer and a small grocery called "Wellcome" - where you can buy drinks, snacks & even electrical outlet adaptors at a fair price. Austin Rd is known for having small international restos that have good prices too. Just a few blocks away is Temple Drive where there is a flea market and a good outdoor place where you can eat good chinese cuisine. The Jordan MTR station is also just a few blocks away, from there you can go to any point in HK: Causeway, Disneyworld, Mongkok, etc. The hotel room was sized just right, it may be a bit cramped and the bed may be a bit short for those who are over 6'4" tall - I'm 5'11" and it wasn't a problem. The room has all the basic amenities. For Filipinos, you may want to bring an electrical outlet adaptor to charge your celphones, cameras & laptops. The hotel can lend you an adaptor for free but it doesn't fit our usual plugs. You can buy one for HK$12 in the Wellcome grocery right in front of the hotel. Hotel staff are friendly & most speak basic english.

Reviews.Title: “UNFRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: Kalime
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed. Was close to shopping for Nathon Rd., but the rooms are smaller than my bathroom. No room for suitcases, no mirrors except in bathroom, no extras, like shampoo and no hairdryer. Carpet was dirty, and bedding blankets was older than my Grandmother. Asked for a non-smoking room and was put into a smoking room. Assured me it was non-smoking, smelled like smoke and the pillows reeked of smoke, and there was an ashtray in the room. Insisted they move us, which they did, after I got angry..was moved to another floor, and whole floor was non-smoking. So they lied to me. Also asked for coupons for our breakfast, and they said just sign the ticket to your room. Next morning they wouldn't let us eat without paying. (price quoted and paid in advance, to us included buffet breakfast) Next day they sent me a msg. saying they made a mistake and breakfast was included. but by then it was too late. We didn't get breakfast before joining our day long tour.

Reviews.Title: “super hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ukjan2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights via Australia, large hotel but the staff were very friendly, helpful and polite, the room was big enough and very very clean and the bar and lobby are great. Would recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: kiraywm
Reviews.Content: I had a great rate for this hotel, and it didnt disappoint. Its very close to Harbour City shopping centre, the markets, Tsim Tsa Tsui... a short stroll and you're by the harbour! The Jordan MTR is very very close by, so you can hop on and end up in Mong Kok. The room was actually quite big & clean.
