I entered my room just as a lady was cleaning it, and I saw how much effort she put into cleaning the place up. The front desk was very helpful. Overall, a great hotel, and I am already planning to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: scn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the BP International over the period of New Year 2007-2008. The hotel is quite good - when you compare alternatives at a similar price. It has everything you would expect, pretty good rooms, all the usual bathroom stuff, friendly staff and some good views out over the harbour. The location is great; very centrally located near Nathan road and the park. We'd recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't want to spend a ridiculous amount of money on a hotel, but wants something reasonably decent.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Brownes
Reviews.Content: BP Internatoinal was great value for money spent. The location is really good. It's one street away from Nathan Road which is excellent for shopping (electrical items especially) The room was rather small but this would only bother a person if they spent a lot of time in their room. It was very clean and also provided a travel agency within the hotel to book tours and Disneyland tickets etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and good price”
Reviews.Author: syann
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3N in the hotel during March. Chosen the place as of its great location. There are a lot of eateries nearby the hotel, ferry terminal is within 5 mins walk and the MTR station is within 10 mins walk. Generally the hotel rooms in HK are quite small but the size in BP is good enought to squeeze in 3 adults for a twin room. Toilet is simple but clean and the service at the front counter is good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay though not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: smong
Reviews.Content: This is a late review. I stayed in BP with my family last year. A clean and ok hotel near the Jordan subway station. Standard service you would find in hotel chains, quite friendly and helpful staff but no porter to bring your luggage to the room. abt 7 mins walk to train station and possible to walk to popular shopping places like tsimsashui, mongkok. Near to plenty of tea houses, cafes and local shop houses. Nothing to shout about but a pretty decent and convenient place to stay in a so congested city.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: ompi
Reviews.Content: worst hotel i have ever stayed in. The staff were unhelpful at the reception, didnt understand english and did not take any persons feelings into consideration. They just know how to take money at the reception desk- The staff at breakfast have attitude beyond belief!!! I have never been so shocked in my life!! DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL!!! YOU WILL REGRET IT!! i will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience”
Reviews.Author: QwertyuUk
Reviews.Content: had a long flight from the UK, came to bp international to find they had messed up my booking, ended up paying for there mistake.. That's not all, every tourist needs advice, and directions, but the reception staff were unhelpful.. "hey could u tell were the nearest station is?" the reply was= "I'm sorry I do not nw" To my suprise it was just down the road(nathan rd) the worst experimce was when I had checked out and rhe assisstant manager accussed my family on robbery on pillows and towels. Like I'd travel 6000 miles for some towels and pillows, he instruced that he needed to check my luggage or he would not let me go! Ended up having to pay for sum poxy pillows and towels.. Worst holiday experimce. Would not recommened

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Willy2007
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family for a week at the BP International House. Excellent location of the Hotel, just a few meters from Jordan MTR station on Nathan Road. 7-Eleven just across the street and McDonalds & Pacific Coffee on the corner. Rooms are quite small, but very clean. The TV in the room is the smallest I have seen at any Hotel ! Overall good experience and recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Kowloon Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: stujude
Reviews.Content: Stayed at BP International for 3 night stopover en route to Sydney. Set in the centre of Tsim Tsa Tsui, Austin Road, Kowloon, the hotel is very well located for all transport links and just off Nathan Road..............where all the action is. Booked through a website 5 months prior to actual stay date, the cost was approx £46 per double room pn. Couldn't believe it. Great VFM. £5 pp per buffet breakfast which was quite comprehensive. My room on 21st floor overlooked Kowloon park, great view and very quiet. Room a little on small side (to us Europeans) but very comfy. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone and will certainly book it on my next Hong Kong visit. Stujude Wilts UK

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel in an Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: lord_of_hearts
Reviews.Content: My second stay in Honghong with my wife, after several change of hotel reservations with my travel agent I finally decided to book in BP International. I decided in this hotel because of the Good Review from Trip Advisor. All I can say is, I agree to most of the comments and rating on this hotel. The hotel lobby was impressive, its like one of the top malls here in Manila where floors and ceilings are shinny ideal for the guests. The front desk officer was accomodating and rooms was just right for Asians like us. Our checking in and out was smoothly carried over. the location was very ideal for tourists, Its just walking in a park going to the shopping centers and transport system. Very nice hotel and very ideal on location and great value. I would definitely recommend and be back here again. Cheers to BP international!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & good value”
Reviews.Author: alreadyexcited
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location overlooking Kowloon Park where you can watch the Tai Chi both morning and evening. The hotel has beautiful reception areas and helpful staff. The rooms are OK but unfortunately the 4 beds in our 2 rooms were all rock hard which was a great shame. It is very clean and cleaning (even of corridor walls) seems to be every day. The park is fabulous to walk through to get to everything and safe even at night as it has security patrols and I felt safe even walking through alone at around 11pm. Tips -Taxis are incredibly cheap, and you need to develop selective deafness as you will be asked if you 'want tailor?', 'want watch?' etc every few yards

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location and Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: RubyRubySydney
Reviews.Content: For the traveller who would prefer to get out of their hotel room and explore a city, the BP International is a perfect choice. The price is incredibly good value, the rooms are clean and well-appointed and the location is fantastic. Instead of breakfast at the hotel, there was a great bakery up on the corner of Nathan Road. A croissant and a coffee on the go was all we needed. We loved the BP as more of our money was spent out and about eating, drinking, shopping, etc. It was a clean, safe place to sleep and re-fuel. It is also close to Nathan Road and all its shops, and the Temple Street area is great for inexpensive street food. Tip: Hunt around online for better prices than booking directly with the hotel. I saved 50% by doing that.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Location, Good Hotel, Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: brookl
Reviews.Content: This is a solid 3-star hotel with what should be considered bargain rates (given the location and the quality of room). We stayed in a harbour-parkview room, which had a surprisingly great view of the harbour and Hong Kong skyline with a direct wide-open view of the 2IFC (the tallest building in Hong Kong) and the rest of Central, although a couple of buildings did partially obstruct the view. I do believe we got extremetly lucky with the view, and I don't think that every harbour-parkview room would have the Hong Kong view comparable to ours. This is definitely a 3-star, not 4-star. The room is tiny and the bed was nothing more than just basic. The hallway was gloomy and the lobby was also rather basic and no-frills, with cramped check-in counter. But the check-in was very quick and smooth, and we had no complaints with the service here. And the important positive was that everything inside the room was pretty clean although basic. I especially thought the bathroom was spotlessly clean; very small but well-designed with a nice new sink and a powerful shower. The location is decent, though not the best. It's on the north side of Kowloon Park, and the closest metro (subway) stop is Jordan only about 5minutes away. If you were to walk to the main part of Harbour City shopping mall, the Star Ferry, and the harbourfront area of Tsim Sha Tsui, it would take a good 15-20 minutes. The area right near the hotel isn't all that interesting, although it is very close to Temple Street Night Market. I will say that Kowloon Park that the hotel sits right next to is very pleasant, with an aviary, well-groomed gardens and a flamingo pond all within the grounds. A stroll through this park is a nice way to get to Tsim Sha Tsui from the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who's budget-conscious but would still like to stay in a nice clean hotel with a decent Kowloon location and a possibility for a nice harbour view from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Youngflyers
Reviews.Content: Husband and I travelled to HKG as a wedding annivesary trip although hubby had been to HK previously many years ago with the forces ie when HKG was British run. BPI is located in an ideal location with easy access to all attractions and to areas which are deemed as "off beaten track". Travel from airport is easy with hotel shuttle bus and no charge (make sure you get a voucher from airport staff. No problems with leaving bags ahead of room avaiability (we arrived 10.30am) and very secure. Staff very helpful even remembered our booking - we had asked for higher room with views overlooking habour. We were not disappointed got lovely view overseeing kowloon park and harbour. Def ask for it and no extra charge. Room size I personally thought were okay, yes slightly on small side particularly bathroom but we were not planning to spend alot of time in hotel room. Jordan MTR just around corner meaning you can go everywhere but have to admit for those who like walking it was about 10-15 min walk to ferry port. Transport is the best I've ever experienced it make London look real poor. Trains/buses/ferry/taxi all very easy and very cheap with the exception of taxi. Get a Ocptus card this saw us thru the entire trip and very easy to top up. The ferry ride is great far better then taking the MTR across the water. Didn't try hotel resturany but always looked busy and food smelt nice! Coffee shop around corner offering free internet access (purchase coffee) which was good as liked to catch up with friends & family. Places to eat..........indian highly rec'd Gaylord a well established indian resturant always busy and have live music every evening. Avoided local places (sorry am a bit picky!) but found it easy to find places to eat just look for packed places especially by the local as this was a sure sign of quality and prices. Markets, well did all of them! Would highly rec'd Ladies, Night Market usual HKG merchandise. Plently of fake stuff but HAGGLE as the prices are extremley marked up. Found Stanley mkt a disappoint as seller somewhat rude and not willing to barter. Shops on TST are bright and sparkling but beware as the prices and selling manner is not for the faint hearted. Buddha a must despite the long winded MTR and bus ride when you get there you forget the ride up and thru the mountains. Photographs galore and so tranquil makes you think about life! Laser show at Harbour is awesome. we took a boat and watched from middle of harbour. Could argue that seeing it from harbour side would have been just as good but hey we just got in the flow of it! Visited Stanley island alot peaceful then the TST not alot to do but the resturants by harbour are great and ideal place to do the people watching! All in all would say there's plently to do lots of shops and sight seeing but grimmicks like HKG Disney didn't really appeal to us. A 5 day trip as a first trip was ideal, would return but as a stop over.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sweety_90
Reviews.Content: Bp International is a nice place to stay at. The rooms are small but everything was clean. We had 2 bunkbeds in our room and a small but more updated bathroom. The service was good. The only problem I had was the walls are thin. I could hear people talking outside of my room while I was inside my room. For the price you are paying for, the room is not a bad deal. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you don't mind small spaces.

Reviews.Title: “Great, great,great!”
Reviews.Author: trip_lang
Reviews.Content: Nice and affordable hotel. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Smart Choice”
Reviews.Author: Godfather_7
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on review and prices. I didn't expect much of anything considering the relatively low rates. I was really surprised how nice the hotel was. The lobby was a real shock, huge and luxurious. The rooms are neat, well-designed and comfortable. Every little gadget and button in the room works like it should, The air conditioner was the most cooperative I have seen anywhere. These are always a problem, but not in this hotel. The bathrooms are spotless, the showers comfortable and clean. The breakfast bar was too abundant, it exceeded every expectation I ever had. Great tasting food, too. Built on a mezzanine it inherits the splendor of the interior design from the lobby below. The location is near perfect: short ride to Kowloon station, 15 minute walk to the ocean ferry. The neighborhood is filled with shops and restaraunts, much like everything esle in Hong Kong. What else can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LeapinLiz
Reviews.Content: BP International is in an excellent location. From the Airport you can easily catch the Express Train to Kowloon Station, where there is a free shuttle bus (K5 I think) to the Hotel. The rooms were spotlessly clean, good size, we had a good view of Kowloon Park and the Harbour. Good size bathroom with great shower and plenty hot water. Comfortable beds. Mini Fridge (no hairdryer though) Free internet available on the breakfast floor. Great buffet (hot and cold breakfast) ... prompt polite check-in & service at reception, (where you can readily exchange your money to Hong Kong dollars). Only a few minutes walk to the Temple Street Markets or Nathan Road Shopping. Good Value !!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are so small”
Reviews.Author: ctmew
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel, having read so many good things about it. The hotel building and the location are excellent, and the hotel lobby with its high ceiling, the large stairways all decorated for the year-end season look really nice, although sitting in the hotel lobby you could hear loud noices of cups and saucers, plates and spoons rattling against each other coming from the upper ground restaurant. It was a very nice fresh feel as you stepped out of the lift with the seemingly new lighting, wall panel and carpet. The disappointment came when you went inside the room - it was really quite tiny, including the bathroom. While we managed with our queen-double room, our children's twin-bedded room with an extra bed that we requested for just looked and felt so crammed. To allow them more space we have to bring their baggages over to our room. If the hotel has slightly enlarged the room size, say add another 50 - 80 sq ft, it would provide very comfortable stay indeed. I was told the room size as it is is 220 sq.ft or so and trust me, I have no idea that 220 sq. ft is so small. The rooms we had were clean, and came with nice partial harbour view in the day as well as night with lights up in and around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Can't forget BP Hotel”
Reviews.Author: teachermanila
Reviews.Content: Sweet Couple,Manila Philippines First timers in Hongkong,my husband and i had a superb experience not just with the views and shopping sprees but with the excellent service of BP Int'l Hotel.It is at the heart of hongkong.You can even take a walk from there up to the lavish and popular boutiques,Kowloon Park,Victoria Harbour,night harbour, and if you want more exercises,-to Mongkok Market!Whew,you can't ask for more with the location of the hotel.Life is hard for us ordinary people here in manila but if we can have extra savings again,i would love to be booked again in BP.It is one of those I miss most in Hongkong!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: annomonus
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location just off Nathan road. The hotel intself was very nice and the front desk and service was good. The room and bathroom were alittle bit small but when you are out sightseeing and shopping all day this does not matter. We had a great view from our room and we were not on the top floor !!! As for Hong Kong itself, we stayed for 4 nights and this was abit too long and we were ready for our onward journey after the 3rd day. A visit to Kowloon Park behind the hotel is very nice with lots of stuff to look at.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel in a Top-Location !”
Reviews.Author: asiaworld
Reviews.Content: Very good Hotel in a superb Location within a short walking distance to the Temple-Street, Jade Market and Nathan Road. The Kowloon Park is just 2-3 minutes away. Friendly reception staff. Small but nice and clean rooms with refrigerator and Aircon. Nice view from our room (Harbourside) Nr. 1828 in the 18th floor. All in all absolutely value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel; good location.”
Reviews.Author: CMPLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at BP International in Sept 2007 after reading good reviews on tripadvisor. We weren't disappointed! We booked through asiatravel and got a pretty good deal for a harbour view room. On arrival the shuttle bus was waiting for us at the station and it took us straight to the hotel door. The room wasn't huge but very clean and nicely decorated. The view was so good we didn't even bother going down to the harbour itself to watch the light show. The location is also very good and close enough to anywhere that you would want to go on a short stay in Hong Kong. The staff were most helpful, too. We were very pleased with our decision to stay here and would recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Experience”
Reviews.Author: aaaaamackay
Reviews.Content: We arranged a limousine through the hotel that never turned up at the airport. This left us stranded at the airport and we had to locate a bus to take us to the Hotel. When arriving at the hotel at 9.00 p.m. (the bus took 2 hours instead of the 45 minutes it should have taken) we were advised that our room which we had booked for 2.00 p.m. was not ready. The front desk staff were very unhelpful and did not care that we had just completed a 12 hour flight and we had children with us who wanted to rest. The rooms were extremely small by any standard and the services were very basic. We would not go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “nosiest hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: cessch
Reviews.Content: i cant believe it. just now 11/28/07 at 11.05 pm i look outside my door to find guitar noise is coming from, there are 15-20 people playing guitar and making the most racket. besides that there are loud noises from emanating from the wall. its incredible. for the price u pay to stay here you could pay half the price for a flop house and get more peace of mind. dont stay at BP. u will regret it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, adequate hotel for base in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: PatrickTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the BP International in Kowloon, Hong Kong for 4 nights in early October 2007. We were on holiday, not a business trip. This was our first visit to Hong Kong and we chose the hotel based on reviews on Trip Advisor. Actually my number one choice was the Salisbury YMCA (based on TA reviews) but the YMCA was fully booked even two months prior to our trip. Overall I was pleased with the BP, although I would have preferred to have been closer to the harbor. Location: The hotel is at the north side of Kowloon Park on Austin Road just west of Nathan Rd. The street in front is rather busy but our room was on the backside of the hotel (I wanted a view of the park and harbor) and was very quiet. Room: Having wanted a room at the Y where everyone recommends a room with a view I followed the trend and booked a room with a view at the BP….and it was worth it. (See attached photo of the view from our window.) It was quiet (as I previously noted) and even on the 21st floor we had a nice view of the harbor without too many obstructions. We could view the nightly light show, although once I saw it I wasn’t impressed. The room (2137) is small but not tiny and there was plenty of room for us and our luggage. The bathroom was cramped, but again it was sufficient and had a very nice shower (no tub). The room was very clean, quiet, and acceptably dark drapes to block out the morning light. A great bonus was excellent air conditioning. Restaurants: We never tried the hotel restaurants. I checked out the buffet but the minute I saw the pickled ducks feet on the salad bar I decided not to eat there. Down near the harbor was a building called the East Tsim Sha Tsui Centre that had western restaurants. We had a good meal at Outback. We also tried the Spaghetti House around the corner on Nathan Rd (just north of Austin). We had acceptable Italian with some interesting but fun miscommunications. A waiter brought our food although he was not the same person who took our order. I asked for glasses of water. He looked a little confused but then paused, walked over to the next table and returned with extra silverware settings for us. I said, “no, we would like some water”. He returned with two mugs of hot water. I stopped trying and we made do with our warm water. Another evening we were on the island and ate at California Pizza Kitchen in the Times Square mall. This was especially funny since I had never eaten at CPK in the states. Across the street from the hotel is 7-Eleven. Next to 7-Eleven (and down some steps) is Wellcome, a grocery store with fresh produce. Over on Nathan Rd across from the park is Pacific Coffee Company where I went for my morning coffee. Transportation: From the airport we took the express train to Kowloon. Even though there were only two of us we qualified for the “group” ticket. They were 70 HKD each instead of the usual 90 HKD. At the Express station it was very easy to catch the free shuttle to the airport. We walked to the shuttle area and very helpful attendants asked what hotel and pointed us to the right bus. On the return I did not attempt to take the free shuttle bus from the hotel back to the express station. The bus only runs every 30 minutes and because we were leaving at 7:00 am I did not want to stand around. The woman at the front desk told me that a taxi to the express station would only cost 20 HKD ($2.50 US) and she was spot on. It took about 5 minutes and was exactly 20 HKD. In town I did not get the Octopus card and I’m glad because mostly we walked. When we did finally take the subway it was incredibly easy to use. They have machines where there’s map. You touch your destination and it tells you the amount to put in for the fare, for example we went to the Wong Tai Sin temple which is about 6 stops from Jordan. The machine told me to put in 8 HKD (the machines take coins) and out popped the ticket. The subway trains are clean and nicely air conditioned. Price: I checked all the various sites and prices were about the same. I booked directly thru the hotel site because I wanted to make sure I got a room with a view. I paid approx. $185 USD.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again”
Reviews.Author: roz_dog83
Reviews.Content: the BP internation is located in tsim sha tsui right in the heart of kowloon. it's a 5 minute walk to the MTR station and about 10-15 minutes to the star ferry terminal. i recieved a free upgrade on arrival, which meant my room looked out over kowloon park and victoria harbour. the rooms were clean and nicely done, if a little on the small size, although more than adequate. the staff were always helpful and friendly. as others have said this is the headquaters of the hong kong scout movement so there are lots of scouts and their parents floating around, however generally they use a separate lobby and lifts. i would definately stay here again and would recommend this hotel as a moderatly priced, but good value hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Margreen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the BP International for 2 nights in October and found it to be in an excellent location for all the shops and amenities. The hotel was spotless and the staff friendly. Evening meal at the hotel was a buffet with plenty of differant choices and was great value for money. Would definately recommend this hotel for any one visiting Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: klblau
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an above average, moderately priced hotel in HK, then this hotel fits your needs. It's conveniently located in Tsim Sha Tsui so there's food, shopping, and access to the public transportation. I don't know when they redid the rooms, but the rooms are nicely furnished and clean. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. As already mentioned, they're moderately priced and IMO worth it. The only con is the size of the room and especially the bathroom. If I was travelling by myself, this room will fit fine, but if you're travelling with your spouse, then you might find it small. The bathroom barely has enough room for one person. You step into the bathroom, turn once and you'll be at the sink, turn again and your facing the toilet, and the turn one more time and you'll be facing the shower. That's how small the bathroom is. Overall, I had a great experience and I'd recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sun-Jae
Reviews.Content: This is very good hotel, with an excellent location in Kowloon (i.e. it took us 10 min by foot to get to the Star Ferry to go to the HK island, the Temple Street Market, the jade market - and 15-20 min to go to Mong Kok) and a good rate. The room was very nice, with a view overlooking the city, the park of Kowloon and part of HK island, so we could even enjoy the Symphony of Light from our room (ask the harbour parkview room). The only negative part would be that the walls are very thin (we could hear when the guest next door was leaving/coming back) and if you're a non-smoker, make sure you ask for the non-smoking floor (we would sometimes smell cigarette smoke). I would definitely go back there and will recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in HK. The staff was polite but not very friendly, but it did look like a very busy hotel (reception was always crowded). It is also the Scout center so it is quite funny to pass by tourists, businessmen and... young (and older) scouts in the hotel lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: chubbylim
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the hotel in July. The rate was great - less than 100 Canadian Dollars a night, even if the rooms were a little small. After all, it is Hong Kong and unless you are prepared to fork out USD300-500, chances are you will end up with smallish rooms. The rooms are well-equipped; there was enough storage area; the room and bathroom were clean. The hotel lobby is quite impressive. The best part of the hotel is its location. Convenient to restaurants, shopping, the ferry to HK and the subway, you cannot go wrong. Someone had commented a while ago that the hotel did not have a luggage storage room and anyone getting to the hotel before the check-in time would have to leave their luggage with the bell desk and the luggage would be left in the lobby. The situation has not changed, although for our 6 bags, they did tie them together. For the price and the quality, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: fattaileddunnart
Reviews.Content: We were travelling as two adults and a child. We found BP International Hotel an excellent place to stay. The hotel is very clean and well maintained and is in an excellent location. It is about one minutes walk from Nathan Road. We stayed on the 16th floor (there are around 25) and had very nice views out to the harbour. The only drawback we found was that the room was rather small. This was not a problem for us as we didn't really spend much time in there. Hotel rooms in HK are generally small unless you want to pay a lot more. I would happily stay here again and would recommned this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel exceeded my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: azyetphil
Reviews.Content: We were impressed by the modern and elegant design of this hotel -- from its lobby to its hotel rooms. Staff are friendly, helpful and accommodating. The hallways and the room itself looked and smelled clean and fresh unlike other 3-star hotels that we've stayed before. Location is also good -- with Kowloon park and Parklane blvd just beside it, and the Jordan MTR stn (which will take you to anywhere you want to go in HK) just a 3-min walk. We've had no problem with our stay except that we weren't able to charge our mobile phones as their outlets are different from the Europe and U.S. plugs (be sure to buy your adaptor!).. Other than that, overall experience was great. We will definitely recommend this hotel to our relatives and friends who will visit HK -- really GOOD value for your money.Ü

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, my 3rd time”
Reviews.Author: lingyaiBangkok
Reviews.Content: I always book this hotel or the Shamrock hotel. It is clean and a good location. 5min walk to Jordan subway station and 1 minute from kowloon park. Sometimes you can hear plumbing, ie people taking a shower in other rooms but not too noisy. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: terez_L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the quad sharing room in BP international, but the tricky part is, the quad sharing room isn't available in any website, so we got a local friend to book the hotel room for us, because it's so worth paying for it. don't expect a 5 star treatment, it's just a clean and equip room with 2 double decker beds. the location is great, just 5 mins walk to the jordan mrt station. you could also talk a walk towards the temple street, as well as the tsim tsa tsui area.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: MrsOX
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in a hotel with a view of the habour but for it not to cost the earth. The BP Internatioanl was an excellent choice, we had a great view of the park and habour and for a very reasonable price. The rooms were clean and of a good size for 2 people. The only disappointment we had was due to our flight times we arrived at 7am and were unable to check in until 2pm. The hotel did not have any showering facilites which is something I would have expected from a hotel of it's rating. The location was great, near all the markets and the underground station. An added bonus was the swimming pool in the park next door which was open until midnight so great for an evening dip. Overall, if you are looking for an average hotel in a good location with great views and value for money then the BP International is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied stay at BP Intl House”
Reviews.Author: Greenheights
Reviews.Content: My last stay in BP Intl House was last August 1999 was great. When I again visited Hongkong now with my family, i was surprised that there were big improvements in the hotel rooms, bathrooms/toilets, lobby, restaurant etc. Everything is clean and modern. Although rooms are little bit small. It's really a quiet (not on the main streets) and nice place to stay. Everything is near.. McDonalds, Restaurants, MTR station, shopping arcade, Kowloon Park, convenient stores.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value, good transport links on the door step”
Reviews.Author: Littlepete81
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights at the begining of May 2007. We booked via Expedia as it seemed to good value and quite a good location on Kowloon side of Hong Kong. The room sizes are fine by European and Hong Kong standards although Americans might want something bigger, but you`re only sleeping there and not spending all day in your room! The bathroom was a bit small, but the room was very clean. The whole hotel seemed new - I believe it was redecorated a few years ago. The staff were very helpful and spoke English and didn't mind us checking in several hours early after a long flight! The airconditioning in the room was quiet and efficient so you could get some sleep without something rattling away all night.. We stayed on the 20th floor (24 floors in total) which is the only non smoking floor. It also gives good views accross Kowloon Park or the harbour. Although we normally ate out, we did eat in the cafe for evening dinner at the end of our stay there and they have a round the world eat as much as you like buffet on offer- it seemed good value for about £12 (english pounds) and was very tasty. Opposite the hotel there is a 7 Eleven as well as another supermarket located 2 doors down (entrance via stairs down) There is a bakery a few doors up if you wanted a continental breakfast etc. There are restaurants all up and down Nathan Road, which is a 1 min walk from the hotel. It felt pretty safe round there even very late at night. Temple St Market is also a 7 min walk away. The subway is only 3mins walk from the hotel (Jordon stop). If you want to walk to the star ferry instead, it is a 15min walk through the lovely Kowloon park. Overall i would definately recommend this hotel if you want to stay on Kowloon side - remember the subway is only 3mins away so this might be a cheap alternative if you were on a budget and couldn't afford the Hong Kong Island side which is more expensive. Top hotel - I would stay here again with no qualms.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: raveman2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only 2 nights. For Hong Kong it is reasonably priced. The hotel was renovated 3 years ago and is very modern and nice. The rooms are small for American standards, but pretty good when comparing to New York. I found all staff quite helpful, bar was a tad expensive but when purchasing a drink had free internet. I did not eat here but restaurant seemed fine. I had good experiences only with the staff. Right near the central subway line and a walk through the park away from downtown. Good district to take in a Hong Kong experience. Will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Surprizingly big room with a nice view for low money”
Reviews.Author: HotplateOntario
Reviews.Content: Mike from Ontario Canada We stayed 2 nights in May /07 and booked through Expedia and were happy with the price we got especially for arriving on a holiday. We were also quite happy with the room . We requested a non smoking room on a upper floor and got a surprisingly big room on the 20’th floor with a good view.overlooking Kowloon Park. This hotel is in a good location for walking to grocery stores and restaurants. and the MTR However, we found the staff to be a bit unhelpful. For example I had asked at the tour desk some information about businesses in Hong Kong – the girl said she had no time and just handed me a phone book. Some other guests at the hotel had also commented to me about how the staff seems unfriendly. Overall I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: oatez
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife and 2 girls (10 & 13) opted for the family room 2 double bunks the room though small was very clean nice view of the HK skyline the matresses comfortable with a room safe and mini fridge. The staff were very helpful especially the tour desk took a day tour to China which was good value. Great location near the night market a park next door and close to Nathan rd and the subway. Will definetly go back there next time we are in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: El_Guapo44
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised. This hotel is in a good location (right next to Kowloon Park, and one of the night markets), and has several nice features for families. First, the price is good - about half of what I was able to get from the Marco Polo Prince. Granted, the location is not as good as the Hotels on the water, but that was not our main concern. The rooms were clean and big enough to accomodate our group. We took a couple of strolls to the park and our kids enjoyed the playsets, McDonalds, and the peaceful atmosphere. The hotel provided us a spare bed for our child at a nominal price. Much cheaper than getting another room or having our 3 year old sleep on the floor. The breakfasts were very good. At about $10 per person, there was plenty of good food and attentive staff. This set us up as we went to Beijing right after and were wishing we were back at the BP international. The tour desk lady was very nice and helpful. She set us up with a tour and answered all of our questions with a smile. This really makes a difference when you're working with people who are happy to be there - this was not the case at the hotel we stayed at in Beijing. The in house laundromat was very nice - this help us do some mid-vacation laundry which kept things going smoothly. Overall - good stay; not a 5 star, but nice, clean and with a good location. I'd recommend this to anyone and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: craigh
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights at the end of a month long trip. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived late morning but we accepted an offer of an upgrade if we could wait for an hour. We had coffee in the hotel's cafe before going to our room overlooking Hong Kong island - a lovely view, especially at night. The room was spacious, quiet, clean and with a good shower. The hotel is located close to Nathan Rd and the shops. It was a short walk to the nearest MRT station, and 10 mins to the waterfront. We bought an Octopus pass, which made using the metro, buses and ferries a breeze to use. We took advantage of the hotel's tasty and filling breakfasts each day, and booked several tours through its helpful tour desk. All in all, a great value hotel in a full-on city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Qldaussiegirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Arrived from Australia at about 5.30pm and caught the airport train and transferred to the free bus that dropped us at the front door of the hotel. We liked the location as it was near the Temple St markets and there was also Jordan station nearby. Also within walkind distance of the Star Ferry if you are in not too bad condition. Room was okay for the price and breakfast had a really good variety. Main complaint was the cigarette smoke that seemed to come in through the air con. I wouls stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: bloodbubble
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in BP International during our last trip to HK. I like the location - it's situated centrally in Tsim Sha Tsui area and Jordan MTR station is a few mins walk away. We walked to Yau Ma Tei and Mongkok from the hotel, about 25 mins away on foot. There are many tourist attractions and shopping areas around the hotel. The hotel lobby was impressive for a 3 star hotel - but our room was quite small. However, it was clean and the furnitures looked new. I think the hotel was renovated recently. Wasn't very impressed with the front desk staff though - they weren't very curteous and helpful when I needed help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Arriadne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at BP International House for 4 days. The hotel had shuttle service from the airport which was arranged by our travel agent. Very convenient! The hotel looks very new and clean. Our check-in was handled very efficiently, it took only a few minutes -- but this could be because the room was already fully paid beforehand. We requested for a non-smoking room and since there weren't any more available, we got an upgrade to the 24th floor with the harbour view at no extra charge! The room is very clean, looks newly renovated although a bit small. I'm very particular about bathrooms (I think hotel bathrooms are disgusting, in general) but I didn't have a problem with their bathroom which also looked newly renovated. They have glass walls instead of tiles so I know they're pretty clean. They also have complete toiletries for guests like toothbrushes, shower caps, slippers, toothpaste, shampoo, etc. They do have soap but it's in a dispenser. You might want to bring your own soap. The room is also very cold. We keep on turning the AC on and off because we couldn't get the right temperature. It was okay but it was colder in our room than outside -- but Hong Kong malls are also cold so I think they like their indoors cold. The concierge staff is also very accomodating although not that so in the middle of the night when we get back from shopping. They TRY but I could see they just want to go home. There is also a cranky male staff who is constantly checking on guests at the lobby. The hotel is walking distance to the Jordan station, to the Temple Street Night Market and to Harbour City. It was very convenient. I like this hotel. I'll consider staying here again. =)

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel !”
Reviews.Author: lalande
Reviews.Content: we stayed one week in BP hotel : it's excellent for price ! very clean, personnal very friendly, and breackfast delicious. There are all commodities, this hotel is near bus stop and MTR, 300 meters Jordan Station. it's near Temple street, and near all stores and interesting areas. If we come back to HK, we will return at BP. The rooms are a little small, but they are nice, and the view on Kowloon-park, and Hong-Kong island is absolutly fabulous .

Reviews.Title: “Slekk and shiny”
Reviews.Author: MattXIII
Reviews.Content: Grand lobby complete with 5 payphones. Staff speak enough english to get through a conversation and are very freindly even when you come back drenched and cascade water everywhere after enjoying a monsoon. Noodles and drink in your fridge, very handy after a 16hour flight. Basically attached to Kowloon park. Noisy and abit smelly, but hey thats Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for your money !”
Reviews.Author: pink_lady-7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over the Christmas / New Years (2007) period for 10 days. We had a very nice room on the 22nd floor with a lovely view of Hong Kong harbour. The room, while not overly spacious, was perfectly fine for the two of us. The daily housekeeping was excellent and the room and washroom were always spotless. The hotel is very close to Nathan Rd. and the harbour (easy walking to great shopping and eating). The subway is handy for easy travel into Hong Kong and the Star Ferry is an easy walk. There was a selection of 22 chanels on the television and there was also an in-room safe (a great convenience). We have stayed here previously and can recommend this hotel as a GREAT value for the money and everyone is so kind and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Makes Motel 6 look like a luxury resort”
Reviews.Author: Breitling888
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel are tiny. When first entering, you see a grand lobby, nice elevators, big hallways...........and then the room. I suppose that for the price paid, you should not expect too much more. The service is well below average. The desk staff was vey rude. When we asked for an extra key, we were told that hotel policy was one key per room. However, over half of our tour group had requested and received extra keys. It was only after pointing this out and arguing for 15 minutes that they finally relented. We had a number of other experiences with the rudeness of the staff over our two night stay which told us that the attitude was prevalent among most of the staff. The food was also terrible at this hotel. We had a buffet breakfast on the 2nd floor where the food was barely edible. After a few bites we were done. Dinner at the Chinese restaurant on the basement floor was also poor, but edible. The final straw was the cockroaches in the room. Upon waking up and turning on the light, I saw a couple of cockroaches scatter off the bed. I had to empty and repack my luggage to make sure that I did not have extra travelers with me. I brought this problem to the attention of the hotel staff upon checkout and there was no apology or promise of action. I would never stay in this hotel again. Very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Urban_Adventurer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in early September 2006 for one week. It is in a great location (near the subway, beside a park, and near lots of shops and restaurants). The thing I liked most about this hotel was the great location and view. My boyfriend and I stayed in a room that faced Kowloon Park. You get a great view of the Hong Kong harbour and all the lights in the evening. I used the park in the mornings to go for runs, which was convenient because access to green space is limited in HK. The staff were accommodating when I requested a quiet room that faced the park. Being vegetarians, this hotel was also in close proximity to about 10 different vegetarian chinese restaurants, which was really great. The hotel is only about a 3 minute walk to the nearest MTR subway station (Jordan). In regards to the interiors, the hotel is fairly new and the rooms look clean and modern. The only thing that visitors should be prepared for is hundreds of boyscouts and girlguides that use the hotel as a dormitory. But you only see them in the lobby, so it wasn't a problem. I'd definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “shoebox”
Reviews.Author: KSI
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on my first night for an eight day business trip to Mainland. Reason for staying here was that my trip was a last minute trip, and all of my regular hotels were booked. This was apparantly the only room in town. My rate was $1400 HKD/night. Requested non smoking room and was given a room with 2 twin beds. I am 6' 4" tall, so I ask to switch, and was refused as it was the last room in the hotel. Room was nicely decorated and very clean. After settling in my room, I then tried to access the internet/email from my room, and was told that there was no wireless on non smoking floor, although they did have broadband access in all rooms. Unfortunately, I did not have a cable, so I checked with reception and was told that they were all out. When I asked what I should do, I was told to go to Mongkok to buy a cable. TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. I did venture out on the streets, and found a cable. When I did get onto the broadband, it was slower than dial up. I could not even access some websites. Needless to stay, I wil never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “BP International”
Reviews.Author: C18LUM
Reviews.Content: Good location, about 20min walk from Avenue of the Stars and Star Ferry. Staff were efficient but not too friendly. Rooms and hotel in general were what you would expect from a 3 star hotel. Bed was quite hard with the pillows being a total contrast. It was like they were blown up with air. This didn't cause me a problem but for those who are a bit more 'picky' over there bed it might.

Reviews.Title: “Good, affordable place for a group”
Reviews.Author: Flames89
Reviews.Content: I stayed here June of 2006 for one week with 3 other friends and was plesently surprised. We were hesistant at first as our taxi driver called the place "garbage" and criticized it for having bunk beds (since there were four of us, our room consisted of 2 bunks...this was also a popular hotel for boy scouts). Once we got there we also ran into a problem as they could not find our reservation that we booked online through a website (this turned out to be more so the websites fault not the hotel). Luckily they had room for us for the entire week and we got an excellent rate for 4 people (About 250 canadian each for the entire week!). The room turned out to be great too. Quite cramped however, but what did you expect for the price and with four 20-somthing guys. The bathroom was very clean and the shower was amazing. Room even had a safe and good TV.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and a great location”
Reviews.Author: downundergal2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights as a stopover from Europe to Australia and were really happy with this hotel. The excellent service started before we even stepped inside as we arrived in the middle of the worst thunderstorm in 40 years so the bus driver rang the hotel to make sure a porter came out with an umbrella to meet us. Our checkin was very professional and courteous. We travelled on a Corporate package and were allocated a harbour view room on the 24th floor, not much to see on arrival but the view was magnificent especially at night when the clouds finally lifted. We had no trouble with noise & hardly saw any scouts as they have a separate bank of lifts and are only allocated between between certain floors on the lower levels. The room was spacious enough for the 2 of us, clean, modern and comfortable. Muted colours, comfortable bed, fluffy pillows and ducted airconditioning. The bathroom was small but clean and the shower pressure wonderful. As space is at a premium I thought the concealed space in the desktop for the hairdryer with a mirror on the lid was ingenious. The tea & coffee making facilities, fruit basket on arrival & an English newspaper each morning all nice touches. Breakfast was a Asian/English buffet with a cook standing by for any requests. Two free internet terminals from 3pm in the bar were handy to check emails especially during happy hour. The location is terrific - straight out the door into the Temple Street Markets, Jordon station around the corner and a short stroll down to the harbour either via the shopping street or through the park which is a really interesting stroll & a great way to see some daily life in action.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless nights”
Reviews.Author: Gorgota
Reviews.Content: The guest room, although small, was very clean and modern. It was very difficult for me to rest well in my room due to several reasons. First, there were a lot of children running and playing along the corridor. Second, there were a few guests who spoke very loudly for a very long time early in the morning and late at night, including weekends. Third, some guests were smoking and as the windows could not be opened, I had to sleep with the smoke the whole nights and felt terrible in the morning. Fourth, one guest actually knocked on my door at 8 am on a Sunday for no reason at all. Some others knocked on the door of their friends/family for a considerable period of time. Fifth, the mattress and pillows were awful. Six, you could hear TV noise and conversation from the room next door. The buffet was disappointing. The hotel itself is actually fine. But don't think I would stay here again. Too much noise and smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: reviewit24u
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as part of a leisure trip and were impressed with the quality of the hotel. The rooms are very tiny, but all of them are above the 16th floor and have nice views of the city and its busy streets. Our room had two very small single beds (this was considered a double room) and the bathroom was also very small and had only a shower, no tub. They supplied basic amenities - toothbrush and toothpaste, comb, and shampoo, but no soap. Each morning they serve a buffet breakfast with both Western/Eastern foods and drinks. The hotel is within walking distance of almost everything - Nathan St. and Canton St. shops, Temple Street market, the waterfront/Star Ferry and skyline, and the closest subway is Jordan station, just 5 minutes walk. The hotel borders the Kowloon Park, a very impressive open space. The staff of the hotel speak English and are very happy to help with questions. Also, this hotel is served by tour companies and is not out of the way. The lobby is very impressive and spacious. MAJOR DOWNSIDE: 2 Internet computers for the entire hotel, and they can only be used from like 3pm to 8pm daily and not on weekends. Not recommended for business travelers because of this.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Pillow Lace
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in Hong Kong as a stopover on route to Australia.The Hotel looked ok from the the outside, but the room left a lot to be desired. The bed was clean which was a bonus. I would not use the BP International again.

Reviews.Title: “BP International INDEED”
Reviews.Author: dreamy_traveler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at BP International. My husband and I decided to go to Hongkong for our 1st year anniversary. We don't plan a very grand vacation though. We were on a budget and BP Int'l happens to be the cheapest in the list that our travel agent gave us. We were really expecting a very ordinary room but the lobby just caught us in awe! Receptionist was very polite although no bus boy helped us bring our luggages to our room, which is really not a big deal coz we could roll our trolleys anyway. We stayed at the 14th floor and the room given to us was quite small but it didn't matter because it feels cozy and is very very clean. The bathroom was also very cute. Small but very modern. The hotel is also strategically located. It's near the MRT and the night market. Only a few steps away to Nathan Rd. It even has a park at the back where you could stroll. Hotel is definetly of good value!

Reviews.Title: “Not for the faint hearted”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a family of four we book a family suite. This was very small, consisting of 4 bunk beds on the 14th floor. The room was clean but I felt that having the bunk beds so close to the window was quite unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: ianallen64
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two children (15 and 11) for 5 nights as part of a round the world trip in January. We booked it after reading Lonely Planet and being offered a 40% discount for an early booking. At the time, knowing that it was bunk beds we had some reservations, but went for it because of the central location and the price (we thought we might be getting low on funds by that stage of our trip). We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived late at night by bus direct from the airport. The lobby is new and looks great (4 star standard), and the room, although small, was modern and comfortable. Staff were helpful, and the buffet breakfasts are large and good value. The hotel is very well located near the Temple Street Market, harbour, and metro (Jordan station). Outside the hotel there is a bus stop for a shuttle bus to Kowloon station (for easy access to Lantau Island, including Disneyland). We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel, and would recommend it to anyone (especially for families who want something central and comfortable that won't cost a fortune).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base in Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: efc
Reviews.Content: The airport express shuttle bus stops at the hotel so it is very easy to get to the hotel from the airport. My wife and I arrived early (around 10am) but we were able to check in after an hour. The staff were very friendly and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at an excellent price”
Reviews.Author: Wrinkly one
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 11 nights over Christmas and had a fantastic time. We were upgraded to the 22nd floor and the room was spotlessly clean with a great shower. We also had a kettle, a television and a fridge in the room. The beds were firm but not too hard. There is a shoe shine machine and a free cold water dispenser on the landing. The hotel is tremendous value-we paid £37.70 for the room per night and the location is excellent, being a 2 minute walk to Nathan Road and the M.T.R. (subway) We didn't eat at the hotel as there are so many restaurants to choose from in that area. Temple Street night market and the Jade Market are both close buy. The 973 bus from outside the Government offices on Canton Road (turn left out of the hotel and cross over using the underpass) goes all the way to Stanley Market, going through Aberdeen and Repulse Bay on the way and takes about 45 minutes to 1 hour.

Reviews.Title: “Not too Bad!”
Reviews.Author: GMSCalgary
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a good location for our shopping trip to Hong Kong. Right off Nathan Road on the Kowloon side, and within walking distance of the night and jade markets, we enjoyed the location. Walking through the adjacent park every morning was fun, and the view from the 20th floor was not to be missed. My one objection - the beds were so hard that for the 5 nights that we stayed we did not get one good night's sleep. If you do not appreciate concrete hard mattresses do, not stay here. They were beyond hard.

Reviews.Title: “No problems at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: fox01
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel the staff were friendly and helpful(they must have read some of the early reviews). The room(21st floor) had a great view across Kowloon park to Hong Kong Island. The bar had two internet machines free of charge which my wife used to email family and friends. We can not comment on the food in the hotel as we ate out during our stays.The location is quite good for transport(mtr/buses) to the other tourist areas of hong kong,the area around the hotel has lots of eating places, the night market at temple street is a short walk away. Just around the corner was Nathan Road for any other shopping you needed to do. We used the hotel as a base as we also visited beijing and taipei. It is close to the airport express station in Kowloon by taxis or free bus, also had a direct bus service to the airport. When we travelled to Beijing and Taipei we left most of our luggage in storage at the hotel(free of charge)We would stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: B P International
HotelInfo.Address: No.8 Austin Road, Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon, Hong Kong, China
